Bible.Verse: 25 For he commandeth, and raiseth the stormy wind, which lifteth up the waves thereof.

Bible.Title: Psalms 107:
Bible.Verse: 26 They mount up to the heaven, they go down again to the depths: their soul is melted because of trouble.

Bible.Title: Psalms 107:
Bible.Verse: 27 They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man, and are at their wit's end.

Bible.Title: Psalms 107:
Bible.Verse: 28 Then they cry unto the LORD in their trouble, and he bringeth them out of their distresses.

Bible.Title: Psalms 107:
Bible.Verse: 29 He maketh the storm a calm, so that the waves thereof are still.

Bible.Title: Psalms 107:
Bible.Verse: 30 Then are they glad because they be quiet; so he bringeth them unto their desired haven.

Bible.Title: Psalms 107:
Bible.Verse: 31 Oh that men would praise the LORD for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!

Bible.Title: Psalms 107:
Bible.Verse: 32 Let them exalt him also in the congregation of the people, and praise him in the assembly of the elders.

Bible.Title: Psalms 107:
Bible.Verse: 33 He turneth rivers into a wilderness, and the watersprings into dry ground;

Bible.Title: Psalms 107:
Bible.Verse: 34 A fruitful land into barrenness, for the wickedness of them that dwell therein.

Bible.Title: Psalms 107:
Bible.Verse: 35 He turneth the wilderness into a standing water, and dry ground into watersprings.

Bible.Title: Psalms 107:
Bible.Verse: 36 And there he maketh the hungry to dwell, that they may prepare a city for habitation;

Bible.Title: Psalms 107:
Bible.Verse: 37 And sow the fields, and plant vineyards, which may yield fruits of increase.

Bible.Title: Psalms 107:
Bible.Verse: 38 He blesseth them also, so that they are multiplied greatly; and suffereth not their cattle to decrease.

Bible.Title: Psalms 107:
Bible.Verse: 39 Again, they are minished and brought low through oppression, affliction, and sorrow.

Bible.Title: Psalms 107:
Bible.Verse: 40 He poureth contempt upon princes, and causeth them to wander in the wilderness, where there is no way.

Bible.Title: Psalms 107:
Bible.Verse: 41 Yet setteth he the poor on high from affliction, and maketh him families like a flock.

Bible.Title: Psalms 107:
Bible.Verse: 42 The righteous shall see it, and rejoice: and all iniquity shall stop her mouth.

Bible.Title: Psalms 107:
Bible.Verse: 43 Whoso is wise, and will observe these things, even they shall understand the lovingkindness of the LORD.

Bible.Title: Psalms 108:
Bible.Verse: 1 O God, my heart is fixed; I will sing and give praise, even with my glory.

Bible.Title: Psalms 108:
Bible.Verse: 2 Awake, psaltery and harp: I myself will awake early.

Bible.Title: Psalms 108:
Bible.Verse: 3 I will praise thee, O LORD, among the people: and I will sing praises unto thee among the nations.

Bible.Title: Psalms 108:
Bible.Verse: 4 For thy mercy is great above the heavens: and thy truth reacheth unto the clouds.

Bible.Title: Psalms 108:
Bible.Verse: 5 Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens: and thy glory above all the earth;

Bible.Title: Psalms 108:
Bible.Verse: 6 That thy beloved may be delivered: save with thy right hand, and answer me.

Bible.Title: Psalms 108:
Bible.Verse: 7 God hath spoken in his holiness; I will rejoice, I will divide Shechem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.

Bible.Title: Psalms 108:
Bible.Verse: 8 Gilead is mine; Manasseh is mine; Ephraim also is the strength of mine head; Judah is my lawgiver;

Bible.Title: Psalms 108:
Bible.Verse: 9 Moab is my washpot; over Edom will I cast out my shoe; over Philistia will I triumph.

Bible.Title: Psalms 108:
Bible.Verse: 10 Who will bring me into the strong city? who will lead me into Edom?

Bible.Title: Psalms 108:
Bible.Verse: 11 Wilt not thou, O God, who hast cast us off? and wilt not thou, O God, go forth with our hosts?

Bible.Title: Psalms 108:
Bible.Verse: 12 Give us help from trouble: for vain is the help of man.

Bible.Title: Psalms 108:
Bible.Verse: 13 Through God we shall do valiantly: for he it is that shall tread down our enemies.

Bible.Title: Psalms 109:
Bible.Verse: 1 Hold not thy peace, O God of my praise;

Bible.Title: Psalms 109:
Bible.Verse: 2 For the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful are opened against me: they have spoken against me with a lying tongue.

Bible.Title: Psalms 109:
Bible.Verse: 3 They compassed me about also with words of hatred; and fought against me without a cause.

Bible.Title: Psalms 109:
Bible.Verse: 4 For my love they are my adversaries: but I give myself unto prayer.

Bible.Title: Psalms 109:
Bible.Verse: 5 And they have rewarded me evil for good, and hatred for my love.

Bible.Title: Psalms 109:
Bible.Verse: 6 Set thou a wicked man over him: and let Satan stand at his right hand.

Bible.Title: Psalms 109:
Bible.Verse: 7 When he shall be judged, let him be condemned: and let his prayer become sin.

Bible.Title: Psalms 109:
Bible.Verse: 8 Let his days be few; and let another take his office.

Bible.Title: Psalms 109:
Bible.Verse: 9 Let his children be fatherless, and his wife a widow.

Bible.Title: Psalms 109:
Bible.Verse: 10 Let his children be continually vagabonds, and beg: let them seek their bread also out of their desolate places.

Bible.Title: Psalms 109:
Bible.Verse: 11 Let the extortioner catch all that he hath; and let the strangers spoil his labour.

Bible.Title: Psalms 109:
Bible.Verse: 12 Let there be none to extend mercy unto him: neither let there be any to favour his fatherless children.

Bible.Title: Psalms 109:
Bible.Verse: 13 Let his posterity be cut off; and in the generation following let their name be blotted out.

Bible.Title: Psalms 109:
Bible.Verse: 14 Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered with the LORD; and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.

Bible.Title: Psalms 109:
Bible.Verse: 15 Let them be before the LORD continually, that he may cut off the memory of them from the earth.

Bible.Title: Psalms 109:
Bible.Verse: 16 Because that he remembered not to shew mercy, but persecuted the poor and needy man, that he might even slay the broken in heart.

Bible.Title: Psalms 109:
Bible.Verse: 17 As he loved cursing, so let it come unto him: as he delighted not in blessing, so let it be far from him.

Bible.Title: Psalms 109:
Bible.Verse: 18 As he clothed himself with cursing like as with his garment, so let it come into his bowels like water, and like oil into his bones.

Bible.Title: Psalms 109:
Bible.Verse: 19 Let it be unto him as the garment which covereth him, and for a girdle wherewith he is girded continually.

Bible.Title: Psalms 109:
Bible.Verse: 20 Let this be the reward of mine adversaries from the LORD, and of them that speak evil against my soul.

Bible.Title: Psalms 109:
Bible.Verse: 21 But do thou for me, O GOD the Lord, for thy name's sake: because thy mercy is good, deliver thou me.

Bible.Title: Psalms 109:
Bible.Verse: 22 For I am poor and needy, and my heart is wounded within me.

Bible.Title: Psalms 109:
Bible.Verse: 23 I am gone like the shadow when it declineth: I am tossed up and down as the locust.

Bible.Title: Psalms 109:
Bible.Verse: 24 My knees are weak through fasting; and my flesh faileth of fatness.

Bible.Title: Psalms 109:
Bible.Verse: 25 I became also a reproach unto them: when they looked upon me they shaked their heads.

Bible.Title: Psalms 109:
Bible.Verse: 26 Help me, O LORD my God: O save me according to thy mercy:

Bible.Title: Psalms 109:
Bible.Verse: 27 That they may know that this is thy hand; that thou, LORD, hast done it.

Bible.Title: Psalms 109:
Bible.Verse: 28 Let them curse, but bless thou: when they arise, let them be ashamed; but let thy servant rejoice.

Bible.Title: Psalms 109:
Bible.Verse: 29 Let mine adversaries be clothed with shame, and let them cover themselves with their own confusion, as with a mantle.

Bible.Title: Psalms 109:
Bible.Verse: 30 I will greatly praise the LORD with my mouth; yea, I will praise him among the multitude.

Bible.Title: Psalms 109:
Bible.Verse: 31 For he shall stand at the right hand of the poor, to save him from those that condemn his soul.

Bible.Title: Psalms 110:
Bible.Verse: 1 The LORD said unto my Lord, Sit thou at my right hand, until I make thine enemies thy footstool.

Bible.Title: Psalms 110:
Bible.Verse: 2 The LORD shall send the rod of thy strength out of Zion: rule thou in the midst of thine enemies.

Bible.Title: Psalms 110:
Bible.Verse: 3 Thy people shall be willing in the day of thy power, in the beauties of holiness from the womb of the morning: thou hast the dew of thy youth.

Bible.Title: Psalms 110:
Bible.Verse: 4 The LORD hath sworn, and will not repent, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek.

Bible.Title: Psalms 110:
Bible.Verse: 5 The Lord at thy right hand shall strike through kings in the day of his wrath.

Bible.Title: Psalms 110:
Bible.Verse: 6 He shall judge among the heathen, he shall fill the places with the dead bodies; he shall wound the heads over many countries.

Bible.Title: Psalms 110:
Bible.Verse: 7 He shall drink of the brook in the way: therefore shall he lift up the head.

Bible.Title: Psalms 111:
Bible.Verse: 1 Praise ye the LORD. I will praise the LORD with my whole heart, in the assembly of the upright, and in the congregation.

Bible.Title: Psalms 111:
Bible.Verse: 2 The works of the LORD are great, sought out of all them that have pleasure therein.

Bible.Title: Psalms 111:
Bible.Verse: 3 His work is honourable and glorious: and his righteousness endureth for ever.

Bible.Title: Psalms 111:
Bible.Verse: 4 He hath made his wonderful works to be remembered: the LORD is gracious and full of compassion.

Bible.Title: Psalms 111:
Bible.Verse: 5 He hath given meat unto them that fear him: he will ever be mindful of his covenant.

Bible.Title: Psalms 111:
Bible.Verse: 6 He hath shewed his people the power of his works, that he may give them the heritage of the heathen.

Bible.Title: Psalms 111:
Bible.Verse: 7 The works of his hands are verity and judgment; all his commandments are sure.

Bible.Title: Psalms 111:
Bible.Verse: 8 They stand fast for ever and ever, and are done in truth and uprightness.

Bible.Title: Psalms 111:
Bible.Verse: 9 He sent redemption unto his people: he hath commanded his covenant for ever: holy and reverend is his name.

Bible.Title: Psalms 111:
Bible.Verse: 10 The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom: a good understanding have all they that do his commandments: his praise endureth for ever.

Bible.Title: Psalms 112:
Bible.Verse: 1 Praise ye the LORD. Blessed is the man that feareth the LORD, that delighteth greatly in his commandments.

Bible.Title: Psalms 112:
Bible.Verse: 2 His seed shall be mighty upon earth: the generation of the upright shall be blessed.

Bible.Title: Psalms 112:
Bible.Verse: 3 Wealth and riches shall be in his house: and his righteousness endureth for ever.

Bible.Title: Psalms 112:
Bible.Verse: 4 Unto the upright there ariseth light in the darkness: he is gracious, and full of compassion, and righteous.

Bible.Title: Psalms 112:
Bible.Verse: 5 A good man sheweth favour, and lendeth: he will guide his affairs with discretion.

Bible.Title: Psalms 112:
Bible.Verse: 6 Surely he shall not be moved for ever: the righteous shall be in everlasting remembrance.

Bible.Title: Psalms 112:
Bible.Verse: 7 He shall not be afraid of evil tidings: his heart is fixed, trusting in the LORD.

Bible.Title: Psalms 112:
Bible.Verse: 8 His heart is established, he shall not be afraid, until he see his desire upon his enemies.

Bible.Title: Psalms 112:
Bible.Verse: 9 He hath dispersed, he hath given to the poor; his righteousness endureth for ever; his horn shall be exalted with honour.

Bible.Title: Psalms 112:
Bible.Verse: 10 The wicked shall see it, and be grieved; he shall gnash with his teeth, and melt away: the desire of the wicked shall perish.

Bible.Title: Psalms 113:
Bible.Verse: 1 Praise ye the LORD. Praise, O ye servants of the LORD, praise the name of the LORD.

Bible.Title: Psalms 113:
Bible.Verse: 2 Blessed be the name of the LORD from this time forth and for evermore.

Bible.Title: Psalms 113:
Bible.Verse: 3 From the rising of the sun unto the going down of the same the LORD's name is to be praised.

Bible.Title: Psalms 113:
Bible.Verse: 4 The LORD is high above all nations, and his glory above the heavens.

Bible.Title: Psalms 113:
Bible.Verse: 5 Who is like unto the LORD our God, who dwelleth on high,

Bible.Title: Psalms 113:
Bible.Verse: 6 Who humbleth himself to behold the things that are in heaven, and in the earth!

Bible.Title: Psalms 113:
Bible.Verse: 7 He raiseth up the poor out of the dust, and lifteth the needy out of the dunghill;

Bible.Title: Psalms 113:
Bible.Verse: 8 That he may set him with princes, even with the princes of his people.

Bible.Title: Psalms 113:
Bible.Verse: 9 He maketh the barren woman to keep house, and to be a joyful mother of children. Praise ye the LORD.

Bible.Title: Psalms 114:
Bible.Verse: 1 When Israel went out of Egypt, the house of Jacob from a people of strange language;

Bible.Title: Psalms 114:
Bible.Verse: 2 Judah was his sanctuary, and Israel his dominion.

Bible.Title: Psalms 114:
Bible.Verse: 3 The sea saw it, and fled: Jordan was driven back.

Bible.Title: Psalms 114:
Bible.Verse: 4 The mountains skipped like rams, and the little hills like lambs.

Bible.Title: Psalms 114:
Bible.Verse: 5 What ailed thee, O thou sea, that thou fleddest? thou Jordan, that thou wast driven back?

Bible.Title: Psalms 114:
Bible.Verse: 6 Ye mountains, that ye skipped like rams; and ye little hills, like lambs?

Bible.Title: Psalms 114:
Bible.Verse: 7 Tremble, thou earth, at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the God of Jacob;

Bible.Title: Psalms 114:
Bible.Verse: 8 Which turned the rock into a standing water, the flint into a fountain of waters.

Bible.Title: Psalms 115:
Bible.Verse: 1 Not unto us, O LORD, not unto us, but unto thy name give glory, for thy mercy, and for thy truth's sake.

Bible.Title: Psalms 115:
Bible.Verse: 2 Wherefore should the heathen say, Where is now their God?

Bible.Title: Psalms 115:
Bible.Verse: 3 But our God is in the heavens: he hath done whatsoever he hath pleased.

Bible.Title: Psalms 115:
Bible.Verse: 4 Their idols are silver and gold, the work of men's hands.

Bible.Title: Psalms 115:
Bible.Verse: 5 They have mouths, but they speak not: eyes have they, but they see not:

Bible.Title: Psalms 115:
Bible.Verse: 6 They have ears, but they hear not: noses have they, but they smell not:

Bible.Title: Psalms 115:
Bible.Verse: 7 They have hands, but they handle not: feet have they, but they walk not: neither speak they through their throat.

Bible.Title: Psalms 115:
Bible.Verse: 8 They that make them are like unto them; so is every one that trusteth in them.

Bible.Title: Psalms 115:
Bible.Verse: 9 O Israel, trust thou in the LORD: he is their help and their shield.

Bible.Title: Psalms 115:
Bible.Verse: 10 O house of Aaron, trust in the LORD: he is their help and their shield.

Bible.Title: Psalms 115:
Bible.Verse: 11 Ye that fear the LORD, trust in the LORD: he is their help and their shield.

Bible.Title: Psalms 115:
Bible.Verse: 12 The LORD hath been mindful of us: he will bless us; he will bless the house of Israel; he will bless the house of Aaron.

Bible.Title: Psalms 115:
Bible.Verse: 13 He will bless them that fear the LORD, both small and great.

Bible.Title: Psalms 115:
Bible.Verse: 14 The LORD shall increase you more and more, you and your children.

Bible.Title: Psalms 115:
Bible.Verse: 15 Ye are blessed of the LORD which made heaven and earth.

Bible.Title: Psalms 115:
Bible.Verse: 16 The heaven, even the heavens, are the LORD's: but the earth hath he given to the children of men.

Bible.Title: Psalms 115:
Bible.Verse: 17 The dead praise not the LORD, neither any that go down into silence.

Bible.Title: Psalms 115:
Bible.Verse: 18 But we will bless the LORD from this time forth and for evermore. Praise the LORD.

Bible.Title: Psalms 116:
Bible.Verse: 1 I love the LORD, because he hath heard my voice and my supplications.

Bible.Title: Psalms 116:
Bible.Verse: 2 Because he hath inclined his ear unto me, therefore will I call upon him as long as I live.

Bible.Title: Psalms 116:
Bible.Verse: 3 The sorrows of death compassed me, and the pains of hell gat hold upon me: I found trouble and sorrow.

Bible.Title: Psalms 116:
Bible.Verse: 4 Then called I upon the name of the LORD; O LORD, I beseech thee, deliver my soul.

Bible.Title: Psalms 116:
Bible.Verse: 5 Gracious is the LORD, and righteous; yea, our God is merciful.

Bible.Title: Psalms 116:
Bible.Verse: 6 The LORD preserveth the simple: I was brought low, and he helped me.

Bible.Title: Psalms 116:
Bible.Verse: 7 Return unto thy rest, O my soul; for the LORD hath dealt bountifully with thee.

Bible.Title: Psalms 116:
Bible.Verse: 8 For thou hast delivered my soul from death, mine eyes from tears, and my feet from falling.

Bible.Title: Psalms 116:
Bible.Verse: 9 I will walk before the LORD in the land of the living.

Bible.Title: Psalms 116:
Bible.Verse: 10 I believed, therefore have I spoken: I was greatly afflicted:

Bible.Title: Psalms 116:
Bible.Verse: 11 I said in my haste, All men are liars.

Bible.Title: Psalms 116:
Bible.Verse: 12 What shall I render unto the LORD for all his benefits toward me?

Bible.Title: Psalms 116:
Bible.Verse: 13 I will take the cup of salvation, and call upon the name of the LORD.

Bible.Title: Psalms 116:
Bible.Verse: 14 I will pay my vows unto the LORD now in the presence of all his people.

Bible.Title: Psalms 116:
Bible.Verse: 15 Precious in the sight of the LORD is the death of his saints.

Bible.Title: Psalms 116:
Bible.Verse: 16 O LORD, truly I am thy servant; I am thy servant, and the son of thine handmaid: thou hast loosed my bonds.

Bible.Title: Psalms 116:
Bible.Verse: 17 I will offer to thee the sacrifice of thanksgiving, and will call upon the name of the LORD.

Bible.Title: Psalms 116:
Bible.Verse: 18 I will pay my vows unto the LORD now in the presence of all his people,

Bible.Title: Psalms 116:
Bible.Verse: 19 In the courts of the LORD's house, in the midst of thee, O Jerusalem. Praise ye the LORD.

Bible.Title: Psalms 117:
Bible.Verse: 1 O Praise the LORD, all ye nations: praise him, all ye people.

Bible.Title: Psalms 117:
Bible.Verse: 2 For his merciful kindness is great toward us: and the truth of the LORD endureth for ever. Praise ye the LORD.

Bible.Title: Psalms 118:
Bible.Verse: 1 O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is good: because his mercy endureth for ever.

Bible.Title: Psalms 118:
Bible.Verse: 2 Let Israel now say, that his mercy endureth for ever.

Bible.Title: Psalms 118:
Bible.Verse: 3 Let the house of Aaron now say, that his mercy endureth for ever.

Bible.Title: Psalms 118:
Bible.Verse: 4 Let them now that fear the LORD say, that his mercy endureth for ever.

Bible.Title: Psalms 118:
Bible.Verse: 5 I called upon the LORD in distress: the LORD answered me, and set me in a large place.

Bible.Title: Psalms 118:
Bible.Verse: 6 The LORD is on my side; I will not fear: what can man do unto me?

Bible.Title: Psalms 118:
Bible.Verse: 7 The LORD taketh my part with them that help me: therefore shall I see my desire upon them that hate me.

Bible.Title: Psalms 118:
Bible.Verse: 8 It is better to trust in the LORD than to put confidence in man.

Bible.Title: Psalms 118:
Bible.Verse: 9 It is better to trust in the LORD than to put confidence in princes.

Bible.Title: Psalms 118:
Bible.Verse: 10 All nations compassed me about: but in the name of the LORD will I destroy them.

Bible.Title: Psalms 118:
Bible.Verse: 11 They compassed me about; yea, they compassed me about: but in the name of the LORD I will destroy them.

Bible.Title: Psalms 118:
Bible.Verse: 12 They compassed me about like bees; they are quenched as the fire of thorns: for in the name of the LORD I will destroy them.

Bible.Title: Psalms 118:
Bible.Verse: 13 Thou hast thrust sore at me that I might fall: but the LORD helped me.

Bible.Title: Psalms 118:
Bible.Verse: 14 The LORD is my strength and song, and is become my salvation.

Bible.Title: Psalms 118:
Bible.Verse: 15 The voice of rejoicing and salvation is in the tabernacles of the righteous: the right hand of the LORD doeth valiantly.

Bible.Title: Psalms 118:
Bible.Verse: 16 The right hand of the LORD is exalted: the right hand of the LORD doeth valiantly.

Bible.Title: Psalms 118:
Bible.Verse: 17 I shall not die, but live, and declare the works of the LORD.

Bible.Title: Psalms 118:
Bible.Verse: 18 The LORD hath chastened me sore: but he hath not given me over unto death.

Bible.Title: Psalms 118:
Bible.Verse: 19 Open to me the gates of righteousness: I will go into them, and I will praise the LORD:

Bible.Title: Psalms 118:
Bible.Verse: 20 This gate of the LORD, into which the righteous shall enter.

Bible.Title: Psalms 118:
Bible.Verse: 21 I will praise thee: for thou hast heard me, and art become my salvation.

Bible.Title: Psalms 118:
Bible.Verse: 22 The stone which the builders refused is become the head stone of the corner.

Bible.Title: Psalms 118:
Bible.Verse: 23 This is the LORD's doing; it is marvellous in our eyes.

Bible.Title: Psalms 118:
Bible.Verse: 24 This is the day which the LORD hath made; we will rejoice and be glad in it.

Bible.Title: Psalms 118:
Bible.Verse: 25 Save now, I beseech thee, O LORD: O LORD, I beseech thee, send now prosperity.

Bible.Title: Psalms 118:
Bible.Verse: 26 Blessed be he that cometh in the name of the LORD: we have blessed you out of the house of the LORD.

Bible.Title: Psalms 118:
Bible.Verse: 27 God is the LORD, which hath shewed us light: bind the sacrifice with cords, even unto the horns of the altar.

Bible.Title: Psalms 118:
Bible.Verse: 28 Thou art my God, and I will praise thee: thou art my God, I will exalt thee.

Bible.Title: Psalms 118:
Bible.Verse: 29 O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 1 Blessed are the undefiled in the way, who walk in the law of the LORD.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 2 Blessed are they that keep his testimonies, and that seek him with the whole heart.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 3 They also do no iniquity: they walk in his ways.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 4 Thou hast commanded us to keep thy precepts diligently.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 5 O that my ways were directed to keep thy statutes!

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 6 Then shall I not be ashamed, when I have respect unto all thy commandments.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 7 I will praise thee with uprightness of heart, when I shall have learned thy righteous judgments.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 8 I will keep thy statutes: O forsake me not utterly.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 9 Wherewithal shall a young man cleanse his way? by taking heed thereto according to thy word.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 10 With my whole heart have I sought thee: O let me not wander from thy commandments.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 11 Thy word have I hid in mine heart, that I might not sin against thee.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 12 Blessed art thou, O LORD: teach me thy statutes.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 13 With my lips have I declared all the judgments of thy mouth.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 14 I have rejoiced in the way of thy testimonies, as much as in all riches.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 15 I will meditate in thy precepts, and have respect unto thy ways.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 16 I will delight myself in thy statutes: I will not forget thy word.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 17 Deal bountifully with thy servant, that I may live, and keep thy word.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 18 Open thou mine eyes, that I may behold wondrous things out of thy law.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 19 I am a stranger in the earth: hide not thy commandments from me.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 20 My soul breaketh for the longing that it hath unto thy judgments at all times.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 21 Thou hast rebuked the proud that are cursed, which do err from thy commandments.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 22 Remove from me reproach and contempt; for I have kept thy testimonies.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 23 Princes also did sit and speak against me: but thy servant did meditate in thy statutes.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 24 Thy testimonies also are my delight and my counsellors.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 25 My soul cleaveth unto the dust: quicken thou me according to thy word.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 26 I have declared my ways, and thou heardest me: teach me thy statutes.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 27 Make me to understand the way of thy precepts: so shall I talk of thy wondrous works.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 28 My soul melteth for heaviness: strengthen thou me according unto thy word.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 29 Remove from me the way of lying: and grant me thy law graciously.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 30 I have chosen the way of truth: thy judgments have I laid before me.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 31 I have stuck unto thy testimonies: O LORD, put me not to shame.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 32 I will run the way of thy commandments, when thou shalt enlarge my heart.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 33 Teach me, O LORD, the way of thy statutes; and I shall keep it unto the end.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 34 Give me understanding, and I shall keep thy law; yea, I shall observe it with my whole heart.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 35 Make me to go in the path of thy commandments; for therein do I delight.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 36 Incline my heart unto thy testimonies, and not to covetousness.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 37 Turn away mine eyes from beholding vanity; and quicken thou me in thy way.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 38 Stablish thy word unto thy servant, who is devoted to thy fear.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 39 Turn away my reproach which I fear: for thy judgments are good.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 40 Behold, I have longed after thy precepts: quicken me in thy righteousness.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 41 Let thy mercies come also unto me, O LORD, even thy salvation, according to thy word.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 42 So shall I have wherewith to answer him that reproacheth me: for I trust in thy word.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 43 And take not the word of truth utterly out of my mouth; for I have hoped in thy judgments.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 44 So shall I keep thy law continually for ever and ever.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 45 And I will walk at liberty: for I seek thy precepts.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 46 I will speak of thy testimonies also before kings, and will not be ashamed.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 47 And I will delight myself in thy commandments, which I have loved.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 48 My hands also will I lift up unto thy commandments, which I have loved; and I will meditate in thy statutes.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 49 Remember the word unto thy servant, upon which thou hast caused me to hope.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 50 This is my comfort in my affliction: for thy word hath quickened me.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 51 The proud have had me greatly in derision: yet have I not declined from thy law.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 52 I remembered thy judgments of old, O LORD; and have comforted myself.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 53 Horror hath taken hold upon me because of the wicked that forsake thy law.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 54 Thy statutes have been my songs in the house of my pilgrimage.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 55 I have remembered thy name, O LORD, in the night, and have kept thy law.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 56 This I had, because I kept thy precepts.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 57 Thou art my portion, O LORD: I have said that I would keep thy words.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 58 I intreated thy favour with my whole heart: be merciful unto me according to thy word.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 59 I thought on my ways, and turned my feet unto thy testimonies.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 60 I made haste, and delayed not to keep thy commandments.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 61 The bands of the wicked have robbed me: but I have not forgotten thy law.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 62 At midnight I will rise to give thanks unto thee because of thy righteous judgments.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 63 I am a companion of all them that fear thee, and of them that keep thy precepts.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 64 The earth, O LORD, is full of thy mercy: teach me thy statutes.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 65 Thou hast dealt well with thy servant, O LORD, according unto thy word.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 66 Teach me good judgment and knowledge: for I have believed thy commandments.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 67 Before I was afflicted I went astray: but now have I kept thy word.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 68 Thou art good, and doest good; teach me thy statutes.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 69 The proud have forged a lie against me: but I will keep thy precepts with my whole heart.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 70 Their heart is as fat as grease; but I delight in thy law.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 71 It is good for me that I have been afflicted; that I might learn thy statutes.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 72 The law of thy mouth is better unto me than thousands of gold and silver.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 73 Thy hands have made me and fashioned me: give me understanding, that I may learn thy commandments.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 74 They that fear thee will be glad when they see me; because I have hoped in thy word.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 75 I know, O LORD, that thy judgments are right, and that thou in faithfulness hast afflicted me.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 76 Let, I pray thee, thy merciful kindness be for my comfort, according to thy word unto thy servant.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 77 Let thy tender mercies come unto me, that I may live: for thy law is my delight.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 78 Let the proud be ashamed; for they dealt perversely with me without a cause: but I will meditate in thy precepts.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 79 Let those that fear thee turn unto me, and those that have known thy testimonies.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 80 Let my heart be sound in thy statutes; that I be not ashamed.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 81 My soul fainteth for thy salvation: but I hope in thy word.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 82 Mine eyes fail for thy word, saying, When wilt thou comfort me?

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 83 For I am become like a bottle in the smoke; yet do I not forget thy statutes.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 84 How many are the days of thy servant? when wilt thou execute judgment on them that persecute me?

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 85 The proud have digged pits for me, which are not after thy law.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 86 All thy commandments are faithful: they persecute me wrongfully; help thou me.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 87 They had almost consumed me upon earth; but I forsook not thy precepts.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 88 Quicken me after thy lovingkindness; so shall I keep the testimony of thy mouth.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 89 For ever, O LORD, thy word is settled in heaven.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 90 Thy faithfulness is unto all generations: thou hast established the earth, and it abideth.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 91 They continue this day according to thine ordinances: for all are thy servants.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 92 Unless thy law had been my delights, I should then have perished in mine affliction.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 93 I will never forget thy precepts: for with them thou hast quickened me.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 94 I am thine, save me; for I have sought thy precepts.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 95 The wicked have waited for me to destroy me: but I will consider thy testimonies.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 96 I have seen an end of all perfection: but thy commandment is exceeding broad.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 97 O how love I thy law! it is my meditation all the day.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 98 Thou through thy commandments hast made me wiser than mine enemies: for they are ever with me.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 99 I have more understanding than all my teachers: for thy testimonies are my meditation.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 100 I understand more than the ancients, because I keep thy precepts.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 101 I have refrained my feet from every evil way, that I might keep thy word.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 102 I have not departed from thy judgments: for thou hast taught me.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 103 How sweet are thy words unto my taste! yea, sweeter than honey to my mouth!

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 104 Through thy precepts I get understanding: therefore I hate every false way.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 105 Thy word is a lamp unto my feet, and a light unto my path.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 106 I have sworn, and I will perform it, that I will keep thy righteous judgments.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 107 I am afflicted very much: quicken me, O LORD, according unto thy word.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 108 Accept, I beseech thee, the freewill offerings of my mouth, O LORD, and teach me thy judgments.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 109 My soul is continually in my hand: yet do I not forget thy law.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 110 The wicked have laid a snare for me: yet I erred not from thy precepts.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 111 Thy testimonies have I taken as an heritage for ever: for they are the rejoicing of my heart.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 112 I have inclined mine heart to perform thy statutes alway, even unto the end.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 113 I hate vain thoughts: but thy law do I love.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 114 Thou art my hiding place and my shield: I hope in thy word.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 115 Depart from me, ye evildoers: for I will keep the commandments of my God.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 116 Uphold me according unto thy word, that I may live: and let me not be ashamed of my hope.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 117 Hold thou me up, and I shall be safe: and I will have respect unto thy statutes continually.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 118 Thou hast trodden down all them that err from thy statutes: for their deceit is falsehood.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 119 Thou puttest away all the wicked of the earth like dross: therefore I love thy testimonies.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 120 My flesh trembleth for fear of thee; and I am afraid of thy judgments.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 121 I have done judgment and justice: leave me not to mine oppressors.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 122 Be surety for thy servant for good: let not the proud oppress me.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 123 Mine eyes fail for thy salvation, and for the word of thy righteousness.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 124 Deal with thy servant according unto thy mercy, and teach me thy statutes.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 125 I am thy servant; give me understanding, that I may know thy testimonies.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 126 It is time for thee, LORD, to work: for they have made void thy law.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 127 Therefore I love thy commandments above gold; yea, above fine gold.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 128 Therefore I esteem all thy precepts concerning all things to be right; and I hate every false way.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 129 Thy testimonies are wonderful: therefore doth my soul keep them.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 130 The entrance of thy words giveth light; it giveth understanding unto the simple.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 131 I opened my mouth, and panted: for I longed for thy commandments.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 132 Look thou upon me, and be merciful unto me, as thou usest to do unto those that love thy name.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 133 Order my steps in thy word: and let not any iniquity have dominion over me.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 134 Deliver me from the oppression of man: so will I keep thy precepts.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 135 Make thy face to shine upon thy servant; and teach me thy statutes.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 136 Rivers of waters run down mine eyes, because they keep not thy law.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 137 Righteous art thou, O LORD, and upright are thy judgments.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 138 Thy testimonies that thou hast commanded are righteous and very faithful.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 139 My zeal hath consumed me, because mine enemies have forgotten thy words.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 140 Thy word is very pure: therefore thy servant loveth it.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 141 I am small and despised: yet do not I forget thy precepts.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 142 Thy righteousness is an everlasting righteousness, and thy law is the truth.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 143 Trouble and anguish have taken hold on me: yet thy commandments are my delights.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 144 The righteousness of thy testimonies is everlasting: give me understanding, and I shall live.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 145 I cried with my whole heart; hear me, O LORD: I will keep thy statutes.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 146 I cried unto thee; save me, and I shall keep thy testimonies.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 147 I prevented the dawning of the morning, and cried: I hoped in thy word.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 148 Mine eyes prevent the night watches, that I might meditate in thy word.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 149 Hear my voice according unto thy lovingkindness: O LORD, quicken me according to thy judgment.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 150 They draw nigh that follow after mischief: they are far from thy law.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 151 Thou art near, O LORD; and all thy commandments are truth.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 152 Concerning thy testimonies, I have known of old that thou hast founded them for ever.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 153 Consider mine affliction, and deliver me: for I do not forget thy law.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 154 Plead my cause, and deliver me: quicken me according to thy word.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 155 Salvation is far from the wicked: for they seek not thy statutes.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 156 Great are thy tender mercies, O LORD: quicken me according to thy judgments.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 157 Many are my persecutors and mine enemies; yet do I not decline from thy testimonies.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 158 I beheld the transgressors, and was grieved; because they kept not thy word.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 159 Consider how I love thy precepts: quicken me, O LORD, according to thy lovingkindness.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 160 Thy word is true from the beginning: and every one of thy righteous judgments endureth for ever.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 161 Princes have persecuted me without a cause: but my heart standeth in awe of thy word.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 162 I rejoice at thy word, as one that findeth great spoil.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 163 I hate and abhor lying: but thy law do I love.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 164 Seven times a day do I praise thee because of thy righteous judgments.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 165 Great peace have they which love thy law: and nothing shall offend them.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 166 LORD, I have hoped for thy salvation, and done thy commandments.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 167 My soul hath kept thy testimonies; and I love them exceedingly.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 168 I have kept thy precepts and thy testimonies: for all my ways are before thee.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 169 Let my cry come near before thee, O LORD: give me understanding according to thy word.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 170 Let my supplication come before thee: deliver me according to thy word.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 171 My lips shall utter praise, when thou hast taught me thy statutes.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 172 My tongue shall speak of thy word: for all thy commandments are righteousness.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 173 Let thine hand help me; for I have chosen thy precepts.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 174 I have longed for thy salvation, O LORD; and thy law is my delight.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 175 Let my soul live, and it shall praise thee; and let thy judgments help me.

Bible.Title: Psalms 119:
Bible.Verse: 176 I have gone astray like a lost sheep; seek thy servant; for I do not forget thy commandments.

Bible.Title: Psalms 120:
Bible.Verse: 1 In my distress I cried unto the LORD, and he heard me.

Bible.Title: Psalms 120:
Bible.Verse: 2 Deliver my soul, O LORD, from lying lips, and from a deceitful tongue.

Bible.Title: Psalms 120:
Bible.Verse: 3 What shall be given unto thee? or what shall be done unto thee, thou false tongue?

Bible.Title: Psalms 120:
Bible.Verse: 4 Sharp arrows of the mighty, with coals of juniper.

Bible.Title: Psalms 120:
Bible.Verse: 5 Woe is me, that I sojourn in Mesech, that I dwell in the tents of Kedar!

Bible.Title: Psalms 120:
Bible.Verse: 6 My soul hath long dwelt with him that hateth peace.

Bible.Title: Psalms 120:
Bible.Verse: 7 I am for peace: but when I speak, they are for war.

Bible.Title: Psalms 121:
Bible.Verse: 1 I will lift up mine eyes unto the hills, from whence cometh my help.

Bible.Title: Psalms 121:
Bible.Verse: 2 My help cometh from the LORD, which made heaven and earth.

Bible.Title: Psalms 121:
Bible.Verse: 3 He will not suffer thy foot to be moved: he that keepeth thee will not slumber.

Bible.Title: Psalms 121:
Bible.Verse: 4 Behold, he that keepeth Israel shall neither slumber nor sleep.

Bible.Title: Psalms 121:
Bible.Verse: 5 The LORD is thy keeper: the LORD is thy shade upon thy right hand.

Bible.Title: Psalms 121:
Bible.Verse: 6 The sun shall not smite thee by day, nor the moon by night.

Bible.Title: Psalms 121:
Bible.Verse: 7 The LORD shall preserve thee from all evil: he shall preserve thy soul.

Bible.Title: Psalms 121:
Bible.Verse: 8 The LORD shall preserve thy going out and thy coming in from this time forth, and even for evermore.

Bible.Title: Psalms 122:
Bible.Verse: 1 I was glad when they said unto me, Let us go into the house of the LORD.

Bible.Title: Psalms 122:
Bible.Verse: 2 Our feet shall stand within thy gates, O Jerusalem.

Bible.Title: Psalms 122:
Bible.Verse: 3 Jerusalem is builded as a city that is compact together:

Bible.Title: Psalms 122:
Bible.Verse: 4 Whither the tribes go up, the tribes of the LORD, unto the testimony of Israel, to give thanks unto the name of the LORD.

Bible.Title: Psalms 122:
Bible.Verse: 5 For there are set thrones of judgment, the thrones of the house of David.

Bible.Title: Psalms 122:
Bible.Verse: 6 Pray for the peace of Jerusalem: they shall prosper that love thee.

Bible.Title: Psalms 122:
Bible.Verse: 7 Peace be within thy walls, and prosperity within thy palaces.

Bible.Title: Psalms 122:
Bible.Verse: 8 For my brethren and companions' sakes, I will now say, Peace be within thee.

Bible.Title: Psalms 122:
Bible.Verse: 9 Because of the house of the LORD our God I will seek thy good.

Bible.Title: Psalms 123:
Bible.Verse: 1 Unto thee lift I up mine eyes, O thou that dwellest in the heavens.

Bible.Title: Psalms 123:
Bible.Verse: 2 Behold, as the eyes of servants look unto the hand of their masters, and as the eyes of a maiden unto the hand of her mistress; so our eyes wait upon the LORD our God, until that he have mercy upon us.

Bible.Title: Psalms 123:
Bible.Verse: 3 Have mercy upon us, O LORD, have mercy upon us: for we are exceedingly filled with contempt.

Bible.Title: Psalms 123:
Bible.Verse: 4 Our soul is exceedingly filled with the scorning of those that are at ease, and with the contempt of the proud.

Bible.Title: Psalms 124:
Bible.Verse: 1 If it had not been the LORD who was on our side, now may Israel say;

Bible.Title: Psalms 124:
Bible.Verse: 2 If it had not been the LORD who was on our side, when men rose up against us:

Bible.Title: Psalms 124:
Bible.Verse: 3 Then they had swallowed us up quick, when their wrath was kindled against us:

Bible.Title: Psalms 124:
Bible.Verse: 4 Then the waters had overwhelmed us, the stream had gone over our soul:

Bible.Title: Psalms 124:
Bible.Verse: 5 Then the proud waters had gone over our soul.

Bible.Title: Psalms 124:
Bible.Verse: 6 Blessed be the LORD, who hath not given us as a prey to their teeth.

Bible.Title: Psalms 124:
Bible.Verse: 7 Our soul is escaped as a bird out of the snare of the fowlers: the snare is broken, and we are escaped.

Bible.Title: Psalms 124:
Bible.Verse: 8 Our help is in the name of the LORD, who made heaven and earth.

Bible.Title: Psalms 125:
Bible.Verse: 1 They that trust in the LORD shall be as mount Zion, which cannot be removed, but abideth for ever.

Bible.Title: Psalms 125:
Bible.Verse: 2 As the mountains are round about Jerusalem, so the LORD is round about his people from henceforth even for ever.

Bible.Title: Psalms 125:
Bible.Verse: 3 For the rod of the wicked shall not rest upon the lot of the righteous; lest the righteous put forth their hands unto iniquity.

Bible.Title: Psalms 125:
Bible.Verse: 4 Do good, O LORD, unto those that be good, and to them that are upright in their hearts.

Bible.Title: Psalms 125:
Bible.Verse: 5 As for such as turn aside unto their crooked ways, the LORD shall lead them forth with the workers of iniquity: but peace shall be upon Israel.

Bible.Title: Psalms 126:
Bible.Verse: 1 When the LORD turned again the captivity of Zion, we were like them that dream.

Bible.Title: Psalms 126:
Bible.Verse: 2 Then was our mouth filled with laughter, and our tongue with singing: then said they among the heathen, The LORD hath done great things for them.

Bible.Title: Psalms 126:
Bible.Verse: 3 The LORD hath done great things for us; whereof we are glad.

Bible.Title: Psalms 126:
Bible.Verse: 4 Turn again our captivity, O LORD, as the streams in the south.

Bible.Title: Psalms 126:
Bible.Verse: 5 They that sow in tears shall reap in joy.

Bible.Title: Psalms 126:
Bible.Verse: 6 He that goeth forth and weepeth, bearing precious seed, shall doubtless come again with rejoicing, bringing his sheaves with him.

Bible.Title: Psalms 127:
Bible.Verse: 1 Except the LORD build the house, they labour in vain that build it: except the LORD keep the city, the watchman waketh but in vain.

Bible.Title: Psalms 127:
Bible.Verse: 2 It is vain for you to rise up early, to sit up late, to eat the bread of sorrows: for so he giveth his beloved sleep.

Bible.Title: Psalms 127:
Bible.Verse: 3 Lo, children are an heritage of the LORD: and the fruit of the womb is his reward.

Bible.Title: Psalms 127:
Bible.Verse: 4 As arrows are in the hand of a mighty man; so are children of the youth.

Bible.Title: Psalms 127:
Bible.Verse: 5 Happy is the man that hath his quiver full of them: they shall not be ashamed, but they shall speak with the enemies in the gate.

Bible.Title: Psalms 128:
Bible.Verse: 1 Blessed is every one that feareth the LORD; that walketh in his ways.

Bible.Title: Psalms 128:
Bible.Verse: 2 For thou shalt eat the labour of thine hands: happy shalt thou be, and it shall be well with thee.

Bible.Title: Psalms 128:
Bible.Verse: 3 Thy wife shall be as a fruitful vine by the sides of thine house: thy children like olive plants round about thy table.

Bible.Title: Psalms 128:
Bible.Verse: 4 Behold, that thus shall the man be blessed that feareth the LORD.

Bible.Title: Psalms 128:
Bible.Verse: 5 The LORD shall bless thee out of Zion: and thou shalt see the good of Jerusalem all the days of thy life.

Bible.Title: Psalms 128:
Bible.Verse: 6 Yea, thou shalt see thy children's children, and peace upon Israel.

Bible.Title: Psalms 129:
Bible.Verse: 1 Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth, may Israel now say:

Bible.Title: Psalms 129:
Bible.Verse: 2 Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth: yet they have not prevailed against me.

Bible.Title: Psalms 129:
Bible.Verse: 3 The plowers plowed upon my back: they made long their furrows.

Bible.Title: Psalms 129:
Bible.Verse: 4 The LORD is righteous: he hath cut asunder the cords of the wicked.

Bible.Title: Psalms 129:
Bible.Verse: 5 Let them all be confounded and turned back that hate Zion.

Bible.Title: Psalms 129:
Bible.Verse: 6 Let them be as the grass upon the housetops, which withereth afore it groweth up:

Bible.Title: Psalms 129:
Bible.Verse: 7 Wherewith the mower filleth not his hand; nor he that bindeth sheaves his bosom.

Bible.Title: Psalms 129:
Bible.Verse: 8 Neither do they which go by say, The blessing of the LORD be upon you: we bless you in the name of the LORD.

Bible.Title: Psalms 130:
Bible.Verse: 1 Out of the depths have I cried unto thee, O LORD.

Bible.Title: Psalms 130:
Bible.Verse: 2 Lord, hear my voice: let thine ears be attentive to the voice of my supplications.

Bible.Title: Psalms 130:
Bible.Verse: 3 If thou, LORD, shouldest mark iniquities, O Lord, who shall stand?

Bible.Title: Psalms 130:
Bible.Verse: 4 But there is forgiveness with thee, that thou mayest be feared.

Bible.Title: Psalms 130:
Bible.Verse: 5 I wait for the LORD, my soul doth wait, and in his word do I hope.

Bible.Title: Psalms 130:
Bible.Verse: 6 My soul waiteth for the Lord more than they that watch for the morning: I say, more than they that watch for the morning.

Bible.Title: Psalms 130:
Bible.Verse: 7 Let Israel hope in the LORD: for with the LORD there is mercy, and with him is plenteous redemption.

Bible.Title: Psalms 130:
Bible.Verse: 8 And he shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities.

Bible.Title: Psalms 131:
Bible.Verse: 1 Lord, my heart is not haughty, nor mine eyes lofty: neither do I exercise myself in great matters, or in things too high for me.

Bible.Title: Psalms 131:
Bible.Verse: 2 Surely I have behaved and quieted myself, as a child that is weaned of his mother: my soul is even as a weaned child.

Bible.Title: Psalms 131:
Bible.Verse: 3 Let Israel hope in the LORD from henceforth and for ever.

Bible.Title: Psalms 132:
Bible.Verse: 1 Lord, remember David, and all his afflictions:

Bible.Title: Psalms 132:
Bible.Verse: 2 How he sware unto the LORD, and vowed unto the mighty God of Jacob;

Bible.Title: Psalms 132:
Bible.Verse: 3 Surely I will not come into the tabernacle of my house, nor go up into my bed;

Bible.Title: Psalms 132:
Bible.Verse: 4 I will not give sleep to mine eyes, or slumber to mine eyelids,

Bible.Title: Psalms 132:
Bible.Verse: 5 Until I find out a place for the LORD, an habitation for the mighty God of Jacob.

Bible.Title: Psalms 132:
Bible.Verse: 6 Lo, we heard of it at Ephratah: we found it in the fields of the wood.

Bible.Title: Psalms 132:
Bible.Verse: 7 We will go into his tabernacles: we will worship at his footstool.

Bible.Title: Psalms 132:
Bible.Verse: 8 Arise, O LORD, into thy rest; thou, and the ark of thy strength.

Bible.Title: Psalms 132:
Bible.Verse: 9 Let thy priests be clothed with righteousness; and let thy saints shout for joy.

Bible.Title: Psalms 132:
Bible.Verse: 10 For thy servant David's sake turn not away the face of thine anointed.

Bible.Title: Psalms 132:
Bible.Verse: 11 The LORD hath sworn in truth unto David; he will not turn from it; Of the fruit of thy body will I set upon thy throne.

Bible.Title: Psalms 132:
Bible.Verse: 12 If thy children will keep my covenant and my testimony that I shall teach them, their children shall also sit upon thy throne for evermore.

Bible.Title: Psalms 132:
Bible.Verse: 13 For the LORD hath chosen Zion; he hath desired it for his habitation.

Bible.Title: Psalms 132:
Bible.Verse: 14 This is my rest for ever: here will I dwell; for I have desired it.

Bible.Title: Psalms 132:
Bible.Verse: 15 I will abundantly bless her provision: I will satisfy her poor with bread.

Bible.Title: Psalms 132:
Bible.Verse: 16 I will also clothe her priests with salvation: and her saints shall shout aloud for joy.

Bible.Title: Psalms 132:
Bible.Verse: 17 There will I make the horn of David to bud: I have ordained a lamp for mine anointed.

Bible.Title: Psalms 132:
Bible.Verse: 18 His enemies will I clothe with shame: but upon himself shall his crown flourish.

Bible.Title: Psalms 133:
Bible.Verse: 1 Behold, how good and how pleasant it is for brethren to dwell together in unity!

Bible.Title: Psalms 133:
Bible.Verse: 2 It is like the precious ointment upon the head, that ran down upon the beard, even Aaron's beard: that went down to the skirts of his garments;

Bible.Title: Psalms 133:
Bible.Verse: 3 As the dew of Hermon, and as the dew that descended upon the mountains of Zion: for there the LORD commanded the blessing, even life for evermore.

Bible.Title: Psalms 134:
Bible.Verse: 1 Behold, bless ye the LORD, all ye servants of the LORD, which by night stand in the house of the LORD.

Bible.Title: Psalms 134:
Bible.Verse: 2 Lift up your hands in the sanctuary, and bless the LORD.

Bible.Title: Psalms 134:
Bible.Verse: 3 The LORD that made heaven and earth bless thee out of Zion.

Bible.Title: Psalms 135:
Bible.Verse: 1 Praise ye the LORD. Praise ye the name of the LORD; praise him, O ye servants of the LORD.

Bible.Title: Psalms 135:
Bible.Verse: 2 Ye that stand in the house of the LORD, in the courts of the house of our God,

Bible.Title: Psalms 135:
Bible.Verse: 3 Praise the LORD; for the LORD is good: sing praises unto his name; for it is pleasant.

Bible.Title: Psalms 135:
Bible.Verse: 4 For the LORD hath chosen Jacob unto himself, and Israel for his peculiar treasure.

Bible.Title: Psalms 135:
Bible.Verse: 5 For I know that the LORD is great, and that our Lord is above all gods.

Bible.Title: Psalms 135:
Bible.Verse: 6 Whatsoever the LORD pleased, that did he in heaven, and in earth, in the seas, and all deep places.

Bible.Title: Psalms 135:
Bible.Verse: 7 He causeth the vapours to ascend from the ends of the earth; he maketh lightnings for the rain; he bringeth the wind out of his treasuries.

Bible.Title: Psalms 135:
Bible.Verse: 8 Who smote the firstborn of Egypt, both of man and beast.

Bible.Title: Psalms 135:
Bible.Verse: 9 Who sent tokens and wonders into the midst of thee, O Egypt, upon Pharaoh, and upon all his servants.

Bible.Title: Psalms 135:
Bible.Verse: 10 Who smote great nations, and slew mighty kings;

Bible.Title: Psalms 135:
Bible.Verse: 11 Sihon king of the Amorites, and Og king of Bashan, and all the kingdoms of Canaan:

Bible.Title: Psalms 135:
Bible.Verse: 12 And gave their land for an heritage, an heritage unto Israel his people.

Bible.Title: Psalms 135:
Bible.Verse: 13 Thy name, O LORD, endureth for ever; and thy memorial, O LORD, throughout all generations.

Bible.Title: Psalms 135:
Bible.Verse: 14 For the LORD will judge his people, and he will repent himself concerning his servants.

Bible.Title: Psalms 135:
Bible.Verse: 15 The idols of the heathen are silver and gold, the work of men's hands.

Bible.Title: Psalms 135:
Bible.Verse: 16 They have mouths, but they speak not; eyes have they, but they see not;

Bible.Title: Psalms 135:
Bible.Verse: 17 They have ears, but they hear not; neither is there any breath in their mouths.

Bible.Title: Psalms 135:
Bible.Verse: 18 They that make them are like unto them: so is every one that trusteth in them.

Bible.Title: Psalms 135:
Bible.Verse: 19 Bless the LORD, O house of Israel: bless the LORD, O house of Aaron:

Bible.Title: Psalms 135:
Bible.Verse: 20 Bless the LORD, O house of Levi: ye that fear the LORD, bless the LORD.

Bible.Title: Psalms 135:
Bible.Verse: 21 Blessed be the LORD out of Zion, which dwelleth at Jerusalem. Praise ye the LORD.

Bible.Title: Psalms 136:
Bible.Verse: 1 O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Bible.Title: Psalms 136:
Bible.Verse: 2 O give thanks unto the God of gods: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Bible.Title: Psalms 136:
Bible.Verse: 3 O give thanks to the Lord of lords: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Bible.Title: Psalms 136:
Bible.Verse: 4 To him who alone doeth great wonders: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Bible.Title: Psalms 136:
Bible.Verse: 5 To him that by wisdom made the heavens: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Bible.Title: Psalms 136:
Bible.Verse: 6 To him that stretched out the earth above the waters: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Bible.Title: Psalms 136:
Bible.Verse: 7 To him that made great lights: for his mercy endureth for ever:

Bible.Title: Psalms 136:
Bible.Verse: 8 The sun to rule by day: for his mercy endureth for ever:

Bible.Title: Psalms 136:
Bible.Verse: 9 The moon and stars to rule by night: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Bible.Title: Psalms 136:
Bible.Verse: 10 To him that smote Egypt in their firstborn: for his mercy endureth for ever:

Bible.Title: Psalms 136:
Bible.Verse: 11 And brought out Israel from among them: for his mercy endureth for ever:

Bible.Title: Psalms 136:
Bible.Verse: 12 With a strong hand, and with a stretched out arm: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Bible.Title: Psalms 136:
Bible.Verse: 13 To him which divided the Red sea into parts: for his mercy endureth for ever:

Bible.Title: Psalms 136:
Bible.Verse: 14 And made Israel to pass through the midst of it: for his mercy endureth for ever:

Bible.Title: Psalms 136:
Bible.Verse: 15 But overthrew Pharaoh and his host in the Red sea: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Bible.Title: Psalms 136:
Bible.Verse: 16 To him which led his people through the wilderness: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Bible.Title: Psalms 136:
Bible.Verse: 17 To him which smote great kings: for his mercy endureth for ever:

Bible.Title: Psalms 136:
Bible.Verse: 18 And slew famous kings: for his mercy endureth for ever:

Bible.Title: Psalms 136:
Bible.Verse: 19 Sihon king of the Amorites: for his mercy endureth for ever:

Bible.Title: Psalms 136:
Bible.Verse: 20 And Og the king of Bashan: for his mercy endureth for ever:

Bible.Title: Psalms 136:
Bible.Verse: 21 And gave their land for an heritage: for his mercy endureth for ever:

Bible.Title: Psalms 136:
Bible.Verse: 22 Even an heritage unto Israel his servant: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Bible.Title: Psalms 136:
Bible.Verse: 23 Who remembered us in our low estate: for his mercy endureth for ever:

Bible.Title: Psalms 136:
Bible.Verse: 24 And hath redeemed us from our enemies: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Bible.Title: Psalms 136:
Bible.Verse: 25 Who giveth food to all flesh: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Bible.Title: Psalms 136:
Bible.Verse: 26 O give thanks unto the God of heaven: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Bible.Title: Psalms 137:
Bible.Verse: 1 By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down, yea, we wept, when we remembered Zion.

Bible.Title: Psalms 137:
Bible.Verse: 2 We hanged our harps upon the willows in the midst thereof.

Bible.Title: Psalms 137:
Bible.Verse: 3 For there they that carried us away captive required of us a song; and they that wasted us required of us mirth, saying, Sing us one of the songs of Zion.

Bible.Title: Psalms 137:
Bible.Verse: 4 How shall we sing the LORD's song in a strange land?

Bible.Title: Psalms 137:
Bible.Verse: 5 If I forget thee, O Jerusalem, let my right hand forget her cunning.

Bible.Title: Psalms 137:
Bible.Verse: 6 If I do not remember thee, let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth; if I prefer not Jerusalem above my chief joy.

Bible.Title: Psalms 137:
Bible.Verse: 7 Remember, O LORD, the children of Edom in the day of Jerusalem; who said, Rase it, rase it, even to the foundation thereof.

Bible.Title: Psalms 137:
Bible.Verse: 8 O daughter of Babylon, who art to be destroyed; happy shall he be, that rewardeth thee as thou hast served us.

Bible.Title: Psalms 137:
Bible.Verse: 9 Happy shall he be, that taketh and dasheth thy little ones against the stones.

Bible.Title: Psalms 138:
Bible.Verse: 1 I will praise thee with my whole heart: before the gods will I sing praise unto thee.

Bible.Title: Psalms 138:
Bible.Verse: 2 I will worship toward thy holy temple, and praise thy name for thy lovingkindness and for thy truth: for thou hast magnified thy word above all thy name.

Bible.Title: Psalms 138:
Bible.Verse: 3 In the day when I cried thou answeredst me, and strengthenedst me with strength in my soul.

Bible.Title: Psalms 138:
Bible.Verse: 4 All the kings of the earth shall praise thee, O LORD, when they hear the words of thy mouth.

Bible.Title: Psalms 138:
Bible.Verse: 5 Yea, they shall sing in the ways of the LORD: for great is the glory of the LORD.

Bible.Title: Psalms 138:
Bible.Verse: 6 Though the LORD be high, yet hath he respect unto the lowly: but the proud he knoweth afar off.

Bible.Title: Psalms 138:
Bible.Verse: 7 Though I walk in the midst of trouble, thou wilt revive me: thou shalt stretch forth thine hand against the wrath of mine enemies, and thy right hand shall save me.

Bible.Title: Psalms 138:
Bible.Verse: 8 The LORD will perfect that which concerneth me: thy mercy, O LORD, endureth for ever: forsake not the works of thine own hands.

Bible.Title: Psalms 139:
Bible.Verse: 1 O LORD, thou hast searched me, and known me.

Bible.Title: Psalms 139:
Bible.Verse: 2 Thou knowest my downsitting and mine uprising, thou understandest my thought afar off.

Bible.Title: Psalms 139:
Bible.Verse: 3 Thou compassest my path and my lying down, and art acquainted with all my ways.

Bible.Title: Psalms 139:
Bible.Verse: 4 For there is not a word in my tongue, but, lo, O LORD, thou knowest it altogether.

Bible.Title: Psalms 139:
Bible.Verse: 5 Thou hast beset me behind and before, and laid thine hand upon me.

Bible.Title: Psalms 139:
Bible.Verse: 6 Such knowledge is too wonderful for me; it is high, I cannot attain unto it.

Bible.Title: Psalms 139:
Bible.Verse: 7 Whither shall I go from thy spirit? or whither shall I flee from thy presence?

Bible.Title: Psalms 139:
Bible.Verse: 8 If I ascend up into heaven, thou art there: if I make my bed in hell, behold, thou art there.

Bible.Title: Psalms 139:
Bible.Verse: 9 If I take the wings of the morning, and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea;

Bible.Title: Psalms 139:
Bible.Verse: 10 Even there shall thy hand lead me, and thy right hand shall hold me.

Bible.Title: Psalms 139:
Bible.Verse: 11 If I say, Surely the darkness shall cover me; even the night shall be light about me.

Bible.Title: Psalms 139:
Bible.Verse: 12 Yea, the darkness hideth not from thee; but the night shineth as the day: the darkness and the light are both alike to thee.

Bible.Title: Psalms 139:
Bible.Verse: 13 For thou hast possessed my reins: thou hast covered me in my mother's womb.

Bible.Title: Psalms 139:
Bible.Verse: 14 I will praise thee; for I am fearfully and wonderfully made: marvellous are thy works; and that my soul knoweth right well.

Bible.Title: Psalms 139:
Bible.Verse: 15 My substance was not hid from thee, when I was made in secret, and curiously wrought in the lowest parts of the earth.

Bible.Title: Psalms 139:
Bible.Verse: 16 Thine eyes did see my substance, yet being unperfect; and in thy book all my members were written, which in continuance were fashioned, when as yet there was none of them.

Bible.Title: Psalms 139:
Bible.Verse: 17 How precious also are thy thoughts unto me, O God! how great is the sum of them!

Bible.Title: Psalms 139:
Bible.Verse: 18 If I should count them, they are more in number than the sand: when I awake, I am still with thee.

Bible.Title: Psalms 139:
Bible.Verse: 19 Surely thou wilt slay the wicked, O God: depart from me therefore, ye bloody men.

Bible.Title: Psalms 139:
Bible.Verse: 20 For they speak against thee wickedly, and thine enemies take thy name in vain.

Bible.Title: Psalms 139:
Bible.Verse: 21 Do not I hate them, O LORD, that hate thee? and am not I grieved with those that rise up against thee?

Bible.Title: Psalms 139:
Bible.Verse: 22 I hate them with perfect hatred: I count them mine enemies.

Bible.Title: Psalms 139:
Bible.Verse: 23 Search me, O God, and know my heart: try me, and know my thoughts:

Bible.Title: Psalms 139:
Bible.Verse: 24 And see if there be any wicked way in me, and lead me in the way everlasting.

Bible.Title: Psalms 140:
Bible.Verse: 1 Deliver me, O LORD, from the evil man: preserve me from the violent man;

Bible.Title: Psalms 140:
Bible.Verse: 2 Which imagine mischiefs in their heart; continually are they gathered together for war.

Bible.Title: Psalms 140:
Bible.Verse: 3 They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent; adders' poison is under their lips. Selah.

Bible.Title: Psalms 140:
Bible.Verse: 4 Keep me, O LORD, from the hands of the wicked; preserve me from the violent man; who have purposed to overthrow my goings.

Bible.Title: Psalms 140:
Bible.Verse: 5 The proud have hid a snare for me, and cords; they have spread a net by the wayside; they have set gins for me. Selah.

Bible.Title: Psalms 140:
Bible.Verse: 6 I said unto the LORD, Thou art my God: hear the voice of my supplications, O LORD.

Bible.Title: Psalms 140:
Bible.Verse: 7 O GOD the Lord, the strength of my salvation, thou hast covered my head in the day of battle.

Bible.Title: Psalms 140:
Bible.Verse: 8 Grant not, O LORD, the desires of the wicked: further not his wicked device; lest they exalt themselves. Selah.

Bible.Title: Psalms 140:
Bible.Verse: 9 As for the head of those that compass me about, let the mischief of their own lips cover them.

Bible.Title: Psalms 140:
Bible.Verse: 10 Let burning coals fall upon them: let them be cast into the fire; into deep pits, that they rise not up again.

Bible.Title: Psalms 140:
Bible.Verse: 11 Let not an evil speaker be established in the earth: evil shall hunt the violent man to overthrow him.

Bible.Title: Psalms 140:
Bible.Verse: 12 I know that the LORD will maintain the cause of the afflicted, and the right of the poor.

Bible.Title: Psalms 140:
Bible.Verse: 13 Surely the righteous shall give thanks unto thy name: the upright shall dwell in thy presence.

Bible.Title: Psalms 141:
Bible.Verse: 1 Lord, I cry unto thee: make haste unto me; give ear unto my voice, when I cry unto thee.

Bible.Title: Psalms 141:
Bible.Verse: 2 Let my prayer be set forth before thee as incense; and the lifting up of my hands as the evening sacrifice.

Bible.Title: Psalms 141:
Bible.Verse: 3 Set a watch, O LORD, before my mouth; keep the door of my lips.

Bible.Title: Psalms 141:
Bible.Verse: 4 Incline not my heart to any evil thing, to practise wicked works with men that work iniquity: and let me not eat of their dainties.

Bible.Title: Psalms 141:
Bible.Verse: 5 Let the righteous smite me; it shall be a kindness: and let him reprove me; it shall be an excellent oil, which shall not break my head: for yet my prayer also shall be in their calamities.

Bible.Title: Psalms 141:
Bible.Verse: 6 When their judges are overthrown in stony places, they shall hear my words; for they are sweet.

Bible.Title: Psalms 141:
Bible.Verse: 7 Our bones are scattered at the grave's mouth, as when one cutteth and cleaveth wood upon the earth.

Bible.Title: Psalms 141:
Bible.Verse: 8 But mine eyes are unto thee, O GOD the Lord: in thee is my trust; leave not my soul destitute.

Bible.Title: Psalms 141:
Bible.Verse: 9 Keep me from the snares which they have laid for me, and the gins of the workers of iniquity.

Bible.Title: Psalms 141:
Bible.Verse: 10 Let the wicked fall into their own nets, whilst that I withal escape.

Bible.Title: Psalms 142:
Bible.Verse: 1 I cried unto the LORD with my voice; with my voice unto the LORD did I make my supplication.

Bible.Title: Psalms 142:
Bible.Verse: 2 I poured out my complaint before him; I shewed before him my trouble.

Bible.Title: Psalms 142:
Bible.Verse: 3 When my spirit was overwhelmed within me, then thou knewest my path. In the way wherein I walked have they privily laid a snare for me.

Bible.Title: Psalms 142:
Bible.Verse: 4 I looked on my right hand, and beheld, but there was no man that would know me: refuge failed me; no man cared for my soul.

Bible.Title: Psalms 142:
Bible.Verse: 5 I cried unto thee, O LORD: I said, Thou art my refuge and my portion in the land of the living.

Bible.Title: Psalms 142:
Bible.Verse: 6 Attend unto my cry; for I am brought very low: deliver me from my persecutors; for they are stronger than I.

Bible.Title: Psalms 142:
Bible.Verse: 7 Bring my soul out of prison, that I may praise thy name: the righteous shall compass me about; for thou shalt deal bountifully with me.

Bible.Title: Psalms 143:
Bible.Verse: 1 Hear my prayer, O LORD, give ear to my supplications: in thy faithfulness answer me, and in thy righteousness.

Bible.Title: Psalms 143:
Bible.Verse: 2 And enter not into judgment with thy servant: for in thy sight shall no man living be justified.

Bible.Title: Psalms 143:
Bible.Verse: 3 For the enemy hath persecuted my soul; he hath smitten my life down to the ground; he hath made me to dwell in darkness, as those that have been long dead.

Bible.Title: Psalms 143:
Bible.Verse: 4 Therefore is my spirit overwhelmed within me; my heart within me is desolate.

Bible.Title: Psalms 143:
Bible.Verse: 5 I remember the days of old; I meditate on all thy works; I muse on the work of thy hands.

Bible.Title: Psalms 143:
Bible.Verse: 6 I stretch forth my hands unto thee: my soul thirsteth after thee, as a thirsty land. Selah.

Bible.Title: Psalms 143:
Bible.Verse: 7 Hear me speedily, O LORD: my spirit faileth: hide not thy face from me, lest I be like unto them that go down into the pit.

Bible.Title: Psalms 143:
Bible.Verse: 8 Cause me to hear thy lovingkindness in the morning; for in thee do I trust: cause me to know the way wherein I should walk; for I lift up my soul unto thee.

Bible.Title: Psalms 143:
Bible.Verse: 9 Deliver me, O LORD, from mine enemies: I flee unto thee to hide me.

Bible.Title: Psalms 143:
Bible.Verse: 10 Teach me to do thy will; for thou art my God: thy spirit is good; lead me into the land of uprightness.

Bible.Title: Psalms 143:
Bible.Verse: 11 Quicken me, O LORD, for thy name's sake: for thy righteousness' sake bring my soul out of trouble.

Bible.Title: Psalms 143:
Bible.Verse: 12 And of thy mercy cut off mine enemies, and destroy all them that afflict my soul: for I am thy servant.

Bible.Title: Psalms 144:
Bible.Verse: 1 Blessed be the LORD my strength, which teacheth my hands to war, and my fingers to fight:

Bible.Title: Psalms 144:
Bible.Verse: 2 My goodness, and my fortress; my high tower, and my deliverer; my shield, and he in whom I trust; who subdueth my people under me.

Bible.Title: Psalms 144:
Bible.Verse: 3 LORD, what is man, that thou takest knowledge of him! or the son of man, that thou makest account of him!

Bible.Title: Psalms 144:
Bible.Verse: 4 Man is like to vanity: his days are as a shadow that passeth away.

Bible.Title: Psalms 144:
Bible.Verse: 5 Bow thy heavens, O LORD, and come down: touch the mountains, and they shall smoke.

Bible.Title: Psalms 144:
Bible.Verse: 6 Cast forth lightning, and scatter them: shoot out thine arrows, and destroy them.

Bible.Title: Psalms 144:
Bible.Verse: 7 Send thine hand from above; rid me, and deliver me out of great waters, from the hand of strange children;

Bible.Title: Psalms 144:
Bible.Verse: 8 Whose mouth speaketh vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood.

Bible.Title: Psalms 144:
Bible.Verse: 9 I will sing a new song unto thee, O God: upon a psaltery and an instrument of ten strings will I sing praises unto thee.

Bible.Title: Psalms 144:
Bible.Verse: 10 It is he that giveth salvation unto kings: who delivereth David his servant from the hurtful sword.

Bible.Title: Psalms 144:
Bible.Verse: 11 Rid me, and deliver me from the hand of strange children, whose mouth speaketh vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood:

Bible.Title: Psalms 144:
Bible.Verse: 12 That our sons may be as plants grown up in their youth; that our daughters may be as corner stones, polished after the similitude of a palace:

Bible.Title: Psalms 144:
Bible.Verse: 13 That our garners may be full, affording all manner of store: that our sheep may bring forth thousands and ten thousands in our streets:

Bible.Title: Psalms 144:
Bible.Verse: 14 That our oxen may be strong to labour; that there be no breaking in, nor going out; that there be no complaining in our streets.

Bible.Title: Psalms 144:
Bible.Verse: 15 Happy is that people, that is in such a case: yea, happy is that people, whose God is the LORD.

Bible.Title: Psalms 145:
Bible.Verse: 1 I will extol thee, my God, O king; and I will bless thy name for ever and ever.

Bible.Title: Psalms 145:
Bible.Verse: 2 Every day will I bless thee; and I will praise thy name for ever and ever.

Bible.Title: Psalms 145:
Bible.Verse: 3 Great is the LORD, and greatly to be praised; and his greatness is unsearchable.

Bible.Title: Psalms 145:
Bible.Verse: 4 One generation shall praise thy works to another, and shall declare thy mighty acts.

Bible.Title: Psalms 145:
Bible.Verse: 5 I will speak of the glorious honour of thy majesty, and of thy wondrous works.

Bible.Title: Psalms 145:
Bible.Verse: 6 And men shall speak of the might of thy terrible acts: and I will declare thy greatness.

Bible.Title: Psalms 145:
Bible.Verse: 7 They shall abundantly utter the memory of thy great goodness, and shall sing of thy righteousness.

Bible.Title: Psalms 145:
Bible.Verse: 8 The LORD is gracious, and full of compassion; slow to anger, and of great mercy.

Bible.Title: Psalms 145:
Bible.Verse: 9 The LORD is good to all: and his tender mercies are over all his works.

Bible.Title: Psalms 145:
Bible.Verse: 10 All thy works shall praise thee, O LORD; and thy saints shall bless thee.

Bible.Title: Psalms 145:
Bible.Verse: 11 They shall speak of the glory of thy kingdom, and talk of thy power;

Bible.Title: Psalms 145:
Bible.Verse: 12 To make known to the sons of men his mighty acts, and the glorious majesty of his kingdom.

Bible.Title: Psalms 145:
Bible.Verse: 13 Thy kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, and thy dominion endureth throughout all generations.

Bible.Title: Psalms 145:
Bible.Verse: 14 The LORD upholdeth all that fall, and raiseth up all those that be bowed down.

Bible.Title: Psalms 145:
Bible.Verse: 15 The eyes of all wait upon thee; and thou givest them their meat in due season.

Bible.Title: Psalms 145:
Bible.Verse: 16 Thou openest thine hand, and satisfiest the desire of every living thing.

Bible.Title: Psalms 145:
Bible.Verse: 17 The LORD is righteous in all his ways, and holy in all his works.

Bible.Title: Psalms 145:
Bible.Verse: 18 The LORD is nigh unto all them that call upon him, to all that call upon him in truth.

Bible.Title: Psalms 145:
Bible.Verse: 19 He will fulfil the desire of them that fear him: he also will hear their cry, and will save them.

Bible.Title: Psalms 145:
Bible.Verse: 20 The LORD preserveth all them that love him: but all the wicked will he destroy.

Bible.Title: Psalms 145:
Bible.Verse: 21 My mouth shall speak the praise of the LORD: and let all flesh bless his holy name for ever and ever.

Bible.Title: Psalms 146:
Bible.Verse: 1 Praise ye the LORD. Praise the LORD, O my soul.

Bible.Title: Psalms 146:
Bible.Verse: 2 While I live will I praise the LORD: I will sing praises unto my God while I have any being.

Bible.Title: Psalms 146:
Bible.Verse: 3 Put not your trust in princes, nor in the son of man, in whom there is no help.

Bible.Title: Psalms 146:
Bible.Verse: 4 His breath goeth forth, he returneth to his earth; in that very day his thoughts perish.

Bible.Title: Psalms 146:
Bible.Verse: 5 Happy is he that hath the God of Jacob for his help, whose hope is in the LORD his God:

Bible.Title: Psalms 146:
Bible.Verse: 6 Which made heaven, and earth, the sea, and all that therein is: which keepeth truth for ever:

Bible.Title: Psalms 146:
Bible.Verse: 7 Which executeth judgment for the oppressed: which giveth food to the hungry. The LORD looseth the prisoners:

Bible.Title: Psalms 146:
Bible.Verse: 8 The LORD openeth the eyes of the blind: the LORD raiseth them that are bowed down: the LORD loveth the righteous:

Bible.Title: Psalms 146:
Bible.Verse: 9 The LORD preserveth the strangers; he relieveth the fatherless and widow: but the way of the wicked he turneth upside down.

Bible.Title: Psalms 146:
Bible.Verse: 10 The LORD shall reign for ever, even thy God, O Zion, unto all generations. Praise ye the LORD.

Bible.Title: Psalms 147:
Bible.Verse: 1 Praise ye the LORD: for it is good to sing praises unto our God; for it is pleasant; and praise is comely.

Bible.Title: Psalms 147:
Bible.Verse: 2 The LORD doth build up Jerusalem: he gathereth together the outcasts of Israel.

Bible.Title: Psalms 147:
Bible.Verse: 3 He healeth the broken in heart, and bindeth up their wounds.

Bible.Title: Psalms 147:
Bible.Verse: 4 He telleth the number of the stars; he calleth them all by their names.

Bible.Title: Psalms 147:
Bible.Verse: 5 Great is our Lord, and of great power: his understanding is infinite.

Bible.Title: Psalms 147:
Bible.Verse: 6 The LORD lifteth up the meek: he casteth the wicked down to the ground.

Bible.Title: Psalms 147:
Bible.Verse: 7 Sing unto the LORD with thanksgiving; sing praise upon the harp unto our God:

Bible.Title: Psalms 147:
Bible.Verse: 8 Who covereth the heaven with clouds, who prepareth rain for the earth, who maketh grass to grow upon the mountains.

Bible.Title: Psalms 147:
Bible.Verse: 9 He giveth to the beast his food, and to the young ravens which cry.

Bible.Title: Psalms 147:
Bible.Verse: 10 He delighteth not in the strength of the horse: he taketh not pleasure in the legs of a man.

Bible.Title: Psalms 147:
Bible.Verse: 11 The LORD taketh pleasure in them that fear him, in those that hope in his mercy.

Bible.Title: Psalms 147:
Bible.Verse: 12 Praise the LORD, O Jerusalem; praise thy God, O Zion.

Bible.Title: Psalms 147:
