Bible.Verse: 13 For he hath strengthened the bars of thy gates; he hath blessed thy children within thee.

Bible.Title: Psalms 147:
Bible.Verse: 14 He maketh peace in thy borders, and filleth thee with the finest of the wheat.

Bible.Title: Psalms 147:
Bible.Verse: 15 He sendeth forth his commandment upon earth: his word runneth very swiftly.

Bible.Title: Psalms 147:
Bible.Verse: 16 He giveth snow like wool: he scattereth the hoarfrost like ashes.

Bible.Title: Psalms 147:
Bible.Verse: 17 He casteth forth his ice like morsels: who can stand before his cold?

Bible.Title: Psalms 147:
Bible.Verse: 18 He sendeth out his word, and melteth them: he causeth his wind to blow, and the waters flow.

Bible.Title: Psalms 147:
Bible.Verse: 19 He sheweth his word unto Jacob, his statutes and his judgments unto Israel.

Bible.Title: Psalms 147:
Bible.Verse: 20 He hath not dealt so with any nation: and as for his judgments, they have not known them. Praise ye the LORD.

Bible.Title: Psalms 148:
Bible.Verse: 1 Praise ye the LORD. Praise ye the LORD from the heavens: praise him in the heights.

Bible.Title: Psalms 148:
Bible.Verse: 2 Praise ye him, all his angels: praise ye him, all his hosts.

Bible.Title: Psalms 148:
Bible.Verse: 3 Praise ye him, sun and moon: praise him, all ye stars of light.

Bible.Title: Psalms 148:
Bible.Verse: 4 Praise him, ye heavens of heavens, and ye waters that be above the heavens.

Bible.Title: Psalms 148:
Bible.Verse: 5 Let them praise the name of the LORD: for he commanded, and they were created.

Bible.Title: Psalms 148:
Bible.Verse: 6 He hath also stablished them for ever and ever: he hath made a decree which shall not pass.

Bible.Title: Psalms 148:
Bible.Verse: 7 Praise the LORD from the earth, ye dragons, and all deeps:

Bible.Title: Psalms 148:
Bible.Verse: 8 Fire, and hail; snow, and vapours; stormy wind fulfilling his word:

Bible.Title: Psalms 148:
Bible.Verse: 9 Mountains, and all hills; fruitful trees, and all cedars:

Bible.Title: Psalms 148:
Bible.Verse: 10 Beasts, and all cattle; creeping things, and flying fowl:

Bible.Title: Psalms 148:
Bible.Verse: 11 Kings of the earth, and all people; princes, and all judges of the earth:

Bible.Title: Psalms 148:
Bible.Verse: 12 Both young men, and maidens; old men, and children:

Bible.Title: Psalms 148:
Bible.Verse: 13 Let them praise the name of the LORD: for his name alone is excellent; his glory is above the earth and heaven.

Bible.Title: Psalms 148:
Bible.Verse: 14 He also exalteth the horn of his people, the praise of all his saints; even of the children of Israel, a people near unto him. Praise ye the LORD.

Bible.Title: Psalms 149:
Bible.Verse: 1 Praise ye the LORD. Sing unto the LORD a new song, and his praise in the congregation of saints.

Bible.Title: Psalms 149:
Bible.Verse: 2 Let Israel rejoice in him that made him: let the children of Zion be joyful in their King.

Bible.Title: Psalms 149:
Bible.Verse: 3 Let them praise his name in the dance: let them sing praises unto him with the timbrel and harp.

Bible.Title: Psalms 149:
Bible.Verse: 4 For the LORD taketh pleasure in his people: he will beautify the meek with salvation.

Bible.Title: Psalms 149:
Bible.Verse: 5 Let the saints be joyful in glory: let them sing aloud upon their beds.

Bible.Title: Psalms 149:
Bible.Verse: 6 Let the high praises of God be in their mouth, and a two-edged sword in their hand;

Bible.Title: Psalms 149:
Bible.Verse: 7 To execute vengeance upon the heathen, and punishments upon the people;

Bible.Title: Psalms 149:
Bible.Verse: 8 To bind their kings with chains, and their nobles with fetters of iron;

Bible.Title: Psalms 149:
Bible.Verse: 9 To execute upon them the judgment written: this honour have all his saints. Praise ye the LORD.

Bible.Title: Psalms 150:
Bible.Verse: 1 Praise ye the LORD. Praise God in his sanctuary: praise him in the firmament of his power.

Bible.Title: Psalms 150:
Bible.Verse: 2 Praise him for his mighty acts: praise him according to his excellent greatness.

Bible.Title: Psalms 150:
Bible.Verse: 3 Praise him with the sound of the trumpet: praise him with the psaltery and harp.

Bible.Title: Psalms 150:
Bible.Verse: 4 Praise him with the timbrel and dance: praise him with stringed instruments and organs.

Bible.Title: Psalms 150:
Bible.Verse: 5 Praise him upon the loud cymbals: praise him upon the high sounding cymbals.

Bible.Title: Psalms 150:
Bible.Verse: 6 Let every thing that hath breath praise the LORD. Praise ye the LORD.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 1:
Bible.Verse: 1 The proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel;

Bible.Title: Proverbs 1:
Bible.Verse: 2 To know wisdom and instruction; to perceive the words of understanding;

Bible.Title: Proverbs 1:
Bible.Verse: 3 To receive the instruction of wisdom, justice, and judgment, and equity;

Bible.Title: Proverbs 1:
Bible.Verse: 4 To give subtilty to the simple, to the young man knowledge and discretion.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 1:
Bible.Verse: 5 A wise man will hear, and will increase learning; and a man of understanding shall attain unto wise counsels:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 1:
Bible.Verse: 6 To understand a proverb, and the interpretation; the words of the wise, and their dark sayings.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 1:
Bible.Verse: 7 The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge: but fools despise wisdom and instruction.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 1:
Bible.Verse: 8 My son, hear the instruction of thy father, and forsake not the law of thy mother:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 1:
Bible.Verse: 9 For they shall be an ornament of grace unto thy head, and chains about thy neck.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 1:
Bible.Verse: 10 My son, if sinners entice thee, consent thou not.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 1:
Bible.Verse: 11 If they say, Come with us, let us lay wait for blood, let us lurk privily for the innocent without cause:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 1:
Bible.Verse: 12 Let us swallow them up alive as the grave; and whole, as those that go down into the pit:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 1:
Bible.Verse: 13 We shall find all precious substance, we shall fill our houses with spoil:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 1:
Bible.Verse: 14 Cast in thy lot among us; let us all have one purse:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 1:
Bible.Verse: 15 My son, walk not thou in the way with them; refrain thy foot from their path:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 1:
Bible.Verse: 16 For their feet run to evil, and make haste to shed blood.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 1:
Bible.Verse: 17 Surely in vain the net is spread in the sight of any bird.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 1:
Bible.Verse: 18 And they lay wait for their own blood; they lurk privily for their own lives.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 1:
Bible.Verse: 19 So are the ways of every one that is greedy of gain; which taketh away the life of the owners thereof.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 1:
Bible.Verse: 20 Wisdom crieth without; she uttereth her voice in the streets:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 1:
Bible.Verse: 21 She crieth in the chief place of concourse, in the openings of the gates: in the city she uttereth her words, saying,

Bible.Title: Proverbs 1:
Bible.Verse: 22 How long, ye simple ones, will ye love simplicity? and the scorners delight in their scorning, and fools hate knowledge?

Bible.Title: Proverbs 1:
Bible.Verse: 23 Turn you at my reproof: behold, I will pour out my spirit unto you, I will make known my words unto you.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 1:
Bible.Verse: 24 Because I have called, and ye refused; I have stretched out my hand, and no man regarded;

Bible.Title: Proverbs 1:
Bible.Verse: 25 But ye have set at nought all my counsel, and would none of my reproof:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 1:
Bible.Verse: 26 I also will laugh at your calamity; I will mock when your fear cometh;

Bible.Title: Proverbs 1:
Bible.Verse: 27 When your fear cometh as desolation, and your destruction cometh as a whirlwind; when distress and anguish cometh upon you.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 1:
Bible.Verse: 28 Then shall they call upon me, but I will not answer; they shall seek me early, but they shall not find me:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 1:
Bible.Verse: 29 For that they hated knowledge, and did not choose the fear of the LORD:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 1:
Bible.Verse: 30 They would none of my counsel: they despised all my reproof.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 1:
Bible.Verse: 31 Therefore shall they eat of the fruit of their own way, and be filled with their own devices.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 1:
Bible.Verse: 32 For the turning away of the simple shall slay them, and the prosperity of fools shall destroy them.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 1:
Bible.Verse: 33 But whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell safely, and shall be quiet from fear of evil.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 2:
Bible.Verse: 1 My son, if thou wilt receive my words, and hide my commandments with thee;

Bible.Title: Proverbs 2:
Bible.Verse: 2 So that thou incline thine ear unto wisdom, and apply thine heart to understanding;

Bible.Title: Proverbs 2:
Bible.Verse: 3 Yea, if thou criest after knowledge, and liftest up thy voice for understanding;

Bible.Title: Proverbs 2:
Bible.Verse: 4 If thou seekest her as silver, and searchest for her as for hid treasures;

Bible.Title: Proverbs 2:
Bible.Verse: 5 Then shalt thou understand the fear of the LORD, and find the knowledge of God.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 2:
Bible.Verse: 6 For the LORD giveth wisdom: out of his mouth cometh knowledge and understanding.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 2:
Bible.Verse: 7 He layeth up sound wisdom for the righteous: he is a buckler to them that walk uprightly.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 2:
Bible.Verse: 8 He keepeth the paths of judgment, and preserveth the way of his saints.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 2:
Bible.Verse: 9 Then shalt thou understand righteousness, and judgment, and equity; yea, every good path.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 2:
Bible.Verse: 10 When wisdom entereth into thine heart, and knowledge is pleasant unto thy soul;

Bible.Title: Proverbs 2:
Bible.Verse: 11 Discretion shall preserve thee, understanding shall keep thee:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 2:
Bible.Verse: 12 To deliver thee from the way of the evil man, from the man that speaketh froward things;

Bible.Title: Proverbs 2:
Bible.Verse: 13 Who leave the paths of uprightness, to walk in the ways of darkness;

Bible.Title: Proverbs 2:
Bible.Verse: 14 Who rejoice to do evil, and delight in the frowardness of the wicked;

Bible.Title: Proverbs 2:
Bible.Verse: 15 Whose ways are crooked, and they froward in their paths:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 2:
Bible.Verse: 16 To deliver thee from the strange woman, even from the stranger which flattereth with her words;

Bible.Title: Proverbs 2:
Bible.Verse: 17 Which forsaketh the guide of her youth, and forgetteth the covenant of her God.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 2:
Bible.Verse: 18 For her house inclineth unto death, and her paths unto the dead.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 2:
Bible.Verse: 19 None that go unto her return again, neither take they hold of the paths of life.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 2:
Bible.Verse: 20 That thou mayest walk in the way of good men, and keep the paths of the righteous.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 2:
Bible.Verse: 21 For the upright shall dwell in the land, and the perfect shall remain in it.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 2:
Bible.Verse: 22 But the wicked shall be cut off from the earth, and the transgressors shall be rooted out of it.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 1 My son, forget not my law; but let thine heart keep my commandments:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 2 For length of days, and long life, and peace, shall they add to thee.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 3 Let not mercy and truth forsake thee: bind them about thy neck; write them upon the table of thine heart:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 4 So shalt thou find favour and good understanding in the sight of God and man.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 5 Trust in the LORD with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 6 In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 7 Be not wise in thine own eyes: fear the LORD, and depart from evil.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 8 It shall be health to thy navel, and marrow to thy bones.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 9 Honour the LORD with thy substance, and with the firstfruits of all thine increase:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 10 So shall thy barns be filled with plenty, and thy presses shall burst out with new wine.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 11 My son, despise not the chastening of the LORD; neither be weary of his correction:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 12 For whom the LORD loveth he correcteth; even as a father the son in whom he delighteth.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 13 Happy is the man that findeth wisdom, and the man that getteth understanding.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 14 For the merchandise of it is better than the merchandise of silver, and the gain thereof than fine gold.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 15 She is more precious than rubies: and all the things thou canst desire are not to be compared unto her.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 16 Length of days is in her right hand; and in her left hand riches and honour.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 17 Her ways are ways of pleasantness, and all her paths are peace.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 18 She is a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her: and happy is every one that retaineth her.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 19 The LORD by wisdom hath founded the earth; by understanding hath he established the heavens.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 20 By his knowledge the depths are broken up, and the clouds drop down the dew.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 21 My son, let not them depart from thine eyes: keep sound wisdom and discretion:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 22 So shall they be life unto thy soul, and grace to thy neck.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 23 Then shalt thou walk in thy way safely, and thy foot shall not stumble.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 24 When thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid: yea, thou shalt lie down, and thy sleep shall be sweet.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 25 Be not afraid of sudden fear, neither of the desolation of the wicked, when it cometh.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 26 For the LORD shall be thy confidence, and shall keep thy foot from being taken.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 27 Withhold not good from them to whom it is due, when it is in the power of thine hand to do it.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 28 Say not unto thy neighbour, Go, and come again, and to morrow I will give; when thou hast it by thee.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 29 Devise not evil against thy neighbour, seeing he dwelleth securely by thee.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 30 Strive not with a man without cause, if he have done thee no harm.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 31 Envy thou not the oppressor, and choose none of his ways.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 32 For the froward is abomination to the LORD: but his secret is with the righteous.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 33 The curse of the LORD is in the house of the wicked: but he blesseth the habitation of the just.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 34 Surely he scorneth the scorners: but he giveth grace unto the lowly.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 3:
Bible.Verse: 35 The wise shall inherit glory: but shame shall be the promotion of fools.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 4:
Bible.Verse: 1 Hear, ye children, the instruction of a father, and attend to know understanding.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 4:
Bible.Verse: 2 For I give you good doctrine, forsake ye not my law.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 4:
Bible.Verse: 3 For I was my father's son, tender and only beloved in the sight of my mother.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 4:
Bible.Verse: 4 He taught me also, and said unto me, Let thine heart retain my words: keep my commandments, and live.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 4:
Bible.Verse: 5 Get wisdom, get understanding: forget it not; neither decline from the words of my mouth.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 4:
Bible.Verse: 6 Forsake her not, and she shall preserve thee: love her, and she shall keep thee.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 4:
Bible.Verse: 7 Wisdom is the principal thing; therefore get wisdom: and with all thy getting get understanding.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 4:
Bible.Verse: 8 Exalt her, and she shall promote thee: she shall bring thee to honour, when thou dost embrace her.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 4:
Bible.Verse: 9 She shall give to thine head an ornament of grace: a crown of glory shall she deliver to thee.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 4:
Bible.Verse: 10 Hear, O my son, and receive my sayings; and the years of thy life shall be many.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 4:
Bible.Verse: 11 I have taught thee in the way of wisdom; I have led thee in right paths.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 4:
Bible.Verse: 12 When thou goest, thy steps shall not be straitened; and when thou runnest, thou shalt not stumble.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 4:
Bible.Verse: 13 Take fast hold of instruction; let her not go: keep her; for she is thy life.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 4:
Bible.Verse: 14 Enter not into the path of the wicked, and go not in the way of evil men.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 4:
Bible.Verse: 15 Avoid it, pass not by it, turn from it, and pass away.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 4:
Bible.Verse: 16 For they sleep not, except they have done mischief; and their sleep is taken away, unless they cause some to fall.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 4:
Bible.Verse: 17 For they eat the bread of wickedness, and drink the wine of violence.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 4:
Bible.Verse: 18 But the path of the just is as the shining light, that shineth more and more unto the perfect day.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 4:
Bible.Verse: 19 The way of the wicked is as darkness: they know not at what they stumble.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 4:
Bible.Verse: 20 My son, attend to my words; incline thine ear unto my sayings.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 4:
Bible.Verse: 21 Let them not depart from thine eyes; keep them in the midst of thine heart.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 4:
Bible.Verse: 22 For they are life unto those that find them, and health to all their flesh.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 4:
Bible.Verse: 23 Keep thy heart with all diligence; for out of it are the issues of life.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 4:
Bible.Verse: 24 Put away from thee a froward mouth, and perverse lips put far from thee.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 4:
Bible.Verse: 25 Let thine eyes look right on, and let thine eyelids look straight before thee.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 4:
Bible.Verse: 26 Ponder the path of thy feet, and let all thy ways be established.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 4:
Bible.Verse: 27 Turn not to the right hand nor to the left: remove thy foot from evil.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 5:
Bible.Verse: 1 My son, attend unto my wisdom, and bow thine ear to my understanding:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 5:
Bible.Verse: 2 That thou mayest regard discretion, and that thy lips may keep knowledge.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 5:
Bible.Verse: 3 For the lips of a strange woman drop as an honeycomb, and her mouth is smoother than oil:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 5:
Bible.Verse: 4 But her end is bitter as wormwood, sharp as a two-edged sword.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 5:
Bible.Verse: 5 Her feet go down to death; her steps take hold on hell.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 5:
Bible.Verse: 6 Lest thou shouldest ponder the path of life, her ways are moveable, that thou canst not know them.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 5:
Bible.Verse: 7 Hear me now therefore, O ye children, and depart not from the words of my mouth.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 5:
Bible.Verse: 8 Remove thy way far from her, and come not nigh the door of her house:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 5:
Bible.Verse: 9 Lest thou give thine honour unto others, and thy years unto the cruel:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 5:
Bible.Verse: 10 Lest strangers be filled with thy wealth; and thy labours be in the house of a stranger;

Bible.Title: Proverbs 5:
Bible.Verse: 11 And thou mourn at the last, when thy flesh and thy body are consumed,

Bible.Title: Proverbs 5:
Bible.Verse: 12 And say, How have I hated instruction, and my heart despised reproof;

Bible.Title: Proverbs 5:
Bible.Verse: 13 And have not obeyed the voice of my teachers, nor inclined mine ear to them that instructed me!

Bible.Title: Proverbs 5:
Bible.Verse: 14 I was almost in all evil in the midst of the congregation and assembly.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 5:
Bible.Verse: 15 Drink waters out of thine own cistern, and running waters out of thine own well.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 5:
Bible.Verse: 16 Let thy fountains be dispersed abroad, and rivers of waters in the streets.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 5:
Bible.Verse: 17 Let them be only thine own, and not strangers' with thee.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 5:
Bible.Verse: 18 Let thy fountain be blessed: and rejoice with the wife of thy youth.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 5:
Bible.Verse: 19 Let her be as the loving hind and pleasant roe; let her breasts satisfy thee at all times; and be thou ravished always with her love.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 5:
Bible.Verse: 20 And why wilt thou, my son, be ravished with a strange woman, and embrace the bosom of a stranger?

Bible.Title: Proverbs 5:
Bible.Verse: 21 For the ways of man are before the eyes of the LORD, and he pondereth all his goings.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 5:
Bible.Verse: 22 His own iniquities shall take the wicked himself, and he shall be holden with the cords of his sins.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 5:
Bible.Verse: 23 He shall die without instruction; and in the greatness of his folly he shall go astray.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 1 My son, if thou be surety for thy friend, if thou hast stricken thy hand with a stranger,

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 2 Thou art snared with the words of thy mouth, thou art taken with the words of thy mouth.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 3 Do this now, my son, and deliver thyself, when thou art come into the hand of thy friend; go, humble thyself, and make sure thy friend.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 4 Give not sleep to thine eyes, nor slumber to thine eyelids.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 5 Deliver thyself as a roe from the hand of the hunter, and as a bird from the hand of the fowler.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 6 Go to the ant, thou sluggard; consider her ways, and be wise:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 7 Which having no guide, overseer, or ruler,

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 8 Provideth her meat in the summer, and gathereth her food in the harvest.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 9 How long wilt thou sleep, O sluggard? when wilt thou arise out of thy sleep?

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 10 Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 11 So shall thy poverty come as one that travelleth, and thy want as an armed man.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 12 A naughty person, a wicked man, walketh with a froward mouth.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 13 He winketh with his eyes, he speaketh with his feet, he teacheth with his fingers;

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 14 Frowardness is in his heart, he deviseth mischief continually; he soweth discord.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 15 Therefore shall his calamity come suddenly; suddenly shall he be broken without remedy.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 16 These six things doth the LORD hate: yea, seven are an abomination unto him:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 17 A proud look, a lying tongue, and hands that shed innocent blood,

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 18 An heart that deviseth wicked imaginations, feet that be swift in running to mischief,

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 19 A false witness that speaketh lies, and he that soweth discord among brethren.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 20 My son, keep thy father's commandment, and forsake not the law of thy mother:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 21 Bind them continually upon thine heart, and tie them about thy neck.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 22 When thou goest, it shall lead thee; when thou sleepest, it shall keep thee; and when thou awakest, it shall talk with thee.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 23 For the commandment is a lamp; and the law is light; and reproofs of instruction are the way of life:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 24 To keep thee from the evil woman, from the flattery of the tongue of a strange woman.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 25 Lust not after her beauty in thine heart; neither let her take thee with her eyelids.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 26 For by means of a whorish woman a man is brought to a piece of bread: and the adulteress will hunt for the precious life.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 27 Can a man take fire in his bosom, and his clothes not be burned?

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 28 Can one go upon hot coals, and his feet not be burned?

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 29 So he that goeth in to his neighbour's wife; whosoever toucheth her shall not be innocent.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 30 Men do not despise a thief, if he steal to satisfy his soul when he is hungry;

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 31 But if he be found, he shall restore sevenfold; he shall give all the substance of his house.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 32 But whoso committeth adultery with a woman lacketh understanding: he that doeth it destroyeth his own soul.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 33 A wound and dishonour shall he get; and his reproach shall not be wiped away.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 34 For jealousy is the rage of a man: therefore he will not spare in the day of vengeance.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 6:
Bible.Verse: 35 He will not regard any ransom; neither will he rest content, though thou givest many gifts.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 7:
Bible.Verse: 1 My son, keep my words, and lay up my commandments with thee.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 7:
Bible.Verse: 2 Keep my commandments, and live; and my law as the apple of thine eye.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 7:
Bible.Verse: 3 Bind them upon thy fingers, write them upon the table of thine heart.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 7:
Bible.Verse: 4 Say unto wisdom, Thou art my sister; and call understanding thy kinswoman:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 7:
Bible.Verse: 5 That they may keep thee from the strange woman, from the stranger which flattereth with her words.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 7:
Bible.Verse: 6 For at the window of my house I looked through my casement,

Bible.Title: Proverbs 7:
Bible.Verse: 7 And beheld among the simple ones, I discerned among the youths, a young man void of understanding,

Bible.Title: Proverbs 7:
Bible.Verse: 8 Passing through the street near her corner; and he went the way to her house,

Bible.Title: Proverbs 7:
Bible.Verse: 9 In the twilight, in the evening, in the black and dark night:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 7:
Bible.Verse: 10 And, behold, there met him a woman with the attire of an harlot, and subtil of heart.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 7:
Bible.Verse: 11 (She is loud and stubborn; her feet abide not in her house:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 7:
Bible.Verse: 12 Now is she without, now in the streets, and lieth in wait at every corner.)

Bible.Title: Proverbs 7:
Bible.Verse: 13 So she caught him, and kissed him, and with an impudent face said unto him,

Bible.Title: Proverbs 7:
Bible.Verse: 14 I have peace offerings with me; this day have I payed my vows.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 7:
Bible.Verse: 15 Therefore came I forth to meet thee, diligently to seek thy face, and I have found thee.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 7:
Bible.Verse: 16 I have decked my bed with coverings of tapestry, with carved works, with fine linen of Egypt.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 7:
Bible.Verse: 17 I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 7:
Bible.Verse: 18 Come, let us take our fill of love until the morning: let us solace ourselves with loves.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 7:
Bible.Verse: 19 For the goodman is not at home, he is gone a long journey:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 7:
Bible.Verse: 20 He hath taken a bag of money with him, and will come home at the day appointed.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 7:
Bible.Verse: 21 With her much fair speech she caused him to yield, with the flattering of her lips she forced him.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 7:
Bible.Verse: 22 He goeth after her straightway, as an ox goeth to the slaughter, or as a fool to the correction of the stocks;

Bible.Title: Proverbs 7:
Bible.Verse: 23 Till a dart strike through his liver; as a bird hasteth to the snare, and knoweth not that it is for his life.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 7:
Bible.Verse: 24 Hearken unto me now therefore, O ye children, and attend to the words of my mouth.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 7:
Bible.Verse: 25 Let not thine heart decline to her ways, go not astray in her paths.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 7:
Bible.Verse: 26 For she hath cast down many wounded: yea, many strong men have been slain by her.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 7:
Bible.Verse: 27 Her house is the way to hell, going down to the chambers of death.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 1 Doth not wisdom cry? and understanding put forth her voice?

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 2 She standeth in the top of high places, by the way in the places of the paths.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 3 She crieth at the gates, at the entry of the city, at the coming in at the doors.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 4 Unto you, O men, I call; and my voice is to the sons of man.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 5 O ye simple, understand wisdom: and, ye fools, be ye of an understanding heart.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 6 Hear; for I will speak of excellent things; and the opening of my lips shall be right things.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 7 For my mouth shall speak truth; and wickedness is an abomination to my lips.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 8 All the words of my mouth are in righteousness; there is nothing froward or perverse in them.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 9 They are all plain to him that understandeth, and right to them that find knowledge.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 10 Receive my instruction, and not silver; and knowledge rather than choice gold.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 11 For wisdom is better than rubies; and all the things that may be desired are not to be compared to it.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 12 I wisdom dwell with prudence, and find out knowledge of witty inventions.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 13 The fear of the LORD is to hate evil: pride, and arrogancy, and the evil way, and the froward mouth, do I hate.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 14 Counsel is mine, and sound wisdom: I am understanding; I have strength.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 15 By me kings reign, and princes decree justice.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 16 By me princes rule, and nobles, even all the judges of the earth.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 17 I love them that love me; and those that seek me early shall find me.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 18 Riches and honour are with me; yea, durable riches and righteousness.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 19 My fruit is better than gold, yea, than fine gold; and my revenue than choice silver.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 20 I lead in the way of righteousness, in the midst of the paths of judgment:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 21 That I may cause those that love me to inherit substance; and I will fill their treasures.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 22 The LORD possessed me in the beginning of his way, before his works of old.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 23 I was set up from everlasting, from the beginning, or ever the earth was.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 24 When there were no depths, I was brought forth; when there were no fountains abounding with water.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 25 Before the mountains were settled, before the hills was I brought forth:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 26 While as yet he had not made the earth, nor the fields, nor the highest part of the dust of the world.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 27 When he prepared the heavens, I was there: when he set a compass upon the face of the depth:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 28 When he established the clouds above: when he strengthened the fountains of the deep:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 29 When he gave to the sea his decree, that the waters should not pass his commandment: when he appointed the foundations of the earth:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 30 Then I was by him, as one brought up with him: and I was daily his delight, rejoicing always before him;

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 31 Rejoicing in the habitable part of his earth; and my delights were with the sons of men.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 32 Now therefore hearken unto me, O ye children: for blessed are they that keep my ways.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 33 Hear instruction, and be wise, and refuse it not.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 34 Blessed is the man that heareth me, watching daily at my gates, waiting at the posts of my doors.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 35 For whoso findeth me findeth life, and shall obtain favour of the LORD.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 8:
Bible.Verse: 36 But he that sinneth against me wrongeth his own soul: all they that hate me love death.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 9:
Bible.Verse: 1 Wisdom hath builded her house, she hath hewn out her seven pillars:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 9:
Bible.Verse: 2 She hath killed her beasts; she hath mingled her wine; she hath also furnished her table.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 9:
Bible.Verse: 3 She hath sent forth her maidens: she crieth upon the highest places of the city,

Bible.Title: Proverbs 9:
Bible.Verse: 4 Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither: as for him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him,

Bible.Title: Proverbs 9:
Bible.Verse: 5 Come, eat of my bread, and drink of the wine which I have mingled.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 9:
Bible.Verse: 6 Forsake the foolish, and live; and go in the way of understanding.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 9:
Bible.Verse: 7 He that reproveth a scorner getteth to himself shame: and he that rebuketh a wicked man getteth himself a blot.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 9:
Bible.Verse: 8 Reprove not a scorner, lest he hate thee: rebuke a wise man, and he will love thee.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 9:
Bible.Verse: 9 Give instruction to a wise man, and he will be yet wiser: teach a just man, and he will increase in learning.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 9:
Bible.Verse: 10 The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom: and the knowledge of the holy is understanding.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 9:
Bible.Verse: 11 For by me thy days shall be multiplied, and the years of thy life shall be increased.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 9:
Bible.Verse: 12 If thou be wise, thou shalt be wise for thyself: but if thou scornest, thou alone shalt bear it.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 9:
Bible.Verse: 13 A foolish woman is clamorous: she is simple, and knoweth nothing.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 9:
Bible.Verse: 14 For she sitteth at the door of her house, on a seat in the high places of the city,

Bible.Title: Proverbs 9:
Bible.Verse: 15 To call passengers who go right on their ways:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 9:
Bible.Verse: 16 Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither: and as for him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him,

Bible.Title: Proverbs 9:
Bible.Verse: 17 Stolen waters are sweet, and bread eaten in secret is pleasant.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 9:
Bible.Verse: 18 But he knoweth not that the dead are there; and that her guests are in the depths of hell.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 10:
Bible.Verse: 1 The proverbs of Solomon. A wise son maketh a glad father: but a foolish son is the heaviness of his mother.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 10:
Bible.Verse: 2 Treasures of wickedness profit nothing: but righteousness delivereth from death.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 10:
Bible.Verse: 3 The LORD will not suffer the soul of the righteous to famish: but he casteth away the substance of the wicked.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 10:
Bible.Verse: 4 He becometh poor that dealeth with a slack hand: but the hand of the diligent maketh rich.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 10:
Bible.Verse: 5 He that gathereth in summer is a wise son: but he that sleepeth in harvest is a son that causeth shame.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 10:
Bible.Verse: 6 Blessings are upon the head of the just: but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 10:
Bible.Verse: 7 The memory of the just is blessed: but the name of the wicked shall rot.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 10:
Bible.Verse: 8 The wise in heart will receive commandments: but a prating fool shall fall.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 10:
Bible.Verse: 9 He that walketh uprightly walketh surely: but he that perverteth his ways shall be known.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 10:
Bible.Verse: 10 He that winketh with the eye causeth sorrow: but a prating fool shall fall.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 10:
Bible.Verse: 11 The mouth of a righteous man is a well of life: but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 10:
Bible.Verse: 12 Hatred stirreth up strifes: but love covereth all sins.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 10:
Bible.Verse: 13 In the lips of him that hath understanding wisdom is found: but a rod is for the back of him that is void of understanding.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 10:
Bible.Verse: 14 Wise men lay up knowledge: but the mouth of the foolish is near destruction.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 10:
Bible.Verse: 15 The rich man's wealth is his strong city: the destruction of the poor is their poverty.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 10:
Bible.Verse: 16 The labour of the righteous tendeth to life: the fruit of the wicked to sin.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 10:
Bible.Verse: 17 He is in the way of life that keepeth instruction: but he that refuseth reproof erreth.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 10:
Bible.Verse: 18 He that hideth hatred with lying lips, and he that uttereth a slander, is a fool.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 10:
Bible.Verse: 19 In the multitude of words there wanteth not sin: but he that refraineth his lips is wise.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 10:
Bible.Verse: 20 The tongue of the just is as choice silver: the heart of the wicked is little worth.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 10:
Bible.Verse: 21 The lips of the righteous feed many: but fools die for want of wisdom.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 10:
Bible.Verse: 22 The blessing of the LORD, it maketh rich, and he addeth no sorrow with it.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 10:
Bible.Verse: 23 It is as sport to a fool to do mischief: but a man of understanding hath wisdom.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 10:
Bible.Verse: 24 The fear of the wicked, it shall come upon him: but the desire of the righteous shall be granted.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 10:
Bible.Verse: 25 As the whirlwind passeth, so is the wicked no more: but the righteous is an everlasting foundation.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 10:
Bible.Verse: 26 As vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes, so is the sluggard to them that send him.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 10:
Bible.Verse: 27 The fear of the LORD prolongeth days: but the years of the wicked shall be shortened.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 10:
Bible.Verse: 28 The hope of the righteous shall be gladness: but the expectation of the wicked shall perish.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 10:
Bible.Verse: 29 The way of the LORD is strength to the upright: but destruction shall be to the workers of iniquity.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 10:
Bible.Verse: 30 The righteous shall never be removed: but the wicked shall not inhabit the earth.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 10:
Bible.Verse: 31 The mouth of the just bringeth forth wisdom: but the froward tongue shall be cut out.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 10:
Bible.Verse: 32 The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable: but the mouth of the wicked speaketh frowardness.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 11:
Bible.Verse: 1 A false balance is abomination to the LORD: but a just weight is his delight.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 11:
Bible.Verse: 2 When pride cometh, then cometh shame: but with the lowly is wisdom.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 11:
Bible.Verse: 3 The integrity of the upright shall guide them: but the perverseness of transgressors shall destroy them.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 11:
Bible.Verse: 4 Riches profit not in the day of wrath: but righteousness delivereth from death.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 11:
Bible.Verse: 5 The righteousness of the perfect shall direct his way: but the wicked shall fall by his own wickedness.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 11:
Bible.Verse: 6 The righteousness of the upright shall deliver them: but transgressors shall be taken in their own naughtiness.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 11:
Bible.Verse: 7 When a wicked man dieth, his expectation shall perish: and the hope of unjust men perisheth.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 11:
Bible.Verse: 8 The righteous is delivered out of trouble, and the wicked cometh in his stead.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 11:
Bible.Verse: 9 An hypocrite with his mouth destroyeth his neighbour: but through knowledge shall the just be delivered.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 11:
Bible.Verse: 10 When it goeth well with the righteous, the city rejoiceth: and when the wicked perish, there is shouting.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 11:
Bible.Verse: 11 By the blessing of the upright the city is exalted: but it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 11:
Bible.Verse: 12 He that is void of wisdom despiseth his neighbour: but a man of understanding holdeth his peace.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 11:
Bible.Verse: 13 A talebearer revealeth secrets: but he that is of a faithful spirit concealeth the matter.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 11:
Bible.Verse: 14 Where no counsel is, the people fall: but in the multitude of counsellors there is safety.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 11:
Bible.Verse: 15 He that is surety for a stranger shall smart for it: and he that hateth suretiship is sure.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 11:
Bible.Verse: 16 A gracious woman retaineth honour: and strong men retain riches.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 11:
Bible.Verse: 17 The merciful man doeth good to his own soul: but he that is cruel troubleth his own flesh.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 11:
Bible.Verse: 18 The wicked worketh a deceitful work: but to him that soweth righteousness shall be a sure reward.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 11:
Bible.Verse: 19 As righteousness tendeth to life: so he that pursueth evil pursueth it to his own death.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 11:
Bible.Verse: 20 They that are of a froward heart are abomination to the LORD: but such as are upright in their way are his delight.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 11:
Bible.Verse: 21 Though hand join in hand, the wicked shall not be unpunished: but the seed of the righteous shall be delivered.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 11:
Bible.Verse: 22 As a jewel of gold in a swine's snout, so is a fair woman which is without discretion.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 11:
Bible.Verse: 23 The desire of the righteous is only good: but the expectation of the wicked is wrath.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 11:
Bible.Verse: 24 There is that scattereth, and yet increaseth; and there is that withholdeth more than is meet, but it tendeth to poverty.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 11:
Bible.Verse: 25 The liberal soul shall be made fat: and he that watereth shall be watered also himself.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 11:
Bible.Verse: 26 He that withholdeth corn, the people shall curse him: but blessing shall be upon the head of him that selleth it.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 11:
Bible.Verse: 27 He that diligently seeketh good procureth favour: but he that seeketh mischief, it shall come unto him.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 11:
Bible.Verse: 28 He that trusteth in his riches shall fall; but the righteous shall flourish as a branch.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 11:
Bible.Verse: 29 He that troubleth his own house shall inherit the wind: and the fool shall be servant to the wise of heart.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 11:
Bible.Verse: 30 The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life; and he that winneth souls is wise.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 11:
Bible.Verse: 31 Behold, the righteous shall be recompensed in the earth: much more the wicked and the sinner.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 12:
Bible.Verse: 1 Whoso loveth instruction loveth knowledge: but he that hateth reproof is brutish.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 12:
Bible.Verse: 2 A good man obtaineth favour of the LORD: but a man of wicked devices will he condemn.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 12:
Bible.Verse: 3 A man shall not be established by wickedness: but the root of the righteous shall not be moved.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 12:
Bible.Verse: 4 A virtuous woman is a crown to her husband: but she that maketh ashamed is as rottenness in his bones.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 12:
Bible.Verse: 5 The thoughts of the righteous are right: but the counsels of the wicked are deceit.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 12:
Bible.Verse: 6 The words of the wicked are to lie in wait for blood: but the mouth of the upright shall deliver them.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 12:
Bible.Verse: 7 The wicked are overthrown, and are not: but the house of the righteous shall stand.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 12:
Bible.Verse: 8 A man shall be commended according to his wisdom: but he that is of a perverse heart shall be despised.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 12:
Bible.Verse: 9 He that is despised, and hath a servant, is better than he that honoureth himself, and lacketh bread.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 12:
Bible.Verse: 10 A righteous man regardeth the life of his beast: but the tender mercies of the wicked are cruel.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 12:
Bible.Verse: 11 He that tilleth his land shall be satisfied with bread: but he that followeth vain persons is void of understanding.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 12:
Bible.Verse: 12 The wicked desireth the net of evil men: but the root of the righteous yieldeth fruit.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 12:
Bible.Verse: 13 The wicked is snared by the transgression of his lips: but the just shall come out of trouble.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 12:
Bible.Verse: 14 A man shall be satisfied with good by the fruit of his mouth: and the recompence of a man's hands shall be rendered unto him.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 12:
Bible.Verse: 15 The way of a fool is right in his own eyes: but he that hearkeneth unto counsel is wise.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 12:
Bible.Verse: 16 A fool's wrath is presently known: but a prudent man covereth shame.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 12:
Bible.Verse: 17 He that speaketh truth sheweth forth righteousness: but a false witness deceit.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 12:
Bible.Verse: 18 There is that speaketh like the piercings of a sword: but the tongue of the wise is health.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 12:
Bible.Verse: 19 The lip of truth shall be established for ever: but a lying tongue is but for a moment.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 12:
Bible.Verse: 20 Deceit is in the heart of them that imagine evil: but to the counsellors of peace is joy.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 12:
Bible.Verse: 21 There shall no evil happen to the just: but the wicked shall be filled with mischief.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 12:
Bible.Verse: 22 Lying lips are abomination to the LORD: but they that deal truly are his delight.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 12:
Bible.Verse: 23 A prudent man concealeth knowledge: but the heart of fools proclaimeth foolishness.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 12:
Bible.Verse: 24 The hand of the diligent shall bear rule: but the slothful shall be under tribute.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 12:
Bible.Verse: 25 Heaviness in the heart of man maketh it stoop: but a good word maketh it glad.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 12:
Bible.Verse: 26 The righteous is more excellent than his neighbour: but the way of the wicked seduceth them.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 12:
Bible.Verse: 27 The slothful man roasteth not that which he took in hunting: but the substance of a diligent man is precious.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 12:
Bible.Verse: 28 In the way of righteousness is life: and in the pathway thereof there is no death.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 13:
Bible.Verse: 1 A wise son heareth his father's instruction: but a scorner heareth not rebuke.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 13:
Bible.Verse: 2 A man shall eat good by the fruit of his mouth: but the soul of the transgressors shall eat violence.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 13:
Bible.Verse: 3 He that keepeth his mouth keepeth his life: but he that openeth wide his lips shall have destruction.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 13:
Bible.Verse: 4 The soul of the sluggard desireth, and hath nothing: but the soul of the diligent shall be made fat.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 13:
Bible.Verse: 5 A righteous man hateth lying: but a wicked man is loathsome, and cometh to shame.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 13:
Bible.Verse: 6 Righteousness keepeth him that is upright in the way: but wickedness overthroweth the sinner.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 13:
Bible.Verse: 7 There is that maketh himself rich, yet hath nothing: there is that maketh himself poor, yet hath great riches.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 13:
Bible.Verse: 8 The ransom of a man's life are his riches: but the poor heareth not rebuke.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 13:
Bible.Verse: 9 The light of the righteous rejoiceth: but the lamp of the wicked shall be put out.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 13:
Bible.Verse: 10 Only by pride cometh contention: but with the well advised is wisdom.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 13:
Bible.Verse: 11 Wealth gotten by vanity shall be diminished: but he that gathereth by labour shall increase.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 13:
Bible.Verse: 12 Hope deferred maketh the heart sick: but when the desire cometh, it is a tree of life.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 13:
Bible.Verse: 13 Whoso despiseth the word shall be destroyed: but he that feareth the commandment shall be rewarded.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 13:
Bible.Verse: 14 The law of the wise is a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 13:
Bible.Verse: 15 Good understanding giveth favour: but the way of transgressors is hard.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 13:
Bible.Verse: 16 Every prudent man dealeth with knowledge: but a fool layeth open his folly.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 13:
Bible.Verse: 17 A wicked messenger falleth into mischief: but a faithful ambassador is health.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 13:
Bible.Verse: 18 Poverty and shame shall be to him that refuseth instruction: but he that regardeth reproof shall be honoured.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 13:
Bible.Verse: 19 The desire accomplished is sweet to the soul: but it is abomination to fools to depart from evil.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 13:
Bible.Verse: 20 He that walketh with wise men shall be wise: but a companion of fools shall be destroyed.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 13:
Bible.Verse: 21 Evil pursueth sinners: but to the righteous good shall be repayed.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 13:
Bible.Verse: 22 A good man leaveth an inheritance to his children's children: and the wealth of the sinner is laid up for the just.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 13:
Bible.Verse: 23 Much food is in the tillage of the poor: but there is that is destroyed for want of judgment.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 13:
Bible.Verse: 24 He that spareth his rod hateth his son: but he that loveth him chasteneth him betimes.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 13:
Bible.Verse: 25 The righteous eateth to the satisfying of his soul: but the belly of the wicked shall want.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 1 Every wise woman buildeth her house: but the foolish plucketh it down with her hands.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 2 He that walketh in his uprightness feareth the LORD: but he that is perverse in his ways despiseth him.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 3 In the mouth of the foolish is a rod of pride: but the lips of the wise shall preserve them.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 4 Where no oxen are, the crib is clean: but much increase is by the strength of the ox.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 5 A faithful witness will not lie: but a false witness will utter lies.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 6 A scorner seeketh wisdom, and findeth it not: but knowledge is easy unto him that understandeth.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 7 Go from the presence of a foolish man, when thou perceivest not in him the lips of knowledge.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 8 The wisdom of the prudent is to understand his way: but the folly of fools is deceit.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 9 Fools make a mock at sin: but among the righteous there is favour.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 10 The heart knoweth his own bitterness; and a stranger doth not intermeddle with his joy.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 11 The house of the wicked shall be overthrown: but the tabernacle of the upright shall flourish.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 12 There is a way which seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 13 Even in laughter the heart is sorrowful; and the end of that mirth is heaviness.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 14 The backslider in heart shall be filled with his own ways: and a good man shall be satisfied from himself.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 15 The simple believeth every word: but the prudent man looketh well to his going.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 16 A wise man feareth, and departeth from evil: but the fool rageth, and is confident.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 17 He that is soon angry dealeth foolishly: and a man of wicked devices is hated.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 18 The simple inherit folly: but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 19 The evil bow before the good; and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 20 The poor is hated even of his own neighbour: but the rich hath many friends.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 21 He that despiseth his neighbour sinneth: but he that hath mercy on the poor, happy is he.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 22 Do they not err that devise evil? but mercy and truth shall be to them that devise good.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 23 In all labour there is profit: but the talk of the lips tendeth only to penury.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 24 The crown of the wise is their riches: but the foolishness of fools is folly.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 25 A true witness delivereth souls: but a deceitful witness speaketh lies.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 26 In the fear of the LORD is strong confidence: and his children shall have a place of refuge.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 27 The fear of the LORD is a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 28 In the multitude of people is the king's honour: but in the want of people is the destruction of the prince.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 29 He that is slow to wrath is of great understanding: but he that is hasty of spirit exalteth folly.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 30 A sound heart is the life of the flesh: but envy the rottenness of the bones.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 31 He that oppresseth the poor reproacheth his Maker: but he that honoureth him hath mercy on the poor.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 32 The wicked is driven away in his wickedness: but the righteous hath hope in his death.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 33 Wisdom resteth in the heart of him that hath understanding: but that which is in the midst of fools is made known.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 34 Righteousness exalteth a nation: but sin is a reproach to any people.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 14:
Bible.Verse: 35 The king's favour is toward a wise servant: but his wrath is against him that causeth shame.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 15:
Bible.Verse: 1 A soft answer turneth away wrath: but grievous words stir up anger.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 15:
Bible.Verse: 2 The tongue of the wise useth knowledge aright: but the mouth of fools poureth out foolishness.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 15:
Bible.Verse: 3 The eyes of the LORD are in every place, beholding the evil and the good.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 15:
Bible.Verse: 4 A wholesome tongue is a tree of life: but perverseness therein is a breach in the spirit.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 15:
Bible.Verse: 5 A fool despiseth his father's instruction: but he that regardeth reproof is prudent.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 15:
Bible.Verse: 6 In the house of the righteous is much treasure: but in the revenues of the wicked is trouble.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 15:
Bible.Verse: 7 The lips of the wise disperse knowledge: but the heart of the foolish doeth not so.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 15:
Bible.Verse: 8 The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to the LORD: but the prayer of the upright is his delight.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 15:
Bible.Verse: 9 The way of the wicked is an abomination unto the LORD: but he loveth him that followeth after righteousness.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 15:
Bible.Verse: 10 Correction is grievous unto him that forsaketh the way: and he that hateth reproof shall die.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 15:
Bible.Verse: 11 Hell and destruction are before the LORD: how much more then the hearts of the children of men?

Bible.Title: Proverbs 15:
Bible.Verse: 12 A scorner loveth not one that reproveth him: neither will he go unto the wise.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 15:
Bible.Verse: 13 A merry heart maketh a cheerful countenance: but by sorrow of the heart the spirit is broken.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 15:
Bible.Verse: 14 The heart of him that hath understanding seeketh knowledge: but the mouth of fools feedeth on foolishness.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 15:
Bible.Verse: 15 All the days of the afflicted are evil: but he that is of a merry heart hath a continual feast.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 15:
Bible.Verse: 16 Better is little with the fear of the LORD than great treasure and trouble therewith.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 15:
Bible.Verse: 17 Better is a dinner of herbs where love is, than a stalled ox and hatred therewith.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 15:
Bible.Verse: 18 A wrathful man stirreth up strife: but he that is slow to anger appeaseth strife.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 15:
Bible.Verse: 19 The way of the slothful man is as an hedge of thorns: but the way of the righteous is made plain.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 15:
Bible.Verse: 20 A wise son maketh a glad father: but a foolish man despiseth his mother.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 15:
Bible.Verse: 21 Folly is joy to him that is destitute of wisdom: but a man of understanding walketh uprightly.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 15:
Bible.Verse: 22 Without counsel purposes are disappointed: but in the multitude of counsellors they are established.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 15:
Bible.Verse: 23 A man hath joy by the answer of his mouth: and a word spoken in due season, how good is it!

Bible.Title: Proverbs 15:
Bible.Verse: 24 The way of life is above to the wise, that he may depart from hell beneath.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 15:
Bible.Verse: 25 The LORD will destroy the house of the proud: but he will establish the border of the widow.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 15:
Bible.Verse: 26 The thoughts of the wicked are an abomination to the LORD: but the words of the pure are pleasant words.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 15:
Bible.Verse: 27 He that is greedy of gain troubleth his own house; but he that hateth gifts shall live.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 15:
Bible.Verse: 28 The heart of the righteous studieth to answer: but the mouth of the wicked poureth out evil things.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 15:
Bible.Verse: 29 The LORD is far from the wicked: but he heareth the prayer of the righteous.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 15:
Bible.Verse: 30 The light of the eyes rejoiceth the heart: and a good report maketh the bones fat.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 15:
Bible.Verse: 31 The ear that heareth the reproof of life abideth among the wise.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 15:
Bible.Verse: 32 He that refuseth instruction despiseth his own soul: but he that heareth reproof getteth understanding.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 15:
Bible.Verse: 33 The fear of the LORD is the instruction of wisdom; and before honour is humility.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 16:
Bible.Verse: 1 The preparations of the heart in man, and the answer of the tongue, is from the LORD.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 16:
Bible.Verse: 2 All the ways of a man are clean in his own eyes; but the LORD weigheth the spirits.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 16:
Bible.Verse: 3 Commit thy works unto the LORD, and thy thoughts shall be established.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 16:
Bible.Verse: 4 The LORD hath made all things for himself: yea, even the wicked for the day of evil.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 16:
Bible.Verse: 5 Every one that is proud in heart is an abomination to the LORD: though hand join in hand, he shall not be unpunished.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 16:
Bible.Verse: 6 By mercy and truth iniquity is purged: and by the fear of the LORD men depart from evil.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 16:
Bible.Verse: 7 When a man's ways please the LORD, he maketh even his enemies to be at peace with him.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 16:
Bible.Verse: 8 Better is a little with righteousness than great revenues without right.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 16:
Bible.Verse: 9 A man's heart deviseth his way: but the LORD directeth his steps.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 16:
Bible.Verse: 10 A divine sentence is in the lips of the king: his mouth transgresseth not in judgment.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 16:
Bible.Verse: 11 A just weight and balance are the LORD's: all the weights of the bag are his work.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 16:
Bible.Verse: 12 It is an abomination to kings to commit wickedness: for the throne is established by righteousness.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 16:
Bible.Verse: 13 Righteous lips are the delight of kings; and they love him that speaketh right.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 16:
Bible.Verse: 14 The wrath of a king is as messengers of death: but a wise man will pacify it.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 16:
Bible.Verse: 15 In the light of the king's countenance is life; and his favour is as a cloud of the latter rain.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 16:
Bible.Verse: 16 How much better is it to get wisdom than gold! and to get understanding rather to be chosen than silver!

Bible.Title: Proverbs 16:
Bible.Verse: 17 The highway of the upright is to depart from evil: he that keepeth his way preserveth his soul.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 16:
Bible.Verse: 18 Pride goeth before destruction, and an haughty spirit before a fall.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 16:
Bible.Verse: 19 Better it is to be of an humble spirit with the lowly, than to divide the spoil with the proud.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 16:
Bible.Verse: 20 He that handleth a matter wisely shall find good: and whoso trusteth in the LORD, happy is he.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 16:
Bible.Verse: 21 The wise in heart shall be called prudent: and the sweetness of the lips increaseth learning.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 16:
Bible.Verse: 22 Understanding is a wellspring of life unto him that hath it: but the instruction of fools is folly.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 16:
Bible.Verse: 23 The heart of the wise teacheth his mouth, and addeth learning to his lips.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 16:
Bible.Verse: 24 Pleasant words are as an honeycomb, sweet to the soul, and health to the bones.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 16:
Bible.Verse: 25 There is a way that seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 16:
Bible.Verse: 26 He that laboureth laboureth for himself; for his mouth craveth it of him.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 16:
Bible.Verse: 27 An ungodly man diggeth up evil: and in his lips there is as a burning fire.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 16:
Bible.Verse: 28 A froward man soweth strife: and a whisperer separateth chief friends.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 16:
Bible.Verse: 29 A violent man enticeth his neighbour, and leadeth him into the way that is not good.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 16:
Bible.Verse: 30 He shutteth his eyes to devise froward things: moving his lips he bringeth evil to pass.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 16:
Bible.Verse: 31 The hoary head is a crown of glory, if it be found in the way of righteousness.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 16:
Bible.Verse: 32 He that is slow to anger is better than the mighty; and he that ruleth his spirit than he that taketh a city.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 16:
Bible.Verse: 33 The lot is cast into the lap; but the whole disposing thereof is of the LORD.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 17:
Bible.Verse: 1 Better is a dry morsel, and quietness therewith, than an house full of sacrifices with strife.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 17:
Bible.Verse: 2 A wise servant shall have rule over a son that causeth shame, and shall have part of the inheritance among the brethren.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 17:
Bible.Verse: 3 The fining pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold: but the LORD trieth the hearts.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 17:
Bible.Verse: 4 A wicked doer giveth heed to false lips; and a liar giveth ear to a naughty tongue.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 17:
Bible.Verse: 5 Whoso mocketh the poor reproacheth his Maker: and he that is glad at calamities shall not be unpunished.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 17:
Bible.Verse: 6 Children's children are the crown of old men; and the glory of children are their fathers.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 17:
Bible.Verse: 7 Excellent speech becometh not a fool: much less do lying lips a prince.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 17:
Bible.Verse: 8 A gift is as a precious stone in the eyes of him that hath it: whithersoever it turneth, it prospereth.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 17:
Bible.Verse: 9 He that covereth a transgression seeketh love; but he that repeateth a matter separateth very friends.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 17:
Bible.Verse: 10 A reproof entereth more into a wise man than an hundred stripes into a fool.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 17:
Bible.Verse: 11 An evil man seeketh only rebellion: therefore a cruel messenger shall be sent against him.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 17:
Bible.Verse: 12 Let a bear robbed of her whelps meet a man, rather than a fool in his folly.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 17:
Bible.Verse: 13 Whoso rewardeth evil for good, evil shall not depart from his house.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 17:
Bible.Verse: 14 The beginning of strife is as when one letteth out water: therefore leave off contention, before it be meddled with.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 17:
Bible.Verse: 15 He that justifieth the wicked, and he that condemneth the just, even they both are abomination to the LORD.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 17:
Bible.Verse: 16 Wherefore is there a price in the hand of a fool to get wisdom, seeing he hath no heart to it?

Bible.Title: Proverbs 17:
Bible.Verse: 17 A friend loveth at all times, and a brother is born for adversity.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 17:
Bible.Verse: 18 A man void of understanding striketh hands, and becometh surety in the presence of his friend.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 17:
Bible.Verse: 19 He loveth transgression that loveth strife: and he that exalteth his gate seeketh destruction.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 17:
Bible.Verse: 20 He that hath a froward heart findeth no good: and he that hath a perverse tongue falleth into mischief.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 17:
Bible.Verse: 21 He that begetteth a fool doeth it to his sorrow: and the father of a fool hath no joy.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 17:
Bible.Verse: 22 A merry heart doeth good like a medicine: but a broken spirit drieth the bones.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 17:
Bible.Verse: 23 A wicked man taketh a gift out of the bosom to pervert the ways of judgment.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 17:
Bible.Verse: 24 Wisdom is before him that hath understanding; but the eyes of a fool are in the ends of the earth.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 17:
Bible.Verse: 25 A foolish son is a grief to his father, and bitterness to her that bare him.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 17:
Bible.Verse: 26 Also to punish the just is not good, nor to strike princes for equity.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 17:
Bible.Verse: 27 He that hath knowledge spareth his words: and a man of understanding is of an excellent spirit.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 17:
Bible.Verse: 28 Even a fool, when he holdeth his peace, is counted wise: and he that shutteth his lips is esteemed a man of understanding.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 18:
Bible.Verse: 1 Through desire a man, having separated himself, seeketh and intermeddleth with all wisdom.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 18:
Bible.Verse: 2 A fool hath no delight in understanding, but that his heart may discover itself.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 18:
Bible.Verse: 3 When the wicked cometh, then cometh also contempt, and with ignominy reproach.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 18:
Bible.Verse: 4 The words of a man's mouth are as deep waters, and the wellspring of wisdom as a flowing brook.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 18:
Bible.Verse: 5 It is not good to accept the person of the wicked, to overthrow the righteous in judgment.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 18:
Bible.Verse: 6 A fool's lips enter into contention, and his mouth calleth for strokes.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 18:
Bible.Verse: 7 A fool's mouth is his destruction, and his lips are the snare of his soul.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 18:
Bible.Verse: 8 The words of a talebearer are as wounds, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 18:
Bible.Verse: 9 He also that is slothful in his work is brother to him that is a great waster.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 18:
Bible.Verse: 10 The name of the LORD is a strong tower: the righteous runneth into it, and is safe.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 18:
Bible.Verse: 11 The rich man's wealth is his strong city, and as an high wall in his own conceit.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 18:
Bible.Verse: 12 Before destruction the heart of man is haughty, and before honour is humility.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 18:
Bible.Verse: 13 He that answereth a matter before he heareth it, it is folly and shame unto him.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 18:
Bible.Verse: 14 The spirit of a man will sustain his infirmity; but a wounded spirit who can bear?

Bible.Title: Proverbs 18:
Bible.Verse: 15 The heart of the prudent getteth knowledge; and the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 18:
Bible.Verse: 16 A man's gift maketh room for him, and bringeth him before great men.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 18:
Bible.Verse: 17 He that is first in his own cause seemeth just; but his neighbour cometh and searcheth him.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 18:
Bible.Verse: 18 The lot causeth contentions to cease, and parteth between the mighty.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 18:
Bible.Verse: 19 A brother offended is harder to be won than a strong city: and their contentions are like the bars of a castle.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 18:
Bible.Verse: 20 A man's belly shall be satisfied with the fruit of his mouth; and with the increase of his lips shall he be filled.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 18:
Bible.Verse: 21 Death and life are in the power of the tongue: and they that love it shall eat the fruit thereof.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 18:
Bible.Verse: 22 Whoso findeth a wife findeth a good thing, and obtaineth favour of the LORD.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 18:
Bible.Verse: 23 The poor useth intreaties; but the rich answereth roughly.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 18:
Bible.Verse: 24 A man that hath friends must shew himself friendly: and there is a friend that sticketh closer than a brother.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 19:
Bible.Verse: 1 Better is the poor that walketh in his integrity, than he that is perverse in his lips, and is a fool.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 19:
Bible.Verse: 2 Also, that the soul be without knowledge, it is not good; and he that hasteth with his feet sinneth.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 19:
Bible.Verse: 3 The foolishness of man perverteth his way: and his heart fretteth against the LORD.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 19:
Bible.Verse: 4 Wealth maketh many friends; but the poor is separated from his neighbour.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 19:
Bible.Verse: 5 A false witness shall not be unpunished, and he that speaketh lies shall not escape.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 19:
Bible.Verse: 6 Many will intreat the favour of the prince: and every man is a friend to him that giveth gifts.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 19:
Bible.Verse: 7 All the brethren of the poor do hate him: how much more do his friends go far from him? he pursueth them with words, yet they are wanting to him.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 19:
Bible.Verse: 8 He that getteth wisdom loveth his own soul: he that keepeth understanding shall find good.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 19:
Bible.Verse: 9 A false witness shall not be unpunished, and he that speaketh lies shall perish.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 19:
Bible.Verse: 10 Delight is not seemly for a fool; much less for a servant to have rule over princes.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 19:
Bible.Verse: 11 The discretion of a man deferreth his anger; and it is his glory to pass over a transgression.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 19:
Bible.Verse: 12 The king's wrath is as the roaring of a lion; but his favour is as dew upon the grass.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 19:
Bible.Verse: 13 A foolish son is the calamity of his father: and the contentions of a wife are a continual dropping.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 19:
Bible.Verse: 14 House and riches are the inheritance of fathers: and a prudent wife is from the LORD.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 19:
Bible.Verse: 15 Slothfulness casteth into a deep sleep; and an idle soul shall suffer hunger.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 19:
Bible.Verse: 16 He that keepeth the commandment keepeth his own soul; but he that despiseth his ways shall die.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 19:
Bible.Verse: 17 He that hath pity upon the poor lendeth unto the LORD; and that which he hath given will he pay him again.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 19:
Bible.Verse: 18 Chasten thy son while there is hope, and let not thy soul spare for his crying.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 19:
Bible.Verse: 19 A man of great wrath shall suffer punishment: for if thou deliver him, yet thou must do it again.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 19:
Bible.Verse: 20 Hear counsel, and receive instruction, that thou mayest be wise in thy latter end.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 19:
Bible.Verse: 21 There are many devices in a man's heart; nevertheless the counsel of the LORD, that shall stand.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 19:
Bible.Verse: 22 The desire of a man is his kindness: and a poor man is better than a liar.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 19:
Bible.Verse: 23 The fear of the LORD tendeth to life: and he that hath it shall abide satisfied; he shall not be visited with evil.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 19:
Bible.Verse: 24 A slothful man hideth his hand in his bosom, and will not so much as bring it to his mouth again.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 19:
Bible.Verse: 25 Smite a scorner, and the simple will beware: and reprove one that hath understanding, and he will understand knowledge.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 19:
Bible.Verse: 26 He that wasteth his father, and chaseth away his mother, is a son that causeth shame, and bringeth reproach.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 19:
Bible.Verse: 27 Cease, my son, to hear the instruction that causeth to err from the words of knowledge.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 19:
Bible.Verse: 28 An ungodly witness scorneth judgment: and the mouth of the wicked devoureth iniquity.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 19:
Bible.Verse: 29 Judgments are prepared for scorners, and stripes for the back of fools.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 20:
Bible.Verse: 1 Wine is a mocker, strong drink is raging: and whosoever is deceived thereby is not wise.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 20:
Bible.Verse: 2 The fear of a king is as the roaring of a lion: whoso provoketh him to anger sinneth against his own soul.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 20:
Bible.Verse: 3 It is an honour for a man to cease from strife: but every fool will be meddling.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 20:
Bible.Verse: 4 The sluggard will not plow by reason of the cold; therefore shall he beg in harvest, and have nothing.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 20:
Bible.Verse: 5 Counsel in the heart of man is like deep water; but a man of understanding will draw it out.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 20:
Bible.Verse: 6 Most men will proclaim every one his own goodness: but a faithful man who can find?

Bible.Title: Proverbs 20:
Bible.Verse: 7 The just man walketh in his integrity: his children are blessed after him.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 20:
Bible.Verse: 8 A king that sitteth in the throne of judgment scattereth away all evil with his eyes.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 20:
Bible.Verse: 9 Who can say, I have made my heart clean, I am pure from my sin?

Bible.Title: Proverbs 20:
Bible.Verse: 10 Divers weights, and divers measures, both of them are alike abomination to the LORD.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 20:
Bible.Verse: 11 Even a child is known by his doings, whether his work be pure, and whether it be right.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 20:
Bible.Verse: 12 The hearing ear, and the seeing eye, the LORD hath made even both of them.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 20:
Bible.Verse: 13 Love not sleep, lest thou come to poverty; open thine eyes, and thou shalt be satisfied with bread.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 20:
Bible.Verse: 14 It is naught, it is naught, saith the buyer: but when he is gone his way, then he boasteth.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 20:
Bible.Verse: 15 There is gold, and a multitude of rubies: but the lips of knowledge are a precious jewel.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 20:
Bible.Verse: 16 Take his garment that is surety for a stranger: and take a pledge of him for a strange woman.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 20:
Bible.Verse: 17 Bread of deceit is sweet to a man; but afterwards his mouth shall be filled with gravel.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 20:
Bible.Verse: 18 Every purpose is established by counsel: and with good advice make war.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 20:
Bible.Verse: 19 He that goeth about as a talebearer revealeth secrets: therefore meddle not with him that flattereth with his lips.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 20:
Bible.Verse: 20 Whoso curseth his father or his mother, his lamp shall be put out in obscure darkness.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 20:
Bible.Verse: 21 An inheritance may be gotten hastily at the beginning; but the end thereof shall not be blessed.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 20:
Bible.Verse: 22 Say not thou, I will recompense evil; but wait on the LORD, and he shall save thee.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 20:
Bible.Verse: 23 Divers weights are an abomination unto the LORD; and a false balance is not good.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 20:
Bible.Verse: 24 Man's goings are of the LORD; how can a man then understand his own way?

Bible.Title: Proverbs 20:
Bible.Verse: 25 It is a snare to the man who devoureth that which is holy, and after vows to make enquiry.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 20:
Bible.Verse: 26 A wise king scattereth the wicked, and bringeth the wheel over them.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 20:
Bible.Verse: 27 The spirit of man is the candle of the LORD, searching all the inward parts of the belly.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 20:
Bible.Verse: 28 Mercy and truth preserve the king: and his throne is upholden by mercy.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 20:
Bible.Verse: 29 The glory of young men is their strength: and the beauty of old men is the grey head.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 20:
Bible.Verse: 30 The blueness of a wound cleanseth away evil: so do stripes the inward parts of the belly.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 21:
Bible.Verse: 1 The king's heart is in the hand of the LORD, as the rivers of water: he turneth it whithersoever he will.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 21:
Bible.Verse: 2 Every way of a man is right in his own eyes: but the LORD pondereth the hearts.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 21:
Bible.Verse: 3 To do justice and judgment is more acceptable to the LORD than sacrifice.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 21:
Bible.Verse: 4 An high look, and a proud heart, and the plowing of the wicked, is sin.
