Bible.Title: Proverbs 21:
Bible.Verse: 5 The thoughts of the diligent tend only to plenteousness; but of every one that is hasty only to want.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 21:
Bible.Verse: 6 The getting of treasures by a lying tongue is a vanity tossed to and fro of them that seek death.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 21:
Bible.Verse: 7 The robbery of the wicked shall destroy them; because they refuse to do judgment.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 21:
Bible.Verse: 8 The way of man is froward and strange: but as for the pure, his work is right.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 21:
Bible.Verse: 9 It is better to dwell in a corner of the housetop, than with a brawling woman in a wide house.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 21:
Bible.Verse: 10 The soul of the wicked desireth evil: his neighbour findeth no favour in his eyes.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 21:
Bible.Verse: 11 When the scorner is punished, the simple is made wise: and when the wise is instructed, he receiveth knowledge.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 21:
Bible.Verse: 12 The righteous man wisely considereth the house of the wicked: but God overthroweth the wicked for their wickedness.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 21:
Bible.Verse: 13 Whoso stoppeth his ears at the cry of the poor, he also shall cry himself, but shall not be heard.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 21:
Bible.Verse: 14 A gift in secret pacifieth anger: and a reward in the bosom strong wrath.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 21:
Bible.Verse: 15 It is joy to the just to do judgment: but destruction shall be to the workers of iniquity.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 21:
Bible.Verse: 16 The man that wandereth out of the way of understanding shall remain in the congregation of the dead.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 21:
Bible.Verse: 17 He that loveth pleasure shall be a poor man: he that loveth wine and oil shall not be rich.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 21:
Bible.Verse: 18 The wicked shall be a ransom for the righteous, and the transgressor for the upright.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 21:
Bible.Verse: 19 It is better to dwell in the wilderness, than with a contentious and an angry woman.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 21:
Bible.Verse: 20 There is treasure to be desired and oil in the dwelling of the wise; but a foolish man spendeth it up.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 21:
Bible.Verse: 21 He that followeth after righteousness and mercy findeth life, righteousness, and honour.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 21:
Bible.Verse: 22 A wise man scaleth the city of the mighty, and casteth down the strength of the confidence thereof.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 21:
Bible.Verse: 23 Whoso keepeth his mouth and his tongue keepeth his soul from troubles.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 21:
Bible.Verse: 24 Proud and haughty scorner is his name, who dealeth in proud wrath.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 21:
Bible.Verse: 25 The desire of the slothful killeth him; for his hands refuse to labour.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 21:
Bible.Verse: 26 He coveteth greedily all the day long: but the righteous giveth and spareth not.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 21:
Bible.Verse: 27 The sacrifice of the wicked is abomination: how much more, when he bringeth it with a wicked mind?

Bible.Title: Proverbs 21:
Bible.Verse: 28 A false witness shall perish: but the man that heareth speaketh constantly.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 21:
Bible.Verse: 29 A wicked man hardeneth his face: but as for the upright, he directeth his way.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 21:
Bible.Verse: 30 There is no wisdom nor understanding nor counsel against the LORD.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 21:
Bible.Verse: 31 The horse is prepared against the day of battle: but safety is of the LORD.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 22:
Bible.Verse: 1 A GOOD name is rather to be chosen than great riches, and loving favour rather than silver and gold.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 22:
Bible.Verse: 2 The rich and poor meet together: the LORD is the maker of them all.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 22:
Bible.Verse: 3 A prudent man foreseeth the evil, and hideth himself: but the simple pass on, and are punished.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 22:
Bible.Verse: 4 By humility and the fear of the LORD are riches, and honour, and life.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 22:
Bible.Verse: 5 Thorns and snares are in the way of the froward: he that doth keep his soul shall be far from them.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 22:
Bible.Verse: 6 Train up a child in the way he should go: and when he is old, he will not depart from it.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 22:
Bible.Verse: 7 The rich ruleth over the poor, and the borrower is servant to the lender.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 22:
Bible.Verse: 8 He that soweth iniquity shall reap vanity: and the rod of his anger shall fail.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 22:
Bible.Verse: 9 He that hath a bountiful eye shall be blessed; for he giveth of his bread to the poor.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 22:
Bible.Verse: 10 Cast out the scorner, and contention shall go out; yea, strife and reproach shall cease.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 22:
Bible.Verse: 11 He that loveth pureness of heart, for the grace of his lips the king shall be his friend.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 22:
Bible.Verse: 12 The eyes of the LORD preserve knowledge, and he overthroweth the words of the transgressor.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 22:
Bible.Verse: 13 The slothful man saith, There is a lion without, I shall be slain in the streets.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 22:
Bible.Verse: 14 The mouth of strange women is a deep pit: he that is abhorred of the LORD shall fall therein.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 22:
Bible.Verse: 15 Foolishness is bound in the heart of a child; but the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 22:
Bible.Verse: 16 He that oppresseth the poor to increase his riches, and he that giveth to the rich, shall surely come to want.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 22:
Bible.Verse: 17 Bow down thine ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply thine heart unto my knowledge.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 22:
Bible.Verse: 18 For it is a pleasant thing if thou keep them within thee; they shall withal be fitted in thy lips.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 22:
Bible.Verse: 19 That thy trust may be in the LORD, I have made known to thee this day, even to thee.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 22:
Bible.Verse: 20 Have not I written to thee excellent things in counsels and knowledge,

Bible.Title: Proverbs 22:
Bible.Verse: 21 That I might make thee know the certainty of the words of truth; that thou mightest answer the words of truth to them that send unto thee?

Bible.Title: Proverbs 22:
Bible.Verse: 22 Rob not the poor, because he is poor: neither oppress the afflicted in the gate:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 22:
Bible.Verse: 23 For the LORD will plead their cause, and spoil the soul of those that spoiled them.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 22:
Bible.Verse: 24 Make no friendship with an angry man; and with a furious man thou shalt not go:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 22:
Bible.Verse: 25 Lest thou learn his ways, and get a snare to thy soul.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 22:
Bible.Verse: 26 Be not thou one of them that strike hands, or of them that are sureties for debts.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 22:
Bible.Verse: 27 If thou hast nothing to pay, why should he take away thy bed from under thee?

Bible.Title: Proverbs 22:
Bible.Verse: 28 Remove not the ancient landmark, which thy fathers have set.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 22:
Bible.Verse: 29 Seest thou a man diligent in his business? he shall stand before kings; he shall not stand before mean men.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 1 When thou sittest to eat with a ruler, consider diligently what is before thee:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 2 And put a knife to thy throat, if thou be a man given to appetite.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 3 Be not desirous of his dainties: for they are deceitful meat.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 4 Labour not to be rich: cease from thine own wisdom.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 5 Wilt thou set thine eyes upon that which is not? for riches certainly make themselves wings; they fly away as an eagle toward heaven.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 6 Eat thou not the bread of him that hath an evil eye, neither desire thou his dainty meats:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 7 For as he thinketh in his heart, so is he: Eat and drink, saith he to thee; but his heart is not with thee.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 8 The morsel which thou hast eaten shalt thou vomit up, and lose thy sweet words.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 9 Speak not in the ears of a fool: for he will despise the wisdom of thy words.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 10 Remove not the old landmark; and enter not into the fields of the fatherless:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 11 For their redeemer is mighty; he shall plead their cause with thee.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 12 Apply thine heart unto instruction, and thine ears to the words of knowledge.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 13 Withhold not correction from the child: for if thou beatest him with the rod, he shall not die.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 14 Thou shalt beat him with the rod, and shalt deliver his soul from hell.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 15 My son, if thine heart be wise, my heart shall rejoice, even mine.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 16 Yea, my reins shall rejoice, when thy lips speak right things.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 17 Let not thine heart envy sinners: but be thou in the fear of the LORD all the day long.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 18 For surely there is an end; and thine expectation shall not be cut off.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 19 Hear thou, my son, and be wise, and guide thine heart in the way.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 20 Be not among winebibbers; among riotous eaters of flesh:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 21 For the drunkard and the glutton shall come to poverty: and drowsiness shall clothe a man with rags.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 22 Hearken unto thy father that begat thee, and despise not thy mother when she is old.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 23 Buy the truth, and sell it not; also wisdom, and instruction, and understanding.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 24 The father of the righteous shall greatly rejoice: and he that begetteth a wise child shall have joy of him.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 25 Thy father and thy mother shall be glad, and she that bare thee shall rejoice.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 26 My son, give me thine heart, and let thine eyes observe my ways.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 27 For a whore is a deep ditch; and a strange woman is a narrow pit.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 28 She also lieth in wait as for a prey, and increaseth the transgressors among men.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 29 Who hath woe? who hath sorrow? who hath contentions? who hath babbling? who hath wounds without cause? who hath redness of eyes?

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 30 They that tarry long at the wine; they that go to seek mixed wine.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 31 Look not thou upon the wine when it is red, when it giveth his colour in the cup, when it moveth itself aright.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 32 At the last it biteth like a serpent, and stingeth like an adder.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 33 Thine eyes shall behold strange women, and thine heart shall utter perverse things.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 34 Yea, thou shalt be as he that lieth down in the midst of the sea, or as he that lieth upon the top of a mast.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 23:
Bible.Verse: 35 They have stricken me, shalt thou say, and I was not sick; they have beaten me, and I felt it not: when shall I awake? I will seek it yet again.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 24:
Bible.Verse: 1 Be not thou envious against evil men, neither desire to be with them.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 24:
Bible.Verse: 2 For their heart studieth destruction, and their lips talk of mischief.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 24:
Bible.Verse: 3 Through wisdom is an house builded; and by understanding it is established:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 24:
Bible.Verse: 4 And by knowledge shall the chambers be filled with all precious and pleasant riches.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 24:
Bible.Verse: 5 A wise man is strong; yea, a man of knowledge increaseth strength.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 24:
Bible.Verse: 6 For by wise counsel thou shalt make thy war: and in multitude of counsellors there is safety.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 24:
Bible.Verse: 7 Wisdom is too high for a fool: he openeth not his mouth in the gate.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 24:
Bible.Verse: 8 He that deviseth to do evil shall be called a mischievous person.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 24:
Bible.Verse: 9 The thought of foolishness is sin: and the scorner is an abomination to men.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 24:
Bible.Verse: 10 If thou faint in the day of adversity, thy strength is small.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 24:
Bible.Verse: 11 If thou forbear to deliver them that are drawn unto death, and those that are ready to be slain;

Bible.Title: Proverbs 24:
Bible.Verse: 12 If thou sayest, Behold, we knew it not; doth not he that pondereth the heart consider it? and he that keepeth thy soul, doth not he know it? and shall not he render to every man according to his works?

Bible.Title: Proverbs 24:
Bible.Verse: 13 My son, eat thou honey, because it is good; and the honeycomb, which is sweet to thy taste:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 24:
Bible.Verse: 14 So shall the knowledge of wisdom be unto thy soul: when thou hast found it, then there shall be a reward, and thy expectation shall not be cut off.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 24:
Bible.Verse: 15 Lay not wait, O wicked man, against the dwelling of the righteous; spoil not his resting place:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 24:
Bible.Verse: 16 For a just man falleth seven times, and riseth up again: but the wicked shall fall into mischief.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 24:
Bible.Verse: 17 Rejoice not when thine enemy falleth, and let not thine heart be glad when he stumbleth:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 24:
Bible.Verse: 18 Lest the LORD see it, and it displease him, and he turn away his wrath from him.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 24:
Bible.Verse: 19 Fret not thyself because of evil men, neither be thou envious at the wicked;

Bible.Title: Proverbs 24:
Bible.Verse: 20 For there shall be no reward to the evil man; the candle of the wicked shall be put out.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 24:
Bible.Verse: 21 My son, fear thou the LORD and the king: and meddle not with them that are given to change:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 24:
Bible.Verse: 22 For their calamity shall rise suddenly; and who knoweth the ruin of them both?

Bible.Title: Proverbs 24:
Bible.Verse: 23 These things also belong to the wise. It is not good to have respect of persons in judgment.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 24:
Bible.Verse: 24 He that saith unto the wicked, Thou art righteous; him shall the people curse, nations shall abhor him:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 24:
Bible.Verse: 25 But to them that rebuke him shall be delight, and a good blessing shall come upon them.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 24:
Bible.Verse: 26 Every man shall kiss his lips that giveth a right answer.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 24:
Bible.Verse: 27 Prepare thy work without, and make it fit for thyself in the field; and afterwards build thine house.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 24:
Bible.Verse: 28 Be not a witness against thy neighbour without cause; and deceive not with thy lips.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 24:
Bible.Verse: 29 Say not, I will do so to him as he hath done to me: I will render to the man according to his work.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 24:
Bible.Verse: 30 I went by the field of the slothful, and by the vineyard of the man void of understanding;

Bible.Title: Proverbs 24:
Bible.Verse: 31 And, lo, it was all grown over with thorns, and nettles had covered the face thereof, and the stone wall thereof was broken down.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 24:
Bible.Verse: 32 Then I saw, and considered it well: I looked upon it, and received instruction.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 24:
Bible.Verse: 33 Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 24:
Bible.Verse: 34 So shall thy poverty come as one that travelleth; and thy want as an armed man.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 25:
Bible.Verse: 1 These are also proverbs of Solomon, which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah copied out.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 25:
Bible.Verse: 2 It is the glory of God to conceal a thing: but the honour of kings is to search out a matter.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 25:
Bible.Verse: 3 The heaven for height, and the earth for depth, and the heart of kings is unsearchable.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 25:
Bible.Verse: 4 Take away the dross from the silver, and there shall come forth a vessel for the finer.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 25:
Bible.Verse: 5 Take away the wicked from before the king, and his throne shall be established in righteousness.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 25:
Bible.Verse: 6 Put not forth thyself in the presence of the king, and stand not in the place of great men:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 25:
Bible.Verse: 7 For better it is that it be said unto thee, Come up hither; than that thou shouldest be put lower in the presence of the prince whom thine eyes have seen.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 25:
Bible.Verse: 8 Go not forth hastily to strive, lest thou know not what to do in the end thereof, when thy neighbour hath put thee to shame.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 25:
Bible.Verse: 9 Debate thy cause with thy neighbour himself; and discover not a secret to another:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 25:
Bible.Verse: 10 Lest he that heareth it put thee to shame, and thine infamy turn not away.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 25:
Bible.Verse: 11 A word fitly spoken is like apples of gold in pictures of silver.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 25:
Bible.Verse: 12 As an earring of gold, and an ornament of fine gold, so is a wise reprover upon an obedient ear.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 25:
Bible.Verse: 13 As the cold of snow in the time of harvest, so is a faithful messenger to them that send him: for he refresheth the soul of his masters.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 25:
Bible.Verse: 14 Whoso boasteth himself of a false gift is like clouds and wind without rain.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 25:
Bible.Verse: 15 By long forbearing is a prince persuaded, and a soft tongue breaketh the bone.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 25:
Bible.Verse: 16 Hast thou found honey? eat so much as is sufficient for thee, lest thou be filled therewith, and vomit it.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 25:
Bible.Verse: 17 Withdraw thy foot from thy neighbour's house; lest he be weary of thee, and so hate thee.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 25:
Bible.Verse: 18 A man that beareth false witness against his neighbour is a maul, and a sword, and a sharp arrow.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 25:
Bible.Verse: 19 Confidence in an unfaithful man in time of trouble is like a broken tooth, and a foot out of joint.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 25:
Bible.Verse: 20 As he that taketh away a garment in cold weather, and as vinegar upon nitre, so is he that singeth songs to an heavy heart.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 25:
Bible.Verse: 21 If thine enemy be hungry, give him bread to eat; and if he be thirsty, give him water to drink:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 25:
Bible.Verse: 22 For thou shalt heap coals of fire upon his head, and the LORD shall reward thee.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 25:
Bible.Verse: 23 The north wind driveth away rain: so doth an angry countenance a backbiting tongue.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 25:
Bible.Verse: 24 It is better to dwell in the corner of the housetop, than with a brawling woman and in a wide house.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 25:
Bible.Verse: 25 As cold waters to a thirsty soul, so is good news from a far country.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 25:
Bible.Verse: 26 A righteous man falling down before the wicked is as a troubled fountain, and a corrupt spring.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 25:
Bible.Verse: 27 It is not good to eat much honey: so for men to search their own glory is not glory.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 25:
Bible.Verse: 28 He that hath no rule over his own spirit is like a city that is broken down, and without walls.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 26:
Bible.Verse: 1 As snow in summer, and as rain in harvest, so honour is not seemly for a fool.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 26:
Bible.Verse: 2 As the bird by wandering, as the swallow by flying, so the curse causeless shall not come.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 26:
Bible.Verse: 3 A whip for the horse, a bridle for the ass, and a rod for the fool's back.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 26:
Bible.Verse: 4 Answer not a fool according to his folly, lest thou also be like unto him.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 26:
Bible.Verse: 5 Answer a fool according to his folly, lest he be wise in his own conceit.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 26:
Bible.Verse: 6 He that sendeth a message by the hand of a fool cutteth off the feet, and drinketh damage.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 26:
Bible.Verse: 7 The legs of the lame are not equal: so is a parable in the mouth of fools.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 26:
Bible.Verse: 8 As he that bindeth a stone in a sling, so is he that giveth honour to a fool.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 26:
Bible.Verse: 9 As a thorn goeth up into the hand of a drunkard, so is a parable in the mouth of fools.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 26:
Bible.Verse: 10 The great God that formed all things both rewardeth the fool, and rewardeth transgressors.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 26:
Bible.Verse: 11 As a dog returneth to his vomit, so a fool returneth to his folly.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 26:
Bible.Verse: 12 Seest thou a man wise in his own conceit? there is more hope of a fool than of him.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 26:
Bible.Verse: 13 The slothful man saith, There is a lion in the way; a lion is in the streets.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 26:
Bible.Verse: 14 As the door turneth upon his hinges, so doth the slothful upon his bed.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 26:
Bible.Verse: 15 The slothful hideth his hand in his bosom; it grieveth him to bring it again to his mouth.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 26:
Bible.Verse: 16 The sluggard is wiser in his own conceit than seven men that can render a reason.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 26:
Bible.Verse: 17 He that passeth by, and meddleth with strife belonging not to him, is like one that taketh a dog by the ears.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 26:
Bible.Verse: 18 As a mad man who casteth firebrands, arrows, and death,

Bible.Title: Proverbs 26:
Bible.Verse: 19 So is the man that deceiveth his neighbour, and saith, Am not I in sport?

Bible.Title: Proverbs 26:
Bible.Verse: 20 Where no wood is, there the fire goeth out: so where there is no talebearer, the strife ceaseth.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 26:
Bible.Verse: 21 As coals are to burning coals, and wood to fire; so is a contentious man to kindle strife.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 26:
Bible.Verse: 22 The words of a talebearer are as wounds, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 26:
Bible.Verse: 23 Burning lips and a wicked heart are like a potsherd covered with silver dross.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 26:
Bible.Verse: 24 He that hateth dissembleth with his lips, and layeth up deceit within him;

Bible.Title: Proverbs 26:
Bible.Verse: 25 When he speaketh fair, believe him not: for there are seven abominations in his heart.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 26:
Bible.Verse: 26 Whose hatred is covered by deceit, his wickedness shall be shewed before the whole congregation.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 26:
Bible.Verse: 27 Whoso diggeth a pit shall fall therein: and he that rolleth a stone, it will return upon him.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 26:
Bible.Verse: 28 A lying tongue hateth those that are afflicted by it; and a flattering mouth worketh ruin.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 27:
Bible.Verse: 1 Boast not thyself of to morrow; for thou knowest not what a day may bring forth.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 27:
Bible.Verse: 2 Let another man praise thee, and not thine own mouth; a stranger, and not thine own lips.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 27:
Bible.Verse: 3 A stone is heavy, and the sand weighty; but a fool's wrath is heavier than them both.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 27:
Bible.Verse: 4 Wrath is cruel, and anger is outrageous; but who is able to stand before envy?

Bible.Title: Proverbs 27:
Bible.Verse: 5 Open rebuke is better than secret love.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 27:
Bible.Verse: 6 Faithful are the wounds of a friend; but the kisses of an enemy are deceitful.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 27:
Bible.Verse: 7 The full soul loatheth an honeycomb; but to the hungry soul every bitter thing is sweet.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 27:
Bible.Verse: 8 As a bird that wandereth from her nest, so is a man that wandereth from his place.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 27:
Bible.Verse: 9 Ointment and perfume rejoice the heart: so doth the sweetness of a man's friend by hearty counsel.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 27:
Bible.Verse: 10 Thine own friend, and thy father's friend, forsake not; neither go into thy brother's house in the day of thy calamity: for better is a neighbour that is near than a brother far off.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 27:
Bible.Verse: 11 My son, be wise, and make my heart glad, that I may answer him that reproacheth me.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 27:
Bible.Verse: 12 A prudent man foreseeth the evil, and hideth himself; but the simple pass on, and are punished.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 27:
Bible.Verse: 13 Take his garment that is surety for a stranger, and take a pledge of him for a strange woman.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 27:
Bible.Verse: 14 He that blesseth his friend with a loud voice, rising early in the morning, it shall be counted a curse to him.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 27:
Bible.Verse: 15 A continual dropping in a very rainy day and a contentious woman are alike.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 27:
Bible.Verse: 16 Whosoever hideth her hideth the wind, and the ointment of his right hand, which bewrayeth itself.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 27:
Bible.Verse: 17 Iron sharpeneth iron; so a man sharpeneth the countenance of his friend.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 27:
Bible.Verse: 18 Whoso keepeth the fig tree shall eat the fruit thereof: so he that waiteth on his master shall be honoured.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 27:
Bible.Verse: 19 As in water face answereth to face, so the heart of man to man.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 27:
Bible.Verse: 20 Hell and destruction are never full; so the eyes of man are never satisfied.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 27:
Bible.Verse: 21 As the fining pot for silver, and the furnace for gold; so is a man to his praise.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 27:
Bible.Verse: 22 Though thou shouldest bray a fool in a mortar among wheat with a pestle, yet will not his foolishness depart from him.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 27:
Bible.Verse: 23 Be thou diligent to know the state of thy flocks, and look well to thy herds.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 27:
Bible.Verse: 24 For riches are not for ever: and doth the crown endure to every generation?

Bible.Title: Proverbs 27:
Bible.Verse: 25 The hay appeareth, and the tender grass sheweth itself, and herbs of the mountains are gathered.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 27:
Bible.Verse: 26 The lambs are for thy clothing, and the goats are the price of the field.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 27:
Bible.Verse: 27 And thou shalt have goats' milk enough for thy food, for the food of thy household, and for the maintenance for thy maidens.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 28:
Bible.Verse: 1 The wicked flee when no man pursueth: but the righteous are bold as a lion.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 28:
Bible.Verse: 2 For the transgression of a land many are the princes thereof: but by a man of understanding and knowledge the state thereof shall be prolonged.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 28:
Bible.Verse: 3 A poor man that oppresseth the poor is like a sweeping rain which leaveth no food.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 28:
Bible.Verse: 4 They that forsake the law praise the wicked: but such as keep the law contend with them.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 28:
Bible.Verse: 5 Evil men understand not judgment: but they that seek the LORD understand all things.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 28:
Bible.Verse: 6 Better is the poor that walketh in his uprightness, than he that is perverse in his ways, though he be rich.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 28:
Bible.Verse: 7 Whoso keepeth the law is a wise son: but he that is a companion of riotous men shameth his father.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 28:
Bible.Verse: 8 He that by usury and unjust gain increaseth his substance, he shall gather it for him that will pity the poor.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 28:
Bible.Verse: 9 He that turneth away his ear from hearing the law, even his prayer shall be abomination.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 28:
Bible.Verse: 10 Whoso causeth the righteous to go astray in an evil way, he shall fall himself into his own pit: but the upright shall have good things in possession.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 28:
Bible.Verse: 11 The rich man is wise in his own conceit; but the poor that hath understanding searcheth him out.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 28:
Bible.Verse: 12 When righteous men do rejoice, there is great glory: but when the wicked rise, a man is hidden.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 28:
Bible.Verse: 13 He that covereth his sins shall not prosper: but whoso confesseth and forsaketh them shall have mercy.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 28:
Bible.Verse: 14 Happy is the man that feareth alway: but he that hardeneth his heart shall fall into mischief.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 28:
Bible.Verse: 15 As a roaring lion, and a ranging bear; so is a wicked ruler over the poor people.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 28:
Bible.Verse: 16 The prince that wanteth understanding is also a great oppressor: but he that hateth covetousness shall prolong his days.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 28:
Bible.Verse: 17 A man that doeth violence to the blood of any person shall flee to the pit; let no man stay him.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 28:
Bible.Verse: 18 Whoso walketh uprightly shall be saved: but he that is perverse in his ways shall fall at once.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 28:
Bible.Verse: 19 He that tilleth his land shall have plenty of bread: but he that followeth after vain persons shall have poverty enough.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 28:
Bible.Verse: 20 A faithful man shall abound with blessings: but he that maketh haste to be rich shall not be innocent.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 28:
Bible.Verse: 21 To have respect of persons is not good: for for a piece of bread that man will transgress.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 28:
Bible.Verse: 22 He that hasteth to be rich hath an evil eye, and considereth not that poverty shall come upon him.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 28:
Bible.Verse: 23 He that rebuketh a man afterwards shall find more favour than he that flattereth with the tongue.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 28:
Bible.Verse: 24 Whoso robbeth his father or his mother, and saith, It is no transgression; the same is the companion of a destroyer.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 28:
Bible.Verse: 25 He that is of a proud heart stirreth up strife: but he that putteth his trust in the LORD shall be made fat.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 28:
Bible.Verse: 26 He that trusteth in his own heart is a fool: but whoso walketh wisely, he shall be delivered.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 28:
Bible.Verse: 27 He that giveth unto the poor shall not lack: but he that hideth his eyes shall have many a curse.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 28:
Bible.Verse: 28 When the wicked rise, men hide themselves: but when they perish, the righteous increase.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 29:
Bible.Verse: 1 He, that being often reproved hardeneth his neck, shall suddenly be destroyed, and that without remedy.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 29:
Bible.Verse: 2 When the righteous are in authority, the people rejoice: but when the wicked beareth rule, the people mourn.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 29:
Bible.Verse: 3 Whoso loveth wisdom rejoiceth his father: but he that keepeth company with harlots spendeth his substance.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 29:
Bible.Verse: 4 The king by judgment establisheth the land: but he that receiveth gifts overthroweth it.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 29:
Bible.Verse: 5 A man that flattereth his neighbour spreadeth a net for his feet.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 29:
Bible.Verse: 6 In the transgression of an evil man there is a snare: but the righteous doth sing and rejoice.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 29:
Bible.Verse: 7 The righteous considereth the cause of the poor: but the wicked regardeth not to know it.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 29:
Bible.Verse: 8 Scornful men bring a city into a snare: but wise men turn away wrath.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 29:
Bible.Verse: 9 If a wise man contendeth with a foolish man, whether he rage or laugh, there is no rest.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 29:
Bible.Verse: 10 The bloodthirsty hate the upright: but the just seek his soul.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 29:
Bible.Verse: 11 A fool uttereth all his mind: but a wise man keepeth it in till afterwards.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 29:
Bible.Verse: 12 If a ruler hearken to lies, all his servants are wicked.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 29:
Bible.Verse: 13 The poor and the deceitful man meet together: the LORD lighteneth both their eyes.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 29:
Bible.Verse: 14 The king that faithfully judgeth the poor, his throne shall be established for ever.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 29:
Bible.Verse: 15 The rod and reproof give wisdom: but a child left to himself bringeth his mother to shame.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 29:
Bible.Verse: 16 When the wicked are multiplied, transgression increaseth: but the righteous shall see their fall.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 29:
Bible.Verse: 17 Correct thy son, and he shall give thee rest; yea, he shall give delight unto thy soul.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 29:
Bible.Verse: 18 Where there is no vision, the people perish: but he that keepeth the law, happy is he.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 29:
Bible.Verse: 19 A servant will not be corrected by words: for though he understand he will not answer.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 29:
Bible.Verse: 20 Seest thou a man that is hasty in his words? there is more hope of a fool than of him.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 29:
Bible.Verse: 21 He that delicately bringeth up his servant from a child shall have him become his son at the length.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 29:
Bible.Verse: 22 An angry man stirreth up strife, and a furious man aboundeth in transgression.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 29:
Bible.Verse: 23 A man's pride shall bring him low: but honour shall uphold the humble in spirit.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 29:
Bible.Verse: 24 Whoso is partner with a thief hateth his own soul: he heareth cursing, and bewrayeth it not.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 29:
Bible.Verse: 25 The fear of man bringeth a snare: but whoso putteth his trust in the LORD shall be safe.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 29:
Bible.Verse: 26 Many seek the ruler's favour; but every man's judgment cometh from the LORD.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 29:
Bible.Verse: 27 An unjust man is an abomination to the just: and he that is upright in the way is abomination to the wicked.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 30:
Bible.Verse: 1 The words of Agur the son of Jakeh, even the prophecy: the man spake unto Ithiel, even unto Ithiel and Ucal,

Bible.Title: Proverbs 30:
Bible.Verse: 2 Surely I am more brutish than any man, and have not the understanding of a man.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 30:
Bible.Verse: 3 I neither learned wisdom, nor have the knowledge of the holy.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 30:
Bible.Verse: 4 Who hath ascended up into heaven, or descended? who hath gathered the wind in his fists? who hath bound the waters in a garment? who hath established all the ends of the earth? what is his name, and what is his son's name, if thou canst tell?

Bible.Title: Proverbs 30:
Bible.Verse: 5 Every word of God is pure: he is a shield unto them that put their trust in him.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 30:
Bible.Verse: 6 Add thou not unto his words, lest he reprove thee, and thou be found a liar.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 30:
Bible.Verse: 7 Two things have I required of thee; deny me them not before I die:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 30:
Bible.Verse: 8 Remove far from me vanity and lies: give me neither poverty nor riches; feed me with food convenient for me:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 30:
Bible.Verse: 9 Lest I be full, and deny thee, and say, Who is the LORD? or lest I be poor, and steal, and take the name of my God in vain.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 30:
Bible.Verse: 10 Accuse not a servant unto his master, lest he curse thee, and thou be found guilty.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 30:
Bible.Verse: 11 There is a generation that curseth their father, and doth not bless their mother.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 30:
Bible.Verse: 12 There is a generation that are pure in their own eyes, and yet is not washed from their filthiness.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 30:
Bible.Verse: 13 There is a generation, O how lofty are their eyes! and their eyelids are lifted up.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 30:
Bible.Verse: 14 There is a generation, whose teeth are as swords, and their jaw teeth as knives, to devour the poor from off the earth, and the needy from among men.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 30:
Bible.Verse: 15 The horseleach hath two daughters, crying, Give, give. There are three things that are never satisfied, yea, four things say not, It is enough:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 30:
Bible.Verse: 16 The grave; and the barren womb; the earth that is not filled with water; and the fire that saith not, It is enough.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 30:
Bible.Verse: 17 The eye that mocketh at his father, and despiseth to obey his mother, the ravens of the valley shall pick it out, and the young eagles shall eat it.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 30:
Bible.Verse: 18 There be three things which are too wonderful for me, yea, four which I know not:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 30:
Bible.Verse: 19 The way of an eagle in the air; the way of a serpent upon a rock; the way of a ship in the midst of the sea; and the way of a man with a maid.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 30:
Bible.Verse: 20 Such is the way of an adulterous woman; she eateth, and wipeth her mouth, and saith, I have done no wickedness.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 30:
Bible.Verse: 21 For three things the earth is disquieted, and for four which it cannot bear:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 30:
Bible.Verse: 22 For a servant when he reigneth; and a fool when he is filled with meat;

Bible.Title: Proverbs 30:
Bible.Verse: 23 For an odious woman when she is married; and an handmaid that is heir to her mistress.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 30:
Bible.Verse: 24 There be four things which are little upon the earth, but they are exceeding wise:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 30:
Bible.Verse: 25 The ants are a people not strong, yet they prepare their meat in the summer;

Bible.Title: Proverbs 30:
Bible.Verse: 26 The conies are but a feeble folk, yet make they their houses in the rocks;

Bible.Title: Proverbs 30:
Bible.Verse: 27 The locusts have no king, yet go they forth all of them by bands;

Bible.Title: Proverbs 30:
Bible.Verse: 28 The spider taketh hold with her hands, and is in kings' palaces.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 30:
Bible.Verse: 29 There be three things which go well, yea, four are comely in going:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 30:
Bible.Verse: 30 A lion which is strongest among beasts, and turneth not away for any;

Bible.Title: Proverbs 30:
Bible.Verse: 31 A greyhound; an he goat also; and a king, against whom there is no rising up.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 30:
Bible.Verse: 32 If thou hast done foolishly in lifting up thyself, or if thou hast thought evil, lay thine hand upon thy mouth.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 30:
Bible.Verse: 33 Surely the churning of milk bringeth forth butter, and the wringing of the nose bringeth forth blood: so the forcing of wrath bringeth forth strife.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 31:
Bible.Verse: 1 The words of king Lemuel, the prophecy that his mother taught him.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 31:
Bible.Verse: 2 What, my son? and what, the son of my womb? and what, the son of my vows?

Bible.Title: Proverbs 31:
Bible.Verse: 3 Give not thy strength unto women, nor thy ways to that which destroyeth kings.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 31:
Bible.Verse: 4 It is not for kings, O Lemuel, it is not for kings to drink wine; nor for princes strong drink:

Bible.Title: Proverbs 31:
Bible.Verse: 5 Lest they drink, and forget the law, and pervert the judgment of any of the afflicted.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 31:
Bible.Verse: 6 Give strong drink unto him that is ready to perish, and wine unto those that be of heavy hearts.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 31:
Bible.Verse: 7 Let him drink, and forget his poverty, and remember his misery no more.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 31:
Bible.Verse: 8 Open thy mouth for the dumb in the cause of all such as are appointed to destruction.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 31:
Bible.Verse: 9 Open thy mouth, judge righteously, and plead the cause of the poor and needy.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 31:
Bible.Verse: 10 Who can find a virtuous woman? for her price is far above rubies.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 31:
Bible.Verse: 11 The heart of her husband doth safely trust in her, so that he shall have no need of spoil.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 31:
Bible.Verse: 12 She will do him good and not evil all the days of her life.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 31:
Bible.Verse: 13 She seeketh wool, and flax, and worketh willingly with her hands.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 31:
Bible.Verse: 14 She is like the merchants' ships; she bringeth her food from afar.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 31:
Bible.Verse: 15 She riseth also while it is yet night, and giveth meat to her household, and a portion to her maidens.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 31:
Bible.Verse: 16 She considereth a field, and buyeth it: with the fruit of her hands she planteth a vineyard.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 31:
Bible.Verse: 17 She girdeth her loins with strength, and strengtheneth her arms.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 31:
Bible.Verse: 18 She perceiveth that her merchandise is good: her candle goeth not out by night.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 31:
Bible.Verse: 19 She layeth her hands to the spindle, and her hands hold the distaff.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 31:
Bible.Verse: 20 She stretcheth out her hand to the poor; yea, she reacheth forth her hands to the needy.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 31:
Bible.Verse: 21 She is not afraid of the snow for her household: for all her household are clothed with scarlet.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 31:
Bible.Verse: 22 She maketh herself coverings of tapestry; her clothing is silk and purple.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 31:
Bible.Verse: 23 Her husband is known in the gates, when he sitteth among the elders of the land.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 31:
Bible.Verse: 24 She maketh fine linen, and selleth it; and delivereth girdles unto the merchant.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 31:
Bible.Verse: 25 Strength and honour are her clothing; and she shall rejoice in time to come.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 31:
Bible.Verse: 26 She openeth her mouth with wisdom; and in her tongue is the law of kindness.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 31:
Bible.Verse: 27 She looketh well to the ways of her household, and eateth not the bread of idleness.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 31:
Bible.Verse: 28 Her children arise up, and call her blessed; her husband also, and he praiseth her.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 31:
Bible.Verse: 29 Many daughters have done virtuously, but thou excellest them all.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 31:
Bible.Verse: 30 Favour is deceitful, and beauty is vain: but a woman that feareth the LORD, she shall be praised.

Bible.Title: Proverbs 31:
Bible.Verse: 31 Give her of the fruit of her hands; and let her own works praise her in the gates.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 1:
Bible.Verse: 1 The words of the Preacher, the son of David, king in Jerusalem.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 1:
Bible.Verse: 2 Vanity of vanities, saith the Preacher, vanity of vanities; all is vanity.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 1:
Bible.Verse: 3 What profit hath a man of all his labour which he taketh under the sun?

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 1:
Bible.Verse: 4 One generation passeth away, and another generation cometh: but the earth abideth for ever.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 1:
Bible.Verse: 5 The sun also ariseth, and the sun goeth down, and hasteth to his place where he arose.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 1:
Bible.Verse: 6 The wind goeth toward the south, and turneth about unto the north; it whirleth about continually, and the wind returneth again according to his circuits.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 1:
Bible.Verse: 7 All the rivers run into the sea; yet the sea is not full; unto the place from whence the rivers come, thither they return again.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 1:
Bible.Verse: 8 All things are full of labour; man cannot utter it: the eye is not satisfied with seeing, nor the ear filled with hearing.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 1:
Bible.Verse: 9 The thing that hath been, it is that which shall be; and that which is done is that which shall be done: and there is no new thing under the sun.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 1:
Bible.Verse: 10 Is there any thing whereof it may be said, See, this is new? it hath been already of old time, which was before us.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 1:
Bible.Verse: 11 There is no remembrance of former things; neither shall there be any remembrance of things that are to come with those that shall come after.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 1:
Bible.Verse: 12 I the Preacher was king over Israel in Jerusalem.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 1:
Bible.Verse: 13 And I gave my heart to seek and search out by wisdom concerning all things that are done under heaven: this sore travail hath God given to the sons of man to be exercised therewith.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 1:
Bible.Verse: 14 I have seen all the works that are done under the sun; and, behold, all is vanity and vexation of spirit.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 1:
Bible.Verse: 15 That which is crooked cannot be made straight: and that which is wanting cannot be numbered.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 1:
Bible.Verse: 16 I communed with mine own heart, saying, Lo, I am come to great estate, and have gotten more wisdom than all they that have been before me in Jerusalem: yea, my heart had great experience of wisdom and knowledge.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 1:
Bible.Verse: 17 And I gave my heart to know wisdom, and to know madness and folly: I perceived that this also is vexation of spirit.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 1:
Bible.Verse: 18 For in much wisdom is much grief: and he that increaseth knowledge increaseth sorrow.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 2:
Bible.Verse: 1 I said in mine heart, Go to now, I will prove thee with mirth, therefore enjoy pleasure: and, behold, this also is vanity.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 2:
Bible.Verse: 2 I said of laughter, It is mad: and of mirth, What doeth it?

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 2:
Bible.Verse: 3 I sought in mine heart to give myself unto wine, yet acquainting mine heart with wisdom; and to lay hold on folly, till I might see what was that good for the sons of men, which they should do under the heaven all the days of their life.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 2:
Bible.Verse: 4 I made me great works; I builded me houses; I planted me vineyards:

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 2:
Bible.Verse: 5 I made me gardens and orchards, and I planted trees in them of all kind of fruits:

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 2:
Bible.Verse: 6 I made me pools of water, to water therewith the wood that bringeth forth trees:

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 2:
Bible.Verse: 7 I got me servants and maidens, and had servants born in my house; also I had great possessions of great and small cattle above all that were in Jerusalem before me:

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 2:
Bible.Verse: 8 I gathered me also silver and gold, and the peculiar treasure of kings and of the provinces: I gat me men singers and women singers, and the delights of the sons of men, as musical instruments, and that of all sorts.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 2:
Bible.Verse: 9 So I was great, and increased more than all that were before me in Jerusalem: also my wisdom remained with me.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 2:
Bible.Verse: 10 And whatsoever mine eyes desired I kept not from them, I withheld not my heart from any joy; for my heart rejoiced in all my labour: and this was my portion of all my labour.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 2:
Bible.Verse: 11 Then I looked on all the works that my hands had wrought, and on the labour that I had laboured to do: and, behold, all was vanity and vexation of spirit, and there was no profit under the sun.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 2:
Bible.Verse: 12 And I turned myself to behold wisdom, and madness, and folly: for what can the man do that cometh after the king? even that which hath been already done.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 2:
Bible.Verse: 13 Then I saw that wisdom excelleth folly, as far as light excelleth darkness.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 2:
Bible.Verse: 14 The wise man's eyes are in his head; but the fool walketh in darkness: and I myself perceived also that one event happeneth to them all.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 2:
Bible.Verse: 15 Then said I in my heart, As it happeneth to the fool, so it happeneth even to me; and why was I then more wise? Then I said in my heart, that this also is vanity.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 2:
Bible.Verse: 16 For there is no remembrance of the wise more than of the fool for ever; seeing that which now is in the days to come shall all be forgotten. And how dieth the wise man? as the fool.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 2:
Bible.Verse: 17 Therefore I hated life; because the work that is wrought under the sun is grievous unto me: for all is vanity and vexation of spirit.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 2:
Bible.Verse: 18 Yea, I hated all my labour which I had taken under the sun: because I should leave it unto the man that shall be after me.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 2:
Bible.Verse: 19 And who knoweth whether he shall be a wise man or a fool? yet shall he have rule over all my labour wherein I have laboured, and wherein I have shewed myself wise under the sun. This is also vanity.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 2:
Bible.Verse: 20 Therefore I went about to cause my heart to despair of all the labour which I took under the sun.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 2:
Bible.Verse: 21 For there is a man whose labour is in wisdom, and in knowledge, and in equity; yet to a man that hath not laboured therein shall he leave it for his portion. This also is vanity and a great evil.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 2:
Bible.Verse: 22 For what hath man of all his labour, and of the vexation of his heart, wherein he hath laboured under the sun?

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 2:
Bible.Verse: 23 For all his days are sorrows, and his travail grief; yea, his heart taketh not rest in the night. This is also vanity.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 2:
Bible.Verse: 24 There is nothing better for a man, than that he should eat and drink, and that he should make his soul enjoy good in his labour. This also I saw, that it was from the hand of God.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 2:
Bible.Verse: 25 For who can eat, or who else can hasten hereunto, more than I?

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 2:
Bible.Verse: 26 For God giveth to a man that is good in his sight wisdom, and knowledge, and joy: but to the sinner he giveth travail, to gather and to heap up, that he may give to him that is good before God. This also is vanity and vexation of spirit.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 3:
Bible.Verse: 1 To every thing there is a season, and a time to every purpose under the heaven:

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 3:
Bible.Verse: 2 A time to be born, and a time to die; a time to plant, and a time to pluck up that which is planted;

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 3:
Bible.Verse: 3 A time to kill, and a time to heal; a time to break down, and a time to build up;

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 3:
Bible.Verse: 4 A time to weep, and a time to laugh; a time to mourn, and a time to dance;

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 3:
Bible.Verse: 5 A time to cast away stones, and a time to gather stones together; a time to embrace, and a time to refrain from embracing;

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 3:
Bible.Verse: 6 A time to get, and a time to lose; a time to keep, and a time to cast away;

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 3:
Bible.Verse: 7 A time to rend, and a time to sew; a time to keep silence, and a time to speak;

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 3:
Bible.Verse: 8 A time to love, and a time to hate; a time of war, and a time of peace.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 3:
Bible.Verse: 9 What profit hath he that worketh in that wherein he laboureth?

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 3:
Bible.Verse: 10 I have seen the travail, which God hath given to the sons of men to be exercised in it.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 3:
Bible.Verse: 11 He hath made every thing beautiful in his time: also he hath set the world in their heart, so that no man can find out the work that God maketh from the beginning to the end.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 3:
Bible.Verse: 12 I know that there is no good in them, but for a man to rejoice, and to do good in his life.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 3:
Bible.Verse: 13 And also that every man should eat and drink, and enjoy the good of all his labour, it is the gift of God.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 3:
Bible.Verse: 14 I know that, whatsoever God doeth, it shall be for ever: nothing can be put to it, nor any thing taken from it: and God doeth it, that men should fear before him.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 3:
Bible.Verse: 15 That which hath been is now; and that which is to be hath already been; and God requireth that which is past.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 3:
Bible.Verse: 16 And moreover I saw under the sun the place of judgment, that wickedness was there; and the place of righteousness, that iniquity was there.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 3:
Bible.Verse: 17 I said in mine heart, God shall judge the righteous and the wicked: for there is a time there for every purpose and for every work.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 3:
Bible.Verse: 18 I said in mine heart concerning the estate of the sons of men, that God might manifest them, and that they might see that they themselves are beasts.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 3:
Bible.Verse: 19 For that which befalleth the sons of men befalleth beasts; even one thing befalleth them: as the one dieth, so dieth the other; yea, they have all one breath; so that a man hath no preeminence above a beast: for all is vanity.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 3:
Bible.Verse: 20 All go unto one place; all are of the dust, and all turn to dust again.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 3:
Bible.Verse: 21 Who knoweth the spirit of man that goeth upward, and the spirit of the beast that goeth downward to the earth?

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 3:
Bible.Verse: 22 Wherefore I perceive that there is nothing better, than that a man should rejoice in his own works; for that is his portion: for who shall bring him to see what shall be after him?

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 4:
Bible.Verse: 1 So I returned, and considered all the oppressions that are done under the sun: and behold the tears of such as were oppressed, and they had no comforter; and on the side of their oppressors there was power; but they had no comforter.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 4:
Bible.Verse: 2 Wherefore I praised the dead which are already dead more than the living which are yet alive.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 4:
Bible.Verse: 3 Yea, better is he than both they, which hath not yet been, who hath not seen the evil work that is done under the sun.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 4:
Bible.Verse: 4 Again, I considered all travail, and every right work, that for this a man is envied of his neighbour. This is also vanity and vexation of spirit.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 4:
Bible.Verse: 5 The fool foldeth his hands together, and eateth his own flesh.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 4:
Bible.Verse: 6 Better is an handful with quietness, than both the hands full with travail and vexation of spirit.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 4:
Bible.Verse: 7 Then I returned, and I saw vanity under the sun.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 4:
Bible.Verse: 8 There is one alone, and there is not a second; yea, he hath neither child nor brother: yet is there no end of all his labour; neither is his eye satisfied with riches; neither saith he, For whom do I labour, and bereave my soul of good? This is also vanity, yea, it is a sore travail.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 4:
Bible.Verse: 9 Two are better than one; because they have a good reward for their labour.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 4:
Bible.Verse: 10 For if they fall, the one will lift up his fellow: but woe to him that is alone when he falleth; for he hath not another to help him up.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 4:
Bible.Verse: 11 Again, if two lie together, then they have heat: but how can one be warm alone?

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 4:
Bible.Verse: 12 And if one prevail against him, two shall withstand him; and a threefold cord is not quickly broken.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 4:
Bible.Verse: 13 Better is a poor and a wise child than an old and foolish king, who will no more be admonished.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 4:
Bible.Verse: 14 For out of prison he cometh to reign; whereas also he that is born in his kingdom becometh poor.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 4:
Bible.Verse: 15 I considered all the living which walk under the sun, with the second child that shall stand up in his stead.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 4:
Bible.Verse: 16 There is no end of all the people, even of all that have been before them: they also that come after shall not rejoice in him. Surely this also is vanity and vexation of spirit.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 5:
Bible.Verse: 1 Keep thy foot when thou goest to the house of God, and be more ready to hear, than to give the sacrifice of fools: for they consider not that they do evil.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 5:
Bible.Verse: 2 Be not rash with thy mouth, and let not thine heart be hasty to utter any thing before God: for God is in heaven, and thou upon earth: therefore let thy words be few.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 5:
Bible.Verse: 3 For a dream cometh through the multitude of business; and a fool's voice is known by multitude of words.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 5:
Bible.Verse: 4 When thou vowest a vow unto God, defer not to pay it; for he hath no pleasure in fools: pay that which thou hast vowed.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 5:
Bible.Verse: 5 Better is it that thou shouldest not vow, than that thou shouldest vow and not pay.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 5:
Bible.Verse: 6 Suffer not thy mouth to cause thy flesh to sin; neither say thou before the angel, that it was an error: wherefore should God be angry at thy voice, and destroy the work of thine hands?

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 5:
Bible.Verse: 7 For in the multitude of dreams and many words there are also divers vanities: but fear thou God.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 5:
Bible.Verse: 8 If thou seest the oppression of the poor, and violent perverting of judgment and justice in a province, marvel not at the matter: for he that is higher than the highest regardeth; and there be higher than they.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 5:
Bible.Verse: 9 Moreover the profit of the earth is for all: the king himself is served by the field.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 5:
Bible.Verse: 10 He that loveth silver shall not be satisfied with silver; nor he that loveth abundance with increase: this is also vanity.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 5:
Bible.Verse: 11 When goods increase, they are increased that eat them: and what good is there to the owners thereof, saving the beholding of them with their eyes?

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 5:
Bible.Verse: 12 The sleep of a labouring man is sweet, whether he eat little or much: but the abundance of the rich will not suffer him to sleep.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 5:
Bible.Verse: 13 There is a sore evil which I have seen under the sun, namely, riches kept for the owners thereof to their hurt.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 5:
Bible.Verse: 14 But those riches perish by evil travail: and he begetteth a son, and there is nothing in his hand.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 5:
Bible.Verse: 15 As he came forth of his mother's womb, naked shall he return to go as he came, and shall take nothing of his labour, which he may carry away in his hand.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 5:
Bible.Verse: 16 And this also is a sore evil, that in all points as he came, so shall he go: and what profit hath he that hath laboured for the wind?

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 5:
Bible.Verse: 17 All his days also he eateth in darkness, and he hath much sorrow and wrath with his sickness.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 5:
Bible.Verse: 18 Behold that which I have seen: it is good and comely for one to eat and to drink, and to enjoy the good of all his labour that he taketh under the sun all the days of his life, which God giveth him: for it is his portion.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 5:
Bible.Verse: 19 Every man also to whom God hath given riches and wealth, and hath given him power to eat thereof, and to take his portion, and to rejoice in his labour; this is the gift of God.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 5:
Bible.Verse: 20 For he shall not much remember the days of his life; because God answereth him in the joy of his heart.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 6:
Bible.Verse: 1 There is an evil which I have seen under the sun, and it is common among men:

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 6:
Bible.Verse: 2 A man to whom God hath given riches, wealth, and honour, so that he wanteth nothing for his soul of all that he desireth, yet God giveth him not power to eat thereof, but a stranger eateth it: this is vanity, and it is an evil disease.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 6:
Bible.Verse: 3 If a man beget an hundred children, and live many years, so that the days of his years be many, and his soul be not filled with good, and also that he have no burial; I say, that an untimely birth is better than he.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 6:
Bible.Verse: 4 For he cometh in with vanity, and departeth in darkness, and his name shall be covered with darkness.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 6:
Bible.Verse: 5 Moreover he hath not seen the sun, nor known any thing: this hath more rest than the other.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 6:
Bible.Verse: 6 Yea, though he live a thousand years twice told, yet hath he seen no good: do not all go to one place?

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 6:
Bible.Verse: 7 All the labour of man is for his mouth, and yet the appetite is not filled.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 6:
Bible.Verse: 8 For what hath the wise more than the fool? what hath the poor, that knoweth to walk before the living?

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 6:
Bible.Verse: 9 Better is the sight of the eyes than the wandering of the desire: this is also vanity and vexation of spirit.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 6:
Bible.Verse: 10 That which hath been is named already, and it is known that it is man: neither may he contend with him that is mightier than he.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 6:
Bible.Verse: 11 Seeing there be many things that increase vanity, what is man the better?

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 6:
Bible.Verse: 12 For who knoweth what is good for man in this life, all the days of his vain life which he spendeth as a shadow? for who can tell a man what shall be after him under the sun?

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 7:
Bible.Verse: 1 A good name is better than precious ointment; and the day of death than the day of one's birth.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 7:
Bible.Verse: 2 It is better to go to the house of mourning, than to go to the house of feasting: for that is the end of all men; and the living will lay it to his heart.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 7:
Bible.Verse: 3 Sorrow is better than laughter: for by the sadness of the countenance the heart is made better.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 7:
Bible.Verse: 4 The heart of the wise is in the house of mourning; but the heart of fools is in the house of mirth.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 7:
Bible.Verse: 5 It is better to hear the rebuke of the wise, than for a man to hear the song of fools.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 7:
Bible.Verse: 6 For as the crackling of thorns under a pot, so is the laughter of the fool: this also is vanity.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 7:
Bible.Verse: 7 Surely oppression maketh a wise man mad; and a gift destroyeth the heart.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 7:
Bible.Verse: 8 Better is the end of a thing than the beginning thereof: and the patient in spirit is better than the proud in spirit.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 7:
Bible.Verse: 9 Be not hasty in thy spirit to be angry: for anger resteth in the bosom of fools.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 7:
Bible.Verse: 10 Say not thou, What is the cause that the former days were better than these? for thou dost not enquire wisely concerning this.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 7:
Bible.Verse: 11 Wisdom is good with an inheritance: and by it there is profit to them that see the sun.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 7:
Bible.Verse: 12 For wisdom is a defence, and money is a defence: but the excellency of knowledge is, that wisdom giveth life to them that have it.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 7:
Bible.Verse: 13 Consider the work of God: for who can make that straight, which he hath made crooked?

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 7:
Bible.Verse: 14 In the day of prosperity be joyful, but in the day of adversity consider: God also hath set the one over against the other, to the end that man should find nothing after him.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 7:
Bible.Verse: 15 All things have I seen in the days of my vanity: there is a just man that perisheth in his righteousness, and there is a wicked man that prolongeth his life in his wickedness.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 7:
Bible.Verse: 16 Be not righteous over much; neither make thyself over wise: why shouldest thou destroy thyself ?

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 7:
Bible.Verse: 17 Be not over much wicked, neither be thou foolish: why shouldest thou die before thy time?

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 7:
Bible.Verse: 18 It is good that thou shouldest take hold of this; yea, also from this withdraw not thine hand: for he that feareth God shall come forth of them all.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 7:
Bible.Verse: 19 Wisdom strengtheneth the wise more than ten mighty men which are in the city.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 7:
Bible.Verse: 20 For there is not a just man upon earth, that doeth good, and sinneth not.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 7:
Bible.Verse: 21 Also take no heed unto all words that are spoken; lest thou hear thy servant curse thee:

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 7:
Bible.Verse: 22 For oftentimes also thine own heart knoweth that thou thyself likewise hast cursed others.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 7:
Bible.Verse: 23 All this have I proved by wisdom: I said, I will be wise; but it was far from me.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 7:
Bible.Verse: 24 That which is far off, and exceeding deep, who can find it out?

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 7:
Bible.Verse: 25 I applied mine heart to know, and to search, and to seek out wisdom, and the reason of things, and to know the wickedness of folly, even of foolishness and madness:

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 7:
Bible.Verse: 26 And I find more bitter than death the woman, whose heart is snares and nets, and her hands as bands: whoso pleaseth God shall escape from her; but the sinner shall be taken by her.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 7:
Bible.Verse: 27 Behold, this have I found, saith the preacher, counting one by one, to find out the account:

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 7:
Bible.Verse: 28 Which yet my soul seeketh, but I find not: one man among a thousand have I found; but a woman among all those have I not found.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 7:
Bible.Verse: 29 Lo, this only have I found, that God hath made man upright; but they have sought out many inventions.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 8:
Bible.Verse: 1 Who is as the wise man? and who knoweth the interpretation of a thing? a man's wisdom maketh his face to shine, and the boldness of his face shall be changed.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 8:
Bible.Verse: 2 I counsel thee to keep the king's commandment, and that in regard of the oath of God.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 8:
Bible.Verse: 3 Be not hasty to go out of his sight: stand not in an evil thing; for he doeth whatsoever pleaseth him.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 8:
Bible.Verse: 4 Where the word of a king is, there is power: and who may say unto him, What doest thou?

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 8:
Bible.Verse: 5 Whoso keepeth the commandment shall feel no evil thing: and a wise man's heart discerneth both time and judgment.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 8:
Bible.Verse: 6 Because to every purpose there is time and judgment, therefore the misery of man is great upon him.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 8:
Bible.Verse: 7 For he knoweth not that which shall be: for who can tell him when it shall be?

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 8:
Bible.Verse: 8 There is no man that hath power over the spirit to retain the spirit; neither hath he power in the day of death: and there is no discharge in that war; neither shall wickedness deliver those that are given to it.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 8:
Bible.Verse: 9 All this have I seen, and applied my heart unto every work that is done under the sun: there is a time wherein one man ruleth over another to his own hurt.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 8:
Bible.Verse: 10 And so I saw the wicked buried, who had come and gone from the place of the holy, and they were forgotten in the city where they had so done: this is also vanity.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 8:
Bible.Verse: 11 Because sentence against an evil work is not executed speedily, therefore the heart of the sons of men is fully set in them to do evil.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 8:
Bible.Verse: 12 Though a sinner do evil an hundred times, and his days be prolonged, yet surely I know that it shall be well with them that fear God, which fear before him:

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 8:
Bible.Verse: 13 But it shall not be well with the wicked, neither shall he prolong his days, which are as a shadow; because he feareth not before God.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 8:
Bible.Verse: 14 There is a vanity which is done upon the earth; that there be just men, unto whom it happeneth according to the work of the wicked; again, there be wicked men, to whom it happeneth according to the work of the righteous: I said that this also is vanity.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 8:
Bible.Verse: 15 Then I commended mirth, because a man hath no better thing under the sun, than to eat, and to drink, and to be merry: for that shall abide with him of his labour the days of his life, which God giveth him under the sun.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 8:
Bible.Verse: 16 When I applied mine heart to know wisdom, and to see the business that is done upon the earth: (for also there is that neither day nor night seeth sleep with his eyes:)

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 8:
Bible.Verse: 17 Then I beheld all the work of God, that a man cannot find out the work that is done under the sun: because though a man labour to seek it out, yet he shall not find it; yea farther; though a wise man think to know it, yet shall he not be able to find it.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 9:
Bible.Verse: 1 For all this I considered in my heart even to declare all this, that the righteous, and the wise, and their works, are in the hand of God: no man knoweth either love or hatred by all that is before them.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 9:
Bible.Verse: 2 All things come alike to all: there is one event to the righteous, and to the wicked; to the good and to the clean, and to the unclean; to him that sacrificeth, and to him that sacrificeth not: as is the good, so is the sinner; and he that sweareth, as he that feareth an oath.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 9:
Bible.Verse: 3 This is an evil among all things that are done under the sun, that there is one event unto all: yea, also the heart of the sons of men is full of evil, and madness is in their heart while they live, and after that they go to the dead.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 9:
Bible.Verse: 4 For to him that is joined to all the living there is hope: for a living dog is better than a dead lion.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 9:
Bible.Verse: 5 For the living know that they shall die: but the dead know not any thing, neither have they any more a reward; for the memory of them is forgotten.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 9:
Bible.Verse: 6 Also their love, and their hatred, and their envy, is now perished; neither have they any more a portion for ever in any thing that is done under the sun.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 9:
Bible.Verse: 7 Go thy way, eat thy bread with joy, and drink thy wine with a merry heart; for God now accepteth thy works.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 9:
Bible.Verse: 8 Let thy garments be always white; and let thy head lack no ointment.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 9:
Bible.Verse: 9 Live joyfully with the wife whom thou lovest all the days of the life of thy vanity, which he hath given thee under the sun, all the days of thy vanity: for that is thy portion in this life, and in thy labour which thou takest under the sun.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 9:
Bible.Verse: 10 Whatsoever thy hand findeth to do, do it with thy might; for there is no work, nor device, nor knowledge, nor wisdom, in the grave, whither thou goest.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 9:
Bible.Verse: 11 I returned, and saw under the sun, that the race is not to the swift, nor the battle to the strong, neither yet bread to the wise, nor yet riches to men of understanding, nor yet favour to men of skill; but time and chance happeneth to them all.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 9:
Bible.Verse: 12 For man also knoweth not his time: as the fishes that are taken in an evil net, and as the birds that are caught in the snare; so are the sons of men snared in an evil time, when it falleth suddenly upon them.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 9:
Bible.Verse: 13 This wisdom have I seen also under the sun, and it seemed great unto me:

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 9:
Bible.Verse: 14 There was a little city, and few men within it; and there came a great king against it, and besieged it, and built great bulwarks against it:

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 9:
Bible.Verse: 15 Now there was found in it a poor wise man, and he by his wisdom delivered the city; yet no man remembered that same poor man.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 9:
Bible.Verse: 16 Then said I, Wisdom is better than strength: nevertheless the poor man's wisdom is despised, and his words are not heard.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 9:
Bible.Verse: 17 The words of wise men are heard in quiet more than the cry of him that ruleth among fools.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 9:
Bible.Verse: 18 Wisdom is better than weapons of war: but one sinner destroyeth much good.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 10:
Bible.Verse: 1 Dead flies cause the ointment of the apothecary to send forth a stinking savour: so doth a little folly him that is in reputation for wisdom and honour.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 10:
Bible.Verse: 2 A wise man's heart is at his right hand; but a fool's heart at his left.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 10:
Bible.Verse: 3 Yea also, when he that is a fool walketh by the way, his wisdom faileth him, and he saith to every one that he is a fool.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 10:
Bible.Verse: 4 If the spirit of the ruler rise up against thee, leave not thy place; for yielding pacifieth great offences.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 10:
Bible.Verse: 5 There is an evil which I have seen under the sun, as an error which proceedeth from the ruler:

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 10:
Bible.Verse: 6 Folly is set in great dignity, and the rich sit in low place.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 10:
Bible.Verse: 7 I have seen servants upon horses, and princes walking as servants upon the earth.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 10:
Bible.Verse: 8 He that diggeth a pit shall fall into it; and whoso breaketh an hedge, a serpent shall bite him.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 10:
Bible.Verse: 9 Whoso removeth stones shall be hurt therewith; and he that cleaveth wood shall be endangered thereby.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 10:
Bible.Verse: 10 If the iron be blunt, and he do not whet the edge, then must he put to more strength: but wisdom is profitable to direct.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 10:
Bible.Verse: 11 Surely the serpent will bite without enchantment; and a babbler is no better.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 10:
Bible.Verse: 12 The words of a wise man's mouth are gracious; but the lips of a fool will swallow up himself.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 10:
Bible.Verse: 13 The beginning of the words of his mouth is foolishness: and the end of his talk is mischievous madness.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 10:
Bible.Verse: 14 A fool also is full of words: a man cannot tell what shall be; and what shall be after him, who can tell him?

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 10:
Bible.Verse: 15 The labour of the foolish wearieth every one of them, because he knoweth not how to go to the city.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 10:
Bible.Verse: 16 Woe to thee, O land, when thy king is a child, and thy princes eat in the morning!

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 10:
Bible.Verse: 17 Blessed art thou, O land, when thy king is the son of nobles, and thy princes eat in due season, for strength, and not for drunkenness!

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 10:
Bible.Verse: 18 By much slothfulness the building decayeth; and through idleness of the hands the house droppeth through.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 10:
Bible.Verse: 19 A feast is made for laughter, and wine maketh merry: but money answereth all things.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 10:
Bible.Verse: 20 Curse not the king, no not in thy thought; and curse not the rich in thy bedchamber: for a bird of the air shall carry the voice, and that which hath wings shall tell the matter.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 11:
Bible.Verse: 1 Cast thy bread upon the waters: for thou shalt find it after many days.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 11:
Bible.Verse: 2 Give a portion to seven, and also to eight; for thou knowest not what evil shall be upon the earth.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 11:
Bible.Verse: 3 If the clouds be full of rain, they empty themselves upon the earth: and if the tree fall toward the south, or toward the north, in the place where the tree falleth, there it shall be.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 11:
Bible.Verse: 4 He that observeth the wind shall not sow; and he that regardeth the clouds shall not reap.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 11:
Bible.Verse: 5 As thou knowest not what is the way of the spirit, nor how the bones do grow in the womb of her that is with child: even so thou knowest not the works of God who maketh all.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 11:
Bible.Verse: 6 In the morning sow thy seed, and in the evening withhold not thine hand: for thou knowest not whether shall prosper, either this or that, or whether they both shall be alike good.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 11:
Bible.Verse: 7 Truly the light is sweet, and a pleasant thing it is for the eyes to behold the sun:

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 11:
Bible.Verse: 8 But if a man live many years, and rejoice in them all; yet let him remember the days of darkness; for they shall be many. All that cometh is vanity.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 11:
Bible.Verse: 9 Rejoice, O young man, in thy youth; and let thy heart cheer thee in the days of thy youth, and walk in the ways of thine heart, and in the sight of thine eyes: but know thou, that for all these things God will bring thee into judgment.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 11:
Bible.Verse: 10 Therefore remove sorrow from thy heart, and put away evil from thy flesh: for childhood and youth are vanity.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 12:
Bible.Verse: 1 Remember now thy Creator in the days of thy youth, while the evil days come not, nor the years draw nigh, when thou shalt say, I have no pleasure in them;

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 12:
Bible.Verse: 2 While the sun, or the light, or the moon, or the stars, be not darkened, nor the clouds return after the rain:

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 12:
Bible.Verse: 3 In the day when the keepers of the house shall tremble, and the strong men shall bow themselves, and the grinders cease because they are few, and those that look out of the windows be darkened,

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 12:
Bible.Verse: 4 And the doors shall be shut in the streets, when the sound of the grinding is low, and he shall rise up at the voice of the bird, and all the daughters of musick shall be brought low;

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 12:
