Bible.Verse: 5 Also when they shall be afraid of that which is high, and fears shall be in the way, and the almond tree shall flourish, and the grasshopper shall be a burden, and desire shall fail: because man goeth to his long home, and the mourners go about the streets:

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 12:
Bible.Verse: 6 Or ever the silver cord be loosed, or the golden bowl be broken, or the pitcher be broken at the fountain, or the wheel broken at the cistern.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 12:
Bible.Verse: 7 Then shall the dust return to the earth as it was: and the spirit shall return unto God who gave it.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 12:
Bible.Verse: 8 Vanity of vanities, saith the preacher; all is vanity.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 12:
Bible.Verse: 9 And moreover, because the preacher was wise, he still taught the people knowledge; yea, he gave good heed, and sought out, and set in order many proverbs.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 12:
Bible.Verse: 10 The preacher sought to find out acceptable words: and that which was written was upright, even words of truth.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 12:
Bible.Verse: 11 The words of the wise are as goads, and as nails fastened by the masters of assemblies, which are given from one shepherd.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 12:
Bible.Verse: 12 And further, by these, my son, be admonished: of making many books there is no end; and much study is a weariness of the flesh.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 12:
Bible.Verse: 13 Let us hear the conclusion of the whole matter: Fear God, and keep his commandments: for this is the whole duty of man.

Bible.Title: Ecclesiates 12:
Bible.Verse: 14 For God shall bring every work into judgment, with every secret thing, whether it be good, or whether it be evil.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 1:
Bible.Verse: 1 The song of songs, which is Solomon's.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 1:
Bible.Verse: 2 Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth: for thy love is better than wine.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 1:
Bible.Verse: 3 Because of the savour of thy good ointments thy name is as ointment poured forth, therefore do the virgins love thee.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 1:
Bible.Verse: 4 Draw me, we will run after thee: the king hath brought me into his chambers: we will be glad and rejoice in thee, we will remember thy love more than wine: the upright love thee.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 1:
Bible.Verse: 5 I am black, but comely, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, as the tents of Kedar, as the curtains of Solomon.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 1:
Bible.Verse: 6 Look not upon me, because I am black, because the sun hath looked upon me: my mother's children were angry with me; they made me the keeper of the vineyards; but mine own vineyard have I not kept.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 1:
Bible.Verse: 7 Tell me, O thou whom my soul loveth, where thou feedest, where thou makest thy flock to rest at noon: for why should I be as one that turneth aside by the flocks of thy companions?

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 1:
Bible.Verse: 8 If thou know not, O thou fairest among women, go thy way forth by the footsteps of the flock, and feed thy kids beside the shepherds' tents.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 1:
Bible.Verse: 9 I have compared thee, O my love, to a company of horses in Pharaoh's chariots.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 1:
Bible.Verse: 10 Thy cheeks are comely with rows of jewels, thy neck with chains of gold.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 1:
Bible.Verse: 11 We will make thee borders of gold with studs of silver.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 1:
Bible.Verse: 12 While the king sitteth at his table, my spikenard sendeth forth the smell thereof.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 1:
Bible.Verse: 13 A bundle of myrrh is my well-beloved unto me; he shall lie all night betwixt my breasts.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 1:
Bible.Verse: 14 My beloved is unto me as a cluster of camphire in the vineyards of Engedi.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 1:
Bible.Verse: 15 Behold, thou art fair, my love; behold, thou art fair; thou hast doves' eyes.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 1:
Bible.Verse: 16 Behold, thou art fair, my beloved, yea, pleasant: also our bed is green.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 1:
Bible.Verse: 17 The beams of our house are cedar, and our rafters of fir.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 2:
Bible.Verse: 1 I am the rose of Sharon, and the lily of the valleys.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 2:
Bible.Verse: 2 As the lily among thorns, so is my love among the daughters.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 2:
Bible.Verse: 3 As the apple tree among the trees of the wood, so is my beloved among the sons. I sat down under his shadow with great delight, and his fruit was sweet to my taste.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 2:
Bible.Verse: 4 He brought me to the banqueting house, and his banner over me was love.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 2:
Bible.Verse: 5 Stay me with flagons, comfort me with apples: for I am sick of love.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 2:
Bible.Verse: 6 His left hand is under my head, and his right hand doth embrace me.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 2:
Bible.Verse: 7 I charge you, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, by the roes, and by the hinds of the field, that ye stir not up, nor awake my love, till he please.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 2:
Bible.Verse: 8 The voice of my beloved! behold, he cometh leaping upon the mountains, skipping upon the hills.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 2:
Bible.Verse: 9 My beloved is like a roe or a young hart: behold, he standeth behind our wall, he looketh forth at the windows, shewing himself through the lattice.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 2:
Bible.Verse: 10 My beloved spake, and said unto me, Rise up, my love, my fair one, and come away.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 2:
Bible.Verse: 11 For, lo, the winter is past, the rain is over and gone;

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 2:
Bible.Verse: 12 The flowers appear on the earth; the time of the singing of birds is come, and the voice of the turtle is heard in our land;

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 2:
Bible.Verse: 13 The fig tree putteth forth her green figs, and the vines with the tender grape give a good smell. Arise, my love, my fair one, and come away.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 2:
Bible.Verse: 14 O my dove, that art in the clefts of the rock, in the secret places of the stairs, let me see thy countenance, let me hear thy voice; for sweet is thy voice, and thy countenance is comely.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 2:
Bible.Verse: 15 Take us the foxes, the little foxes, that spoil the vines: for our vines have tender grapes.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 2:
Bible.Verse: 16 My beloved is mine, and I am his: he feedeth among the lilies.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 2:
Bible.Verse: 17 Until the day break, and the shadows flee away, turn, my beloved, and be thou like a roe or a young hart upon the mountains of Bether.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 3:
Bible.Verse: 1 By night on my bed I sought him whom my soul loveth: I sought him, but I found him not.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 3:
Bible.Verse: 2 I will rise now, and go about the city in the streets, and in the broad ways I will seek him whom my soul loveth: I sought him, but I found him not.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 3:
Bible.Verse: 3 The watchmen that go about the city found me: to whom I said, Saw ye him whom my soul loveth?

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 3:
Bible.Verse: 4 It was but a little that I passed from them, but I found him whom my soul loveth: I held him, and would not let him go, until I had brought him into my mother's house, and into the chamber of her that conceived me.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 3:
Bible.Verse: 5 I charge you, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, by the roes, and by the hinds of the field, that ye stir not up, nor awake my love, till he please.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 3:
Bible.Verse: 6 Who is this that cometh out of the wilderness like pillars of smoke, perfumed with myrrh and frankincense, with all powders of the merchant?

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 3:
Bible.Verse: 7 Behold his bed, which is Solomon's; threescore valiant men are about it, of the valiant of Israel.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 3:
Bible.Verse: 8 They all hold swords, being expert in war: every man hath his sword upon his thigh because of fear in the night.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 3:
Bible.Verse: 9 King Solomon made himself a chariot of the wood of Lebanon.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 3:
Bible.Verse: 10 He made the pillars thereof of silver, the bottom thereof of gold, the covering of it of purple, the midst thereof being paved with love, for the daughters of Jerusalem.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 3:
Bible.Verse: 11 Go forth, O ye daughters of Zion, and behold king Solomon with the crown wherewith his mother crowned him in the day of his espousals, and in the day of the gladness of his heart.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 4:
Bible.Verse: 1 Behold, thou art fair, my love; behold, thou art fair; thou hast doves' eyes within thy locks: thy hair is as a flock of goats, that appear from mount Gilead.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 4:
Bible.Verse: 2 Thy teeth are like a flock of sheep that are even shorn, which came up from the washing; whereof every one bear twins, and none is barren among them.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 4:
Bible.Verse: 3 Thy lips are like a thread of scarlet, and thy speech is comely: thy temples are like a piece of a pomegranate within thy locks.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 4:
Bible.Verse: 4 Thy neck is like the tower of David builded for an armoury, whereon there hang a thousand bucklers, all shields of mighty men.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 4:
Bible.Verse: 5 Thy two breasts are like two young roes that are twins, which feed among the lilies.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 4:
Bible.Verse: 6 Until the day break, and the shadows flee away, I will get me to the mountain of myrrh, and to the hill of frankincense.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 4:
Bible.Verse: 7 Thou art all fair, my love; there is no spot in thee.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 4:
Bible.Verse: 8 Come with me from Lebanon, my spouse, with me from Lebanon: look from the top of Amana, from the top of Shenir and Hermon, from the lions' dens, from the mountains of the leopards.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 4:
Bible.Verse: 9 Thou hast ravished my heart, my sister, my spouse; thou hast ravished my heart with one of thine eyes, with one chain of thy neck.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 4:
Bible.Verse: 10 How fair is thy love, my sister, my spouse! how much better is thy love than wine! and the smell of thine ointments than all spices!

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 4:
Bible.Verse: 11 Thy lips, O my spouse, drop as the honeycomb: honey and milk are under thy tongue; and the smell of thy garments is like the smell of Lebanon.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 4:
Bible.Verse: 12 A garden inclosed is my sister, my spouse; a spring shut up, a fountain sealed.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 4:
Bible.Verse: 13 Thy plants are an orchard of pomegranates, with pleasant fruits; camphire, with spikenard,

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 4:
Bible.Verse: 14 Spikenard and saffron; calamus and cinnamon, with all trees of frankincense; myrrh and aloes, with all the chief spices:

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 4:
Bible.Verse: 15 A fountain of gardens, a well of living waters, and streams from Lebanon.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 4:
Bible.Verse: 16 Awake, O north wind; and come, thou south; blow upon my garden, that the spices thereof may flow out. Let my beloved come into his garden, and eat his pleasant fruits.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 5:
Bible.Verse: 1 I am come into my garden, my sister, my spouse: I have gathered my myrrh with my spice; I have eaten my honeycomb with my honey; I have drunk my wine with my milk: eat, O friends; drink, yea, drink abundantly, O beloved.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 5:
Bible.Verse: 2 I sleep, but my heart waketh: it is the voice of my beloved that knocketh, saying, Open to me, my sister, my love, my dove, my undefiled: for my head is filled with dew, and my locks with the drops of the night.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 5:
Bible.Verse: 3 I have put off my coat; how shall I put it on? I have washed my feet; how shall I defile them?

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 5:
Bible.Verse: 4 My beloved put in his hand by the hole of the door, and my bowels were moved for him.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 5:
Bible.Verse: 5 I rose up to open to my beloved; and my hands dropped with myrrh, and my fingers with sweet smelling myrrh, upon the handles of the lock.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 5:
Bible.Verse: 6 I opened to my beloved; but my beloved had withdrawn himself, and was gone: my soul failed when he spake: I sought him, but I could not find him; I called him, but he gave me no answer.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 5:
Bible.Verse: 7 The watchmen that went about the city found me, they smote me, they wounded me; the keepers of the walls took away my veil from me.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 5:
Bible.Verse: 8 I charge you, O daughters of Jerusalem, if ye find my beloved, that ye tell him, that I am sick of love.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 5:
Bible.Verse: 9 What is thy beloved more than another beloved, O thou fairest among women? what is thy beloved more than another beloved, that thou dost so charge us?

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 5:
Bible.Verse: 10 My beloved is white and ruddy, the chiefest among ten thousand.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 5:
Bible.Verse: 11 His head is as the most fine gold, his locks are bushy, and black as a raven.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 5:
Bible.Verse: 12 His eyes are as the eyes of doves by the rivers of waters, washed with milk, and fitly set.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 5:
Bible.Verse: 13 His cheeks are as a bed of spices, as sweet flowers: his lips like lilies, dropping sweet smelling myrrh.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 5:
Bible.Verse: 14 His hands are as gold rings set with the beryl: his belly is as bright ivory overlaid with sapphires.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 5:
Bible.Verse: 15 His legs are as pillars of marble, set upon sockets of fine gold: his countenance is as Lebanon, excellent as the cedars.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 5:
Bible.Verse: 16 His mouth is most sweet: yea, he is altogether lovely. This is my beloved, and this is my friend, O daughters of Jerusalem.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 6:
Bible.Verse: 1 Whither is thy beloved gone, O thou fairest among women? whither is thy beloved turned aside? that we may seek him with thee.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 6:
Bible.Verse: 2 My beloved is gone down into his garden, to the beds of spices, to feed in the gardens, and to gather lilies.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 6:
Bible.Verse: 3 I am my beloved's, and my beloved is mine: he feedeth among the lilies.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 6:
Bible.Verse: 4 Thou art beautiful, O my love, as Tirzah, comely as Jerusalem, terrible as an army with banners.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 6:
Bible.Verse: 5 Turn away thine eyes from me, for they have overcome me: thy hair is as a flock of goats that appear from Gilead.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 6:
Bible.Verse: 6 Thy teeth are as a flock of sheep which go up from the washing, whereof every one beareth twins, and there is not one barren among them.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 6:
Bible.Verse: 7 As a piece of a pomegranate are thy temples within thy locks.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 6:
Bible.Verse: 8 There are threescore queens, and fourscore concubines, and virgins without number.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 6:
Bible.Verse: 9 My dove, my undefiled is but one; she is the only one of her mother, she is the choice one of her that bare her. The daughters saw her, and blessed her; yea, the queens and the concubines, and they praised her.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 6:
Bible.Verse: 10 Who is she that looketh forth as the morning, fair as the moon, clear as the sun, and terrible as an army with banners?

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 6:
Bible.Verse: 11 I went down into the garden of nuts to see the fruits of the valley, and to see whether the vine flourished, and the pomegranates budded.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 6:
Bible.Verse: 12 Or ever I was aware, my soul made me like the chariots of Amminadib.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 6:
Bible.Verse: 13 Return, return, O Shulamite; return, return, that we may look upon thee. What will ye see in the Shulamite? As it were the company of two armies.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 7:
Bible.Verse: 1 How beautiful are thy feet with shoes, O prince's daughter! the joints of thy thighs are like jewels, the work of the hands of a cunning workman.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 7:
Bible.Verse: 2 Thy navel is like a round goblet, which wanteth not liquor: thy belly is like an heap of wheat set about with lilies.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 7:
Bible.Verse: 3 Thy two breasts are like two young roes that are twins.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 7:
Bible.Verse: 4 Thy neck is as a tower of ivory; thine eyes like the fishpools in Heshbon, by the gate of Bathrabbim: thy nose is as the tower of Lebanon which looketh toward Damascus.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 7:
Bible.Verse: 5 Thine head upon thee is like Carmel, and the hair of thine head like purple; the king is held in the galleries.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 7:
Bible.Verse: 6 How fair and how pleasant art thou, O love, for delights!

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 7:
Bible.Verse: 7 This thy stature is like to a palm tree, and thy breasts to clusters of grapes.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 7:
Bible.Verse: 8 I said, I will go up to the palm tree, I will take hold of the boughs thereof: now also thy breasts shall be as clusters of the vine, and the smell of thy nose like apples;

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 7:
Bible.Verse: 9 And the roof of thy mouth like the best wine for my beloved, that goeth down sweetly, causing the lips of those that are asleep to speak.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 7:
Bible.Verse: 10 I am my beloved's, and his desire is toward me.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 7:
Bible.Verse: 11 Come, my beloved, let us go forth into the field; let us lodge in the villages.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 7:
Bible.Verse: 12 Let us get up early to the vineyards; let us see if the vine flourish, whether the tender grape appear, and the pomegranates bud forth: there will I give thee my loves.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 7:
Bible.Verse: 13 The mandrakes give a smell, and at our gates are all manner of pleasant fruits, new and old, which I have laid up for thee, O my beloved.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 8:
Bible.Verse: 1 O that thou wert as my brother, that sucked the breasts of my mother! when I should find thee without, I would kiss thee; yea, I should not be despised.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 8:
Bible.Verse: 2 I would lead thee, and bring thee into my mother's house, who would instruct me: I would cause thee to drink of spiced wine of the juice of my pomegranate.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 8:
Bible.Verse: 3 His left hand should be under my head, and his right hand should embrace me.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 8:
Bible.Verse: 4 I charge you, O daughters of Jerusalem, that ye stir not up, nor awake my love, until he please.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 8:
Bible.Verse: 5 Who is this that cometh up from the wilderness, leaning upon her beloved? I raised thee up under the apple tree: there thy mother brought thee forth: there she brought thee forth that bare thee.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 8:
Bible.Verse: 6 Set me as a seal upon thine heart, as a seal upon thine arm: for love is strong as death; jealousy is cruel as the grave: the coals thereof are coals of fire, which hath a most vehement flame.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 8:
Bible.Verse: 7 Many waters cannot quench love, neither can the floods drown it: if a man would give all the substance of his house for love, it would utterly be contemned.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 8:
Bible.Verse: 8 We have a little sister, and she hath no breasts: what shall we do for our sister in the day when she shall be spoken for?

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 8:
Bible.Verse: 9 If she be a wall, we will build upon her a palace of silver: and if she be a door, we will inclose her with boards of cedar.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 8:
Bible.Verse: 10 I am a wall, and my breasts like towers: then was I in his eyes as one that found favour.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 8:
Bible.Verse: 11 Solomon had a vineyard at Baalhamon; he let out the vineyard unto keepers; every one for the fruit thereof was to bring a thousand pieces of silver.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 8:
Bible.Verse: 12 My vineyard, which is mine, is before me: thou, O Solomon, must have a thousand, and those that keep the fruit thereof two hundred.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 8:
Bible.Verse: 13 Thou that dwellest in the gardens, the companions hearken to thy voice: cause me to hear it.

Bible.Title: Song of Solomon 8:
Bible.Verse: 14 Make haste, my beloved, and be thou like to a roe or to a young hart upon the mountains of spices.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 1:
Bible.Verse: 1 The vision of Isaiah the son of Amoz, which he saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 1:
Bible.Verse: 2 Hear, O heavens, and give ear, O earth: for the LORD hath spoken, I have nourished and brought up children, and they have rebelled against me.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 1:
Bible.Verse: 3 The ox knoweth his owner, and the ass his master's crib: but Israel doth not know, my people doth not consider.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 1:
Bible.Verse: 4 Ah sinful nation, a people laden with iniquity, a seed of evildoers, children that are corrupters: they have forsaken the LORD, they have provoked the Holy One of Israel unto anger, they are gone away backward.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 1:
Bible.Verse: 5 Why should ye be stricken any more? ye will revolt more and more: the whole head is sick, and the whole heart faint.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 1:
Bible.Verse: 6 From the sole of the foot even unto the head there is no soundness in it; but wounds, and bruises, and putrifying sores: they have not been closed, neither bound up, neither mollified with ointment.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 1:
Bible.Verse: 7 Your country is desolate, your cities are burned with fire: your land, strangers devour it in your presence, and it is desolate, as overthrown by strangers.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 1:
Bible.Verse: 8 And the daughter of Zion is left as a cottage in a vineyard, as a lodge in a garden of cucumbers, as a besieged city.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 1:
Bible.Verse: 9 Except the LORD of hosts had left unto us a very small remnant, we should have been as Sodom, and we should have been like unto Gomorrah.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 1:
Bible.Verse: 10 Hear the word of the LORD, ye rulers of Sodom; give ear unto the law of our God, ye people of Gomorrah.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 1:
Bible.Verse: 11 To what purpose is the multitude of your sacrifices unto me? saith the LORD: I am full of the burnt offerings of rams, and the fat of fed beasts; and I delight not in the blood of bullocks, or of lambs, or of he goats.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 1:
Bible.Verse: 12 When ye come to appear before me, who hath required this at your hand, to tread my courts?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 1:
Bible.Verse: 13 Bring no more vain oblations; incense is an abomination unto me; the new moons and sabbaths, the calling of assemblies, I cannot away with; it is iniquity, even the solemn meeting.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 1:
Bible.Verse: 14 Your new moons and your appointed feasts my soul hateth: they are a trouble unto me; I am weary to bear them.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 1:
Bible.Verse: 15 And when ye spread forth your hands, I will hide mine eyes from you: yea, when ye make many prayers, I will not hear: your hands are full of blood.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 1:
Bible.Verse: 16 Wash you, make you clean; put away the evil of your doings from before mine eyes; cease to do evil;

Bible.Title: Isaiah 1:
Bible.Verse: 17 Learn to do well; seek judgment, relieve the oppressed, judge the fatherless, plead for the widow.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 1:
Bible.Verse: 18 Come now, and let us reason together, saith the LORD: though your sins be as scarlet, they shall be as white as snow; though they be red like crimson, they shall be as wool.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 1:
Bible.Verse: 19 If ye be willing and obedient, ye shall eat the good of the land:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 1:
Bible.Verse: 20 But if ye refuse and rebel, ye shall be devoured with the sword: for the mouth of the LORD hath spoken it.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 1:
Bible.Verse: 21 How is the faithful city become an harlot! it was full of judgment; righteousness lodged in it; but now murderers.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 1:
Bible.Verse: 22 Thy silver is become dross, thy wine mixed with water:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 1:
Bible.Verse: 23 Thy princes are rebellious, and companions of thieves: every one loveth gifts, and followeth after rewards: they judge not the fatherless, neither doth the cause of the widow come unto them.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 1:
Bible.Verse: 24 Therefore saith the LORD, the LORD of hosts, the mighty One of Israel, Ah, I will ease me of mine adversaries, and avenge me of mine enemies:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 1:
Bible.Verse: 25 And I will turn my hand upon thee, and purely purge away thy dross, and take away all thy tin:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 1:
Bible.Verse: 26 And I will restore thy judges as at the first, and thy counsellors as at the beginning: afterward thou shalt be called, The city of righteousness, the faithful city.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 1:
Bible.Verse: 27 Zion shall be redeemed with judgment, and her converts with righteousness.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 1:
Bible.Verse: 28 And the destruction of the transgressors and of the sinners shall be together, and they that forsake the LORD shall be consumed.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 1:
Bible.Verse: 29 For they shall be ashamed of the oaks which ye have desired, and ye shall be confounded for the gardens that ye have chosen.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 1:
Bible.Verse: 30 For ye shall be as an oak whose leaf fadeth, and as a garden that hath no water.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 1:
Bible.Verse: 31 And the strong shall be as tow, and the maker of it as a spark, and they shall both burn together, and none shall quench them.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 2:
Bible.Verse: 1 The word that Isaiah the son of Amoz saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 2:
Bible.Verse: 2 And it shall come to pass in the last days, that the mountain of the LORD's house shall be established in the top of the mountains, and shall be exalted above the hills; and all nations shall flow unto it.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 2:
Bible.Verse: 3 And many people shall go and say, Come ye, and let us go up to the mountain of the LORD, to the house of the God of Jacob; and he will teach us of his ways, and we will walk in his paths: for out of Zion shall go forth the law, and the word of the LORD from Jerusalem.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 2:
Bible.Verse: 4 And he shall judge among the nations, and shall rebuke many people: and they shall beat their swords into plowshares, and their spears into pruninghooks: nation shall not lift up sword against nation, neither shall they learn war any more.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 2:
Bible.Verse: 5 O house of Jacob, come ye, and let us walk in the light of the LORD.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 2:
Bible.Verse: 6 Therefore thou hast forsaken thy people the house of Jacob, because they be replenished from the east, and are soothsayers like the Philistines, and they please themselves in the children of strangers.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 2:
Bible.Verse: 7 Their land also is full of silver and gold, neither is there any end of their treasures; their land is also full of horses, neither is there any end of their chariots:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 2:
Bible.Verse: 8 Their land also is full of idols; they worship the work of their own hands, that which their own fingers have made:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 2:
Bible.Verse: 9 And the mean man boweth down, and the great man humbleth himself: therefore forgive them not.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 2:
Bible.Verse: 10 Enter into the rock, and hide thee in the dust, for fear of the LORD, and for the glory of his majesty.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 2:
Bible.Verse: 11 The lofty looks of man shall be humbled, and the haughtiness of men shall be bowed down, and the LORD alone shall be exalted in that day.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 2:
Bible.Verse: 12 For the day of the LORD of hosts shall be upon every one that is proud and lofty, and upon every one that is lifted up; and he shall be brought low:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 2:
Bible.Verse: 13 And upon all the cedars of Lebanon, that are high and lifted up, and upon all the oaks of Bashan,

Bible.Title: Isaiah 2:
Bible.Verse: 14 And upon all the high mountains, and upon all the hills that are lifted up,

Bible.Title: Isaiah 2:
Bible.Verse: 15 And upon every high tower, and upon every fenced wall,

Bible.Title: Isaiah 2:
Bible.Verse: 16 And upon all the ships of Tarshish, and upon all pleasant pictures.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 2:
Bible.Verse: 17 And the loftiness of man shall be bowed down, and the haughtiness of men shall be made low: and the LORD alone shall be exalted in that day.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 2:
Bible.Verse: 18 And the idols he shall utterly abolish.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 2:
Bible.Verse: 19 And they shall go into the holes of the rocks, and into the caves of the earth, for fear of the LORD, and for the glory of his majesty, when he ariseth to shake terribly the earth.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 2:
Bible.Verse: 20 In that day a man shall cast his idols of silver, and his idols of gold, which they made each one for himself to worship, to the moles and to the bats;

Bible.Title: Isaiah 2:
Bible.Verse: 21 To go into the clefts of the rocks, and into the tops of the ragged rocks, for fear of the LORD, and for the glory of his majesty, when he ariseth to shake terribly the earth.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 2:
Bible.Verse: 22 Cease ye from man, whose breath is in his nostrils: for wherein is he to be accounted of ?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 3:
Bible.Verse: 1 For, behold, the Lord, the LORD of hosts, doth take away from Jerusalem and from Judah the stay and the staff, the whole stay of bread, and the whole stay of water.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 3:
Bible.Verse: 2 The mighty man, and the man of war, the judge, and the prophet, and the prudent, and the ancient,

Bible.Title: Isaiah 3:
Bible.Verse: 3 The captain of fifty, and the honourable man, and the counsellor, and the cunning artificer, and the eloquent orator.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 3:
Bible.Verse: 4 And I will give children to be their princes, and babes shall rule over them.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 3:
Bible.Verse: 5 And the people shall be oppressed, every one by another, and every one by his neighbour: the child shall behave himself proudly against the ancient, and the base against the honourable.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 3:
Bible.Verse: 6 When a man shall take hold of his brother of the house of his father, saying, Thou hast clothing, be thou our ruler, and let this ruin be under thy hand:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 3:
Bible.Verse: 7 In that day shall he swear, saying, I will not be an healer; for in my house is neither bread nor clothing: make me not a ruler of the people.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 3:
Bible.Verse: 8 For Jerusalem is ruined, and Judah is fallen: because their tongue and their doings are against the LORD, to provoke the eyes of his glory.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 3:
Bible.Verse: 9 The shew of their countenance doth witness against them; and they declare their sin as Sodom, they hide it not. Woe unto their soul! for they have rewarded evil unto themselves.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 3:
Bible.Verse: 10 Say ye to the righteous, that it shall be well with him: for they shall eat the fruit of their doings.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 3:
Bible.Verse: 11 Woe unto the wicked! it shall be ill with him: for the reward of his hands shall be given him.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 3:
Bible.Verse: 12 As for my people, children are their oppressors, and women rule over them. O my people, they which lead thee cause thee to err, and destroy the way of thy paths.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 3:
Bible.Verse: 13 The LORD standeth up to plead, and standeth to judge the people.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 3:
Bible.Verse: 14 The LORD will enter into judgment with the ancients of his people, and the princes thereof: for ye have eaten up the vineyard; the spoil of the poor is in your houses.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 3:
Bible.Verse: 15 What mean ye that ye beat my people to pieces, and grind the faces of the poor? saith the Lord GOD of hosts.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 3:
Bible.Verse: 16 Moreover the LORD saith, Because the daughters of Zion are haughty, and walk with stretched forth necks and wanton eyes, walking and mincing as they go, and making a tinkling with their feet:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 3:
Bible.Verse: 17 Therefore the LORD will smite with a scab the crown of the head of the daughters of Zion, and the LORD will discover their secret parts.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 3:
Bible.Verse: 18 In that day the Lord will take away the bravery of their tinkling ornaments about their feet, and their cauls, and their round tires like the moon,

Bible.Title: Isaiah 3:
Bible.Verse: 19 The chains, and the bracelets, and the mufflers,

Bible.Title: Isaiah 3:
Bible.Verse: 20 The bonnets, and the ornaments of the legs, and the headbands, and the tablets, and the earrings,

Bible.Title: Isaiah 3:
Bible.Verse: 21 The rings, and nose jewels,

Bible.Title: Isaiah 3:
Bible.Verse: 22 The changeable suits of apparel, and the mantles, and the wimples, and the crisping pins,

Bible.Title: Isaiah 3:
Bible.Verse: 23 The glasses, and the fine linen, and the hoods, and the vails.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 3:
Bible.Verse: 24 And it shall come to pass, that instead of sweet smell there shall be stink; and instead of a girdle a rent; and instead of well set hair baldness; and instead of a stomacher a girding of sackcloth; and burning instead of beauty.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 3:
Bible.Verse: 25 Thy men shall fall by the sword, and thy mighty in the war.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 3:
Bible.Verse: 26 And her gates shall lament and mourn; and she being desolate shall sit upon the ground.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 4:
Bible.Verse: 1 And in that day seven women shall take hold of one man, saying, We will eat our own bread, and wear our own apparel: only let us be called by thy name, to take away our reproach.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 4:
Bible.Verse: 2 In that day shall the branch of the LORD be beautiful and glorious, and the fruit of the earth shall be excellent and comely for them that are escaped of Israel.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 4:
Bible.Verse: 3 And it shall come to pass, that he that is left in Zion, and he that remaineth in Jerusalem, shall be called holy, even every one that is written among the living in Jerusalem:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 4:
Bible.Verse: 4 When the Lord shall have washed away the filth of the daughters of Zion, and shall have purged the blood of Jerusalem from the midst thereof by the spirit of judgment, and by the spirit of burning.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 4:
Bible.Verse: 5 And the LORD will create upon every dwelling place of mount Zion, and upon her assemblies, a cloud and smoke by day, and the shining of a flaming fire by night: for upon all the glory shall be a defence.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 4:
Bible.Verse: 6 And there shall be a tabernacle for a shadow in the day time from the heat, and for a place of refuge, and for a covert from storm and from rain.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 5:
Bible.Verse: 1 Now will I sing to my wellbeloved a song of my beloved touching his vineyard. My wellbeloved hath a vineyard in a very fruitful hill:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 5:
Bible.Verse: 2 And he fenced it, and gathered out the stones thereof, and planted it with the choicest vine, and built a tower in the midst of it, and also made a winepress therein: and he looked that it should bring forth grapes, and it brought forth wild grapes.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 5:
Bible.Verse: 3 And now, O inhabitants of Jerusalem, and men of Judah, judge, I pray you, betwixt me and my vineyard.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 5:
Bible.Verse: 4 What could have been done more to my vineyard, that I have not done in it? wherefore, when I looked that it should bring forth grapes, brought it forth wild grapes?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 5:
Bible.Verse: 5 And now go to; I will tell you what I will do to my vineyard: I will take away the hedge thereof, and it shall be eaten up; and break down the wall thereof, and it shall be trodden down:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 5:
Bible.Verse: 6 And I will lay it waste: it shall not be pruned, nor digged; but there shall come up briers and thorns: I will also command the clouds that they rain no rain upon it.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 5:
Bible.Verse: 7 For the vineyard of the LORD of hosts is the house of Israel, and the men of Judah his pleasant plant: and he looked for judgment, but behold oppression; for righteousness, but behold a cry.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 5:
Bible.Verse: 8 Woe unto them that join house to house, that lay field to field, till there be no place, that they may be placed alone in the midst of the earth!

Bible.Title: Isaiah 5:
Bible.Verse: 9 In mine ears said the LORD of hosts, Of a truth many houses shall be desolate, even great and fair, without inhabitant.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 5:
Bible.Verse: 10 Yea, ten acres of vineyard shall yield one bath, and the seed of an homer shall yield an ephah.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 5:
Bible.Verse: 11 Woe unto them that rise up early in the morning, that they may follow strong drink; that continue until night, till wine inflame them!

Bible.Title: Isaiah 5:
Bible.Verse: 12 And the harp, and the viol, the tabret, and pipe, and wine, are in their feasts: but they regard not the work of the LORD, neither consider the operation of his hands.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 5:
Bible.Verse: 13 Therefore my people are gone into captivity, because they have no knowledge: and their honourable men are famished, and their multitude dried up with thirst.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 5:
Bible.Verse: 14 Therefore hell hath enlarged herself, and opened her mouth without measure: and their glory, and their multitude, and their pomp, and he that rejoiceth, shall descend into it.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 5:
Bible.Verse: 15 And the mean man shall be brought down, and the mighty man shall be humbled, and the eyes of the lofty shall be humbled:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 5:
Bible.Verse: 16 But the LORD of hosts shall be exalted in judgment, and God that is holy shall be sanctified in righteousness.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 5:
Bible.Verse: 17 Then shall the lambs feed after their manner, and the waste places of the fat ones shall strangers eat.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 5:
Bible.Verse: 18 Woe unto them that draw iniquity with cords of vanity, and sin as it were with a cart rope:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 5:
Bible.Verse: 19 That say, Let him make speed, and hasten his work, that we may see it: and let the counsel of the Holy One of Israel draw nigh and come, that we may know it!

Bible.Title: Isaiah 5:
Bible.Verse: 20 Woe unto them that call evil good, and good evil; that put darkness for light, and light for darkness; that put bitter for sweet, and sweet for bitter!

Bible.Title: Isaiah 5:
Bible.Verse: 21 Woe unto them that are wise in their own eyes, and prudent in their own sight!

Bible.Title: Isaiah 5:
Bible.Verse: 22 Woe unto them that are mighty to drink wine, and men of strength to mingle strong drink:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 5:
Bible.Verse: 23 Which justify the wicked for reward, and take away the righteousness of the righteous from him!

Bible.Title: Isaiah 5:
Bible.Verse: 24 Therefore as the fire devoureth the stubble, and the flame consumeth the chaff, so their root shall be as rottenness, and their blossom shall go up as dust: because they have cast away the law of the LORD of hosts, and despised the word of the Holy One of Israel.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 5:
Bible.Verse: 25 Therefore is the anger of the LORD kindled against his people, and he hath stretched forth his hand against them, and hath smitten them: and the hills did tremble, and their carcases were torn in the midst of the streets. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 5:
Bible.Verse: 26 And he will lift up an ensign to the nations from far, and will hiss unto them from the end of the earth: and, behold, they shall come with speed swiftly:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 5:
Bible.Verse: 27 None shall be weary nor stumble among them; none shall slumber nor sleep; neither shall the girdle of their loins be loosed, nor the latchet of their shoes be broken:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 5:
Bible.Verse: 28 Whose arrows are sharp, and all their bows bent, their horses' hoofs shall be counted like flint, and their wheels like a whirlwind:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 5:
Bible.Verse: 29 Their roaring shall be like a lion, they shall roar like young lions: yea, they shall roar, and lay hold of the prey, and shall carry it away safe, and none shall deliver it.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 5:
Bible.Verse: 30 And in that day they shall roar against them like the roaring of the sea: and if one look unto the land, behold darkness and sorrow, and the light is darkened in the heavens thereof.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 6:
Bible.Verse: 1 In the year that king Uzziah died I saw also the LORD sitting upon a throne, high and lifted up, and his train filled the temple.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 6:
Bible.Verse: 2 Above it stood the seraphims: each one had six wings; with twain he covered his face, and with twain he covered his feet, and with twain he did fly.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 6:
Bible.Verse: 3 And one cried unto another, and said, Holy, holy, holy, is the LORD of hosts: the whole earth is full of his glory.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 6:
Bible.Verse: 4 And the posts of the door moved at the voice of him that cried, and the house was filled with smoke.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 6:
Bible.Verse: 5 Then said I, Woe is me! for I am undone; because I am a man of unclean lips, and I dwell in the midst of a people of unclean lips: for mine eyes have seen the King, the LORD of hosts.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 6:
Bible.Verse: 6 Then flew one of the seraphims unto me, having a live coal in his hand, which he had taken with the tongs from off the altar:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 6:
Bible.Verse: 7 And he laid it upon my mouth, and said, Lo, this hath touched thy lips; and thine iniquity is taken away, and thy sin purged.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 6:
Bible.Verse: 8 Also I heard the voice of the Lord, saying, Whom shall I send, and who will go for us? Then said I, Here am I; send me.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 6:
Bible.Verse: 9 And he said, Go, and tell this people, Hear ye indeed, but understand not; and see ye indeed, but perceive not.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 6:
Bible.Verse: 10 Make the heart of this people fat, and make their ears heavy, and shut their eyes; lest they see with their eyes, and hear with their ears, and understand with their heart, and convert, and be healed.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 6:
Bible.Verse: 11 Then said I, Lord, how long? And he answered, Until the cities be wasted without inhabitant, and the houses without man, and the land be utterly desolate,

Bible.Title: Isaiah 6:
Bible.Verse: 12 And the LORD have removed men far away, and there be a great forsaking in the midst of the land.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 6:
Bible.Verse: 13 But yet in it shall be a tenth, and it shall return, and shall be eaten: as a teil tree, and as an oak, whose substance is in them, when they cast their leaves: so the holy seed shall be the substance thereof.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 7:
Bible.Verse: 1 And it came to pass in the days of Ahaz the son of Jotham, the son of Uzziah, king of Judah, that Rezin the king of Syria, and Pekah the son of Remaliah, king of Israel, went up toward Jerusalem to war against it, but could not prevail against it.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 7:
Bible.Verse: 2 And it was told the house of David, saying, Syria is confederate with Ephraim. And his heart was moved, and the heart of his people, as the trees of the wood are moved with the wind.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 7:
Bible.Verse: 3 Then said the LORD unto Isaiah, Go forth now to meet Ahaz, thou, and Shearjashub thy son, at the end of the conduit of the upper pool in the highway of the fuller's field;

Bible.Title: Isaiah 7:
Bible.Verse: 4 And say unto him, Take heed, and be quiet; fear not, neither be fainthearted for the two tails of these smoking firebrands, for the fierce anger of Rezin with Syria, and of the son of Remaliah.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 7:
Bible.Verse: 5 Because Syria, Ephraim, and the son of Remaliah, have taken evil counsel against thee, saying,

Bible.Title: Isaiah 7:
Bible.Verse: 6 Let us go up against Judah, and vex it, and let us make a breach therein for us, and set a king in the midst of it, even the son of Tabeal:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 7:
Bible.Verse: 7 Thus saith the Lord GOD, It shall not stand, neither shall it come to pass.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 7:
Bible.Verse: 8 For the head of Syria is Damascus, and the head of Damascus is Rezin; and within threescore and five years shall Ephraim be broken, that it be not a people.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 7:
Bible.Verse: 9 And the head of Ephraim is Samaria, and the head of Samaria is Remaliah's son. If ye will not believe, surely ye shall not be established.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 7:
Bible.Verse: 10 Moreover the LORD spake again unto Ahaz, saying,

Bible.Title: Isaiah 7:
Bible.Verse: 11 Ask thee a sign of the LORD thy God; ask it either in the depth, or in the height above.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 7:
Bible.Verse: 12 But Ahaz said, I will not ask, neither will I tempt the LORD.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 7:
Bible.Verse: 13 And he said, Hear ye now, O house of David; Is it a small thing for you to weary men, but will ye weary my God also?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 7:
Bible.Verse: 14 Therefore the Lord himself shall give you a sign; Behold, a virgin shall conceive, and bear a son, and shall call his name Immanuel.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 7:
Bible.Verse: 15 Butter and honey shall he eat, that he may know to refuse the evil, and choose the good.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 7:
Bible.Verse: 16 For before the child shall know to refuse the evil, and choose the good, the land that thou abhorrest shall be forsaken of both her kings.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 7:
Bible.Verse: 17 The LORD shall bring upon thee, and upon thy people, and upon thy father's house, days that have not come, from the day that Ephraim departed from Judah; even the king of Assyria.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 7:
Bible.Verse: 18 And it shall come to pass in that day, that the LORD shall hiss for the fly that is in the uttermost part of the rivers of Egypt, and for the bee that is in the land of Assyria.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 7:
Bible.Verse: 19 And they shall come, and shall rest all of them in the desolate valleys, and in the holes of the rocks, and upon all thorns, and upon all bushes.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 7:
Bible.Verse: 20 In the same day shall the Lord shave with a razor that is hired, namely, by them beyond the river, by the king of Assyria, the head, and the hair of the feet: and it shall also consume the beard.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 7:
Bible.Verse: 21 And it shall come to pass in that day, that a man shall nourish a young cow, and two sheep;

Bible.Title: Isaiah 7:
Bible.Verse: 22 And it shall come to pass, for the abundance of milk that they shall give he shall eat butter: for butter and honey shall every one eat that is left in the land.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 7:
Bible.Verse: 23 And it shall come to pass in that day, that every place shall be, where there were a thousand vines at a thousand silverlings, it shall even be for briers and thorns.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 7:
Bible.Verse: 24 With arrows and with bows shall men come thither; because all the land shall become briers and thorns.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 7:
Bible.Verse: 25 And on all hills that shall be digged with the mattock, there shall not come thither the fear of briers and thorns: but it shall be for the sending forth of oxen, and for the treading of lesser cattle.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 8:
Bible.Verse: 1 Moreover the LORD said unto me, Take thee a great roll, and write in it with a man's pen concerning Mahershalalhashbaz.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 8:
Bible.Verse: 2 And I took unto me faithful witnesses to record, Uriah the priest, and Zechariah the son of Jeberechiah.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 8:
Bible.Verse: 3 And I went unto the prophetess; and she conceived, and bare a son. Then said the LORD to me, Call his name Mahershalalhashbaz.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 8:
Bible.Verse: 4 For before the child shall have knowledge to cry, My father, and my mother, the riches of Damascus and the spoil of Samaria shall be taken away before the king of Assyria.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 8:
Bible.Verse: 5 The LORD spake also unto me again, saying,

Bible.Title: Isaiah 8:
Bible.Verse: 6 Forasmuch as this people refuseth the waters of Shiloah that go softly, and rejoice in Rezin and Remaliah's son;

Bible.Title: Isaiah 8:
Bible.Verse: 7 Now therefore, behold, the Lord bringeth up upon them the waters of the river, strong and many, even the king of Assyria, and all his glory: and he shall come up over all his channels, and go over all his banks:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 8:
Bible.Verse: 8 And he shall pass through Judah; he shall overflow and go over, he shall reach even to the neck; and the stretching out of his wings shall fill the breadth of thy land, O Immanuel.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 8:
Bible.Verse: 9 Associate yourselves, O ye people, and ye shall be broken in pieces; and give ear, all ye of far countries: gird yourselves, and ye shall be broken in pieces; gird yourselves, and ye shall be broken in pieces.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 8:
Bible.Verse: 10 Take counsel together, and it shall come to nought; speak the word, and it shall not stand: for God is with us.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 8:
Bible.Verse: 11 For the LORD spake thus to me with a strong hand, and instructed me that I should not walk in the way of this people, saying,

Bible.Title: Isaiah 8:
Bible.Verse: 12 Say ye not, A confederacy, to all them to whom this people shall say, A confederacy; neither fear ye their fear, nor be afraid.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 8:
Bible.Verse: 13 Sanctify the LORD of hosts himself; and let him be your fear, and let him be your dread.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 8:
Bible.Verse: 14 And he shall be for a sanctuary; but for a stone of stumbling and for a rock of offence to both the houses of Israel, for a gin and for a snare to the inhabitants of Jerusalem.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 8:
Bible.Verse: 15 And many among them shall stumble, and fall, and be broken, and be snared, and be taken.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 8:
Bible.Verse: 16 Bind up the testimony, seal the law among my disciples.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 8:
Bible.Verse: 17 And I will wait upon the LORD, that hideth his face from the house of Jacob, and I will look for him.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 8:
Bible.Verse: 18 Behold, I and the children whom the LORD hath given me are for signs and for wonders in Israel from the LORD of hosts, which dwelleth in mount Zion.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 8:
Bible.Verse: 19 And when they shall say unto you, Seek unto them that have familiar spirits, and unto wizards that peep, and that mutter: should not a people seek unto their God? for the living to the dead?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 8:
Bible.Verse: 20 To the law and to the testimony: if they speak not according to this word, it is because there is no light in them.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 8:
Bible.Verse: 21 And they shall pass through it, hardly bestead and hungry: and it shall come to pass, that when they shall be hungry, they shall fret themselves, and curse their king and their God, and look upward.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 8:
Bible.Verse: 22 And they shall look unto the earth; and behold trouble and darkness, dimness of anguish; and they shall be driven to darkness.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 9:
Bible.Verse: 1 Nevertheless the dimness shall not be such as was in her vexation, when at the first he lightly afflicted the land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, and afterward did more grievously afflict her by the way of the sea, beyond Jordan, in Galilee of the nations.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 9:
Bible.Verse: 2 The people that walked in darkness have seen a great light: they that dwell in the land of the shadow of death, upon them hath the light shined.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 9:
Bible.Verse: 3 Thou hast multiplied the nation, and not increased the joy: they joy before thee according to the joy in harvest, and as men rejoice when they divide the spoil.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 9:
Bible.Verse: 4 For thou hast broken the yoke of his burden, and the staff of his shoulder, the rod of his oppressor, as in the day of Midian.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 9:
Bible.Verse: 5 For every battle of the warrior is with confused noise, and garments rolled in blood; but this shall be with burning and fuel of fire.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 9:
Bible.Verse: 6 For unto us a child is born, unto us a son is given: and the government shall be upon his shoulder: and his name shall be called Wonderful, Counsellor, The mighty God, The everlasting Father, The Prince of Peace.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 9:
Bible.Verse: 7 Of the increase of his government and peace there shall be no end, upon the throne of David, and upon his kingdom, to order it, and to establish it with judgment and with justice from henceforth even for ever. The zeal of the LORD of hosts will perform this.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 9:
Bible.Verse: 8 The Lord sent a word into Jacob, and it hath lighted upon Israel.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 9:
Bible.Verse: 9 And all the people shall know, even Ephraim and the inhabitant of Samaria, that say in the pride and stoutness of heart,

Bible.Title: Isaiah 9:
Bible.Verse: 10 The bricks are fallen down, but we will build with hewn stones: the sycomores are cut down, but we will change them into cedars.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 9:
Bible.Verse: 11 Therefore the LORD shall set up the adversaries of Rezin against him, and join his enemies together;

Bible.Title: Isaiah 9:
Bible.Verse: 12 The Syrians before, and the Philistines behind; and they shall devour Israel with open mouth. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 9:
Bible.Verse: 13 For the people turneth not unto him that smiteth them, neither do they seek the LORD of hosts.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 9:
Bible.Verse: 14 Therefore the LORD will cut off from Israel head and tail, branch and rush, in one day.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 9:
Bible.Verse: 15 The ancient and honourable, he is the head; and the prophet that teacheth lies, he is the tail.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 9:
Bible.Verse: 16 For the leaders of this people cause them to err; and they that are led of them are destroyed.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 9:
Bible.Verse: 17 Therefore the LORD shall have no joy in their young men, neither shall have mercy on their fatherless and widows: for every one is an hypocrite and an evildoer, and every mouth speaketh folly. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 9:
Bible.Verse: 18 For wickedness burneth as the fire: it shall devour the briers and thorns, and shall kindle in the thickets of the forest, and they shall mount up like the lifting up of smoke.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 9:
Bible.Verse: 19 Through the wrath of the LORD of hosts is the land darkened, and the people shall be as the fuel of the fire: no man shall spare his brother.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 9:
Bible.Verse: 20 And he shall snatch on the right hand, and be hungry; and he shall eat on the left hand, and they shall not be satisfied: they shall eat every man the flesh of his own arm:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 9:
Bible.Verse: 21 Manasseh, Ephraim; and Ephraim, Manasseh: and they together shall be against Judah. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 10:
Bible.Verse: 1 Woe unto them that decree unrighteous decrees, and that write grievousness which they have prescribed;

Bible.Title: Isaiah 10:
Bible.Verse: 2 To turn aside the needy from judgment, and to take away the right from the poor of my people, that widows may be their prey, and that they may rob the fatherless!

Bible.Title: Isaiah 10:
Bible.Verse: 3 And what will ye do in the day of visitation, and in the desolation which shall come from far? to whom will ye flee for help? and where will ye leave your glory?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 10:
Bible.Verse: 4 Without me they shall bow down under the prisoners, and they shall fall under the slain. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 10:
Bible.Verse: 5 O Assyrian, the rod of mine anger, and the staff in their hand is mine indignation.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 10:
Bible.Verse: 6 I will send him against an hypocritical nation, and against the people of my wrath will I give him a charge, to take the spoil, and to take the prey, and to tread them down like the mire of the streets.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 10:
Bible.Verse: 7 Howbeit he meaneth not so, neither doth his heart think so; but it is in his heart to destroy and cut off nations not a few.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 10:
Bible.Verse: 8 For he saith, Are not my princes altogether kings?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 10:
Bible.Verse: 9 Is not Calno as Carchemish? is not Hamath as Arpad? is not Samaria as Damascus?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 10:
Bible.Verse: 10 As my hand hath found the kingdoms of the idols, and whose graven images did excel them of Jerusalem and of Samaria;

Bible.Title: Isaiah 10:
Bible.Verse: 11 Shall I not, as I have done unto Samaria and her idols, so do to Jerusalem and her idols?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 10:
Bible.Verse: 12 Wherefore it shall come to pass, that when the Lord hath performed his whole work upon mount Zion and on Jerusalem, I will punish the fruit of the stout heart of the king of Assyria, and the glory of his high looks.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 10:
Bible.Verse: 13 For he saith, By the strength of my hand I have done it, and by my wisdom; for I am prudent: and I have removed the bounds of the people, and have robbed their treasures, and I have put down the inhabitants like a valiant man:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 10:
Bible.Verse: 14 And my hand hath found as a nest the riches of the people: and as one gathereth eggs that are left, have I gathered all the earth; and there was none that moved the wing, or opened the mouth, or peeped.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 10:
Bible.Verse: 15 Shall the axe boast itself against him that heweth therewith? or shall the saw magnify itself against him that shaketh it? as if the rod should shake itself against them that lift it up, or as if the staff should lift up itself, as if it were no wood.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 10:
Bible.Verse: 16 Therefore shall the Lord, the Lord of hosts, send among his fat ones leanness; and under his glory he shall kindle a burning like the burning of a fire.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 10:
Bible.Verse: 17 And the light of Israel shall be for a fire, and his Holy One for a flame: and it shall burn and devour his thorns and his briers in one day;

Bible.Title: Isaiah 10:
Bible.Verse: 18 And shall consume the glory of his forest, and of his fruitful field, both soul and body: and they shall be as when a standard-bearer fainteth.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 10:
Bible.Verse: 19 And the rest of the trees of his forest shall be few, that a child may write them.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 10:
Bible.Verse: 20 And it shall come to pass in that day, that the remnant of Israel, and such as are escaped of the house of Jacob, shall no more again stay upon him that smote them; but shall stay upon the LORD, the Holy One of Israel, in truth.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 10:
Bible.Verse: 21 The remnant shall return, even the remnant of Jacob, unto the mighty God.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 10:
Bible.Verse: 22 For though thy people Israel be as the sand of the sea, yet a remnant of them shall return: the consumption decreed shall overflow with righteousness.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 10:
Bible.Verse: 23 For the Lord GOD of hosts shall make a consumption, even determined, in the midst of all the land.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 10:
Bible.Verse: 24 Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD of hosts, O my people that dwellest in Zion, be not afraid of the Assyrian: he shall smite thee with a rod, and shall lift up his staff against thee, after the manner of Egypt.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 10:
Bible.Verse: 25 For yet a very little while, and the indignation shall cease, and mine anger in their destruction.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 10:
Bible.Verse: 26 And the LORD of hosts shall stir up a scourge for him according to the slaughter of Midian at the rock of Oreb: and as his rod was upon the sea, so shall he lift it up after the manner of Egypt.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 10:
Bible.Verse: 27 And it shall come to pass in that day, that his burden shall be taken away from off thy shoulder, and his yoke from off thy neck, and the yoke shall be destroyed because of the anointing.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 10:
Bible.Verse: 28 He is come to Aiath, he is passed to Migron; at Michmash he hath laid up his carriages:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 10:
Bible.Verse: 29 They are gone over the passage: they have taken up their lodging at Geba; Ramah is afraid; Gibeah of Saul is fled.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 10:
Bible.Verse: 30 Lift up thy voice, O daughter of Gallim: cause it to be heard unto Laish, O poor Anathoth.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 10:
Bible.Verse: 31 Madmenah is removed; the inhabitants of Gebim gather themselves to flee.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 10:
Bible.Verse: 32 As yet shall he remain at Nob that day: he shall shake his hand against the mount of the daughter of Zion, the hill of Jerusalem.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 10:
Bible.Verse: 33 Behold, the Lord, the LORD of hosts, shall lop the bough with terror: and the high ones of stature shall be hewn down, and the haughty shall be humbled.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 10:
Bible.Verse: 34 And he shall cut down the thickets of the forest with iron, and Lebanon shall fall by a mighty one.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 11:
Bible.Verse: 1 And there shall come forth a rod out of the stem of Jesse, and a Branch shall grow out of his roots:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 11:
Bible.Verse: 2 And the spirit of the LORD shall rest upon him, the spirit of wisdom and understanding, the spirit of counsel and might, the spirit of knowledge and of the fear of the LORD;

Bible.Title: Isaiah 11:
Bible.Verse: 3 And shall make him of quick understanding in the fear of the LORD: and he shall not judge after the sight of his eyes, neither reprove after the hearing of his ears:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 11:
Bible.Verse: 4 But with righteousness shall he judge the poor, and reprove with equity for the meek of the earth: and he shall smite the earth with the rod of his mouth, and with the breath of his lips shall he slay the wicked.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 11:
Bible.Verse: 5 And righteousness shall be the girdle of his loins, and faithfulness the girdle of his reins.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 11:
Bible.Verse: 6 The wolf also shall dwell with the lamb, and the leopard shall lie down with the kid; and the calf and the young lion and the fatling together; and a little child shall lead them.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 11:
Bible.Verse: 7 And the cow and the bear shall feed; their young ones shall lie down together: and the lion shall eat straw like the ox.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 11:
Bible.Verse: 8 And the sucking child shall play on the hole of the asp, and the weaned child shall put his hand on the cockatrice' den.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 11:
Bible.Verse: 9 They shall not hurt nor destroy in all my holy mountain: for the earth shall be full of the knowledge of the LORD, as the waters cover the sea.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 11:
Bible.Verse: 10 And in that day there shall be a root of Jesse, which shall stand for an ensign of the people; to it shall the Gentiles seek: and his rest shall be glorious.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 11:
Bible.Verse: 11 And it shall come to pass in that day, that the Lord shall set his hand again the second time to recover the remnant of his people, which shall be left, from Assyria, and from Egypt, and from Pathros, and from Cush, and from Elam, and from Shinar, and from Hamath, and from the islands of the sea.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 11:
Bible.Verse: 12 And he shall set up an ensign for the nations, and shall assemble the outcasts of Israel, and gather together the dispersed of Judah from the four corners of the earth.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 11:
Bible.Verse: 13 The envy also of Ephraim shall depart, and the adversaries of Judah shall be cut off: Ephraim shall not envy Judah, and Judah shall not vex Ephraim.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 11:
Bible.Verse: 14 But they shall fly upon the shoulders of the Philistines toward the west; they shall spoil them of the east together: they shall lay their hand upon Edom and Moab; and the children of Ammon shall obey them.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 11:
Bible.Verse: 15 And the LORD shall utterly destroy the tongue of the Egyptian sea; and with his mighty wind shall he shake his hand over the river, and shall smite it in the seven streams, and make men go over dryshod.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 11:
Bible.Verse: 16 And there shall be an highway for the remnant of his people, which shall be left, from Assyria; like as it was to Israel in the day that he came up out of the land of Egypt.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 12:
Bible.Verse: 1 And in that day thou shalt say, O LORD, I will praise thee: though thou wast angry with me, thine anger is turned away, and thou comfortedst me.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 12:
Bible.Verse: 2 Behold, God is my salvation; I will trust, and not be afraid: for the LORD JEHOVAH is my strength and my song; he also is become my salvation.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 12:
Bible.Verse: 3 Therefore with joy shall ye draw water out of the wells of salvation.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 12:
Bible.Verse: 4 And in that day shall ye say, Praise the LORD, call upon his name, declare his doings among the people, make mention that his name is exalted.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 12:
Bible.Verse: 5 Sing unto the LORD; for he hath done excellent things: this is known in all the earth.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 12:
Bible.Verse: 6 Cry out and shout, thou inhabitant of Zion: for great is the Holy One of Israel in the midst of thee.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 13:
Bible.Verse: 1 The burden of Babylon, which Isaiah the son of Amoz did see.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 13:
Bible.Verse: 2 Lift ye up a banner upon the high mountain, exalt the voice unto them, shake the hand, that they may go into the gates of the nobles.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 13:
Bible.Verse: 3 I have commanded my sanctified ones, I have also called my mighty ones for mine anger, even them that rejoice in my highness.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 13:
Bible.Verse: 4 The noise of a multitude in the mountains, like as of a great people; a tumultuous noise of the kingdoms of nations gathered together: the LORD of hosts mustereth the host of the battle.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 13:
Bible.Verse: 5 They come from a far country, from the end of heaven, even the LORD, and the weapons of his indignation, to destroy the whole land.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 13:
Bible.Verse: 6 Howl ye; for the day of the LORD is at hand; it shall come as a destruction from the Almighty.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 13:
Bible.Verse: 7 Therefore shall all hands be faint, and every man's heart shall melt:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 13:
Bible.Verse: 8 And they shall be afraid: pangs and sorrows shall take hold of them; they shall be in pain as a woman that travaileth: they shall be amazed one at another; their faces shall be as flames.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 13:
Bible.Verse: 9 Behold, the day of the LORD cometh, cruel both with wrath and fierce anger, to lay the land desolate: and he shall destroy the sinners thereof out of it.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 13:
Bible.Verse: 10 For the stars of heaven and the constellations thereof shall not give their light: the sun shall be darkened in his going forth, and the moon shall not cause her light to shine.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 13:
Bible.Verse: 11 And I will punish the world for their evil, and the wicked for their iniquity; and I will cause the arrogancy of the proud to cease, and will lay low the haughtiness of the terrible.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 13:
Bible.Verse: 12 I will make a man more precious than fine gold; even a man than the golden wedge of Ophir.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 13:
Bible.Verse: 13 Therefore I will shake the heavens, and the earth shall remove out of her place, in the wrath of the LORD of hosts, and in the day of his fierce anger.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 13:
Bible.Verse: 14 And it shall be as the chased roe, and as a sheep that no man taketh up: they shall every man turn to his own people, and flee every one into his own land.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 13:
Bible.Verse: 15 Every one that is found shall be thrust through; and every one that is joined unto them shall fall by the sword.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 13:
Bible.Verse: 16 Their children also shall be dashed to pieces before their eyes; their houses shall be spoiled, and their wives ravished.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 13:
Bible.Verse: 17 Behold, I will stir up the Medes against them, which shall not regard silver; and as for gold, they shall not delight in it.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 13:
Bible.Verse: 18 Their bows also shall dash the young men to pieces; and they shall have no pity on the fruit of the womb; their eye shall not spare children.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 13:
Bible.Verse: 19 And Babylon, the glory of kingdoms, the beauty of the Chaldees' excellency, shall be as when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 13:
Bible.Verse: 20 It shall never be inhabited, neither shall it be dwelt in from generation to generation: neither shall the Arabian pitch tent there; neither shall the shepherds make their fold there.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 13:
Bible.Verse: 21 But wild beasts of the desert shall lie there; and their houses shall be full of doleful creatures; and owls shall dwell there, and satyrs shall dance there.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 13:
Bible.Verse: 22 And the wild beasts of the islands shall cry in their desolate houses, and dragons in their pleasant palaces: and her time is near to come, and her days shall not be prolonged.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 14:
Bible.Verse: 1 For the LORD will have mercy on Jacob, and will yet choose Israel, and set them in their own land: and the strangers shall be joined with them, and they shall cleave to the house of Jacob.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 14:
Bible.Verse: 2 And the people shall take them, and bring them to their place: and the house of Israel shall possess them in the land of the LORD for servants and handmaids: and they shall take them captives, whose captives they were; and they shall rule over their oppressors.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 14:
Bible.Verse: 3 And it shall come to pass in the day that the LORD shall give thee rest from thy sorrow, and from thy fear, and from the hard bondage wherein thou wast made to serve,

Bible.Title: Isaiah 14:
Bible.Verse: 4 That thou shalt take up this proverb against the king of Babylon, and say, How hath the oppressor ceased! the golden city ceased!

Bible.Title: Isaiah 14:
Bible.Verse: 5 The LORD hath broken the staff of the wicked, and the sceptre of the rulers.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 14:
Bible.Verse: 6 He who smote the people in wrath with a continual stroke, he that ruled the nations in anger, is persecuted, and none hindereth.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 14:
Bible.Verse: 7 The whole earth is at rest, and is quiet: they break forth into singing.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 14:
Bible.Verse: 8 Yea, the fir trees rejoice at thee, and the cedars of Lebanon, saying, Since thou art laid down, no feller is come up against us.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 14:
Bible.Verse: 9 Hell from beneath is moved for thee to meet thee at thy coming: it stirreth up the dead for thee, even all the chief ones of the earth; it hath raised up from their thrones all the kings of the nations.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 14:
Bible.Verse: 10 All they shall speak and say unto thee, Art thou also become weak as we? art thou become like unto us?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 14:
Bible.Verse: 11 Thy pomp is brought down to the grave, and the noise of thy viols: the worm is spread under thee, and the worms cover thee.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 14:
Bible.Verse: 12 How art thou fallen from heaven, O Lucifer, son of the morning! how art thou cut down to the ground, which didst weaken the nations!

Bible.Title: Isaiah 14:
Bible.Verse: 13 For thou hast said in thine heart, I will ascend into heaven, I will exalt my throne above the stars of God: I will sit also upon the mount of the congregation, in the sides of the north:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 14:
Bible.Verse: 14 I will ascend above the heights of the clouds; I will be like the most High.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 14:
Bible.Verse: 15 Yet thou shalt be brought down to hell, to the sides of the pit.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 14:
Bible.Verse: 16 They that see thee shall narrowly look upon thee, and consider thee, saying, Is this the man that made the earth to tremble, that did shake kingdoms;

Bible.Title: Isaiah 14:
Bible.Verse: 17 That made the world as a wilderness, and destroyed the cities thereof; that opened not the house of his prisoners?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 14:
Bible.Verse: 18 All the kings of the nations, even all of them, lie in glory, every one in his own house.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 14:
Bible.Verse: 19 But thou art cast out of thy grave like an abominable branch, and as the raiment of those that are slain, thrust through with a sword, that go down to the stones of the pit; as a carcase trodden under feet.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 14:
Bible.Verse: 20 Thou shalt not be joined with them in burial, because thou hast destroyed thy land, and slain thy people: the seed of evildoers shall never be renowned.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 14:
Bible.Verse: 21 Prepare slaughter for his children for the iniquity of their fathers; that they do not rise, nor possess the land, nor fill the face of the world with cities.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 14:
Bible.Verse: 22 For I will rise up against them, saith the LORD of hosts, and cut off from Babylon the name, and remnant, and son, and nephew, saith the LORD.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 14:
Bible.Verse: 23 I will also make it a possession for the bittern, and pools of water: and I will sweep it with the besom of destruction, saith the LORD of hosts.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 14:
Bible.Verse: 24 The LORD of hosts hath sworn, saying, Surely as I have thought, so shall it come to pass; and as I have purposed, so shall it stand:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 14:
Bible.Verse: 25 That I will break the Assyrian in my land, and upon my mountains tread him under foot: then shall his yoke depart from off them, and his burden depart from off their shoulders.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 14:
Bible.Verse: 26 This is the purpose that is purposed upon the whole earth: and this is the hand that is stretched out upon all the nations.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 14:
Bible.Verse: 27 For the LORD of hosts hath purposed, and who shall disannul it? and his hand is stretched out, and who shall turn it back?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 14:
Bible.Verse: 28 In the year that king Ahaz died was this burden.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 14:
Bible.Verse: 29 Rejoice not thou, whole Palestina, because the rod of him that smote thee is broken: for out of the serpent's root shall come forth a cockatrice, and his fruit shall be a fiery flying serpent.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 14:
Bible.Verse: 30 And the firstborn of the poor shall feed, and the needy shall lie down in safety: and I will kill thy root with famine, and he shall slay thy remnant.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 14:
Bible.Verse: 31 Howl, O gate; cry, O city; thou, whole Palestina, art dissolved: for there shall come from the north a smoke, and none shall be alone in his appointed times.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 14:
Bible.Verse: 32 What shall one then answer the messengers of the nation? That the LORD hath founded Zion, and the poor of his people shall trust in it.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 15:
Bible.Verse: 1 The burden of Moab. Because in the night Ar of Moab is laid waste, and brought to silence; because in the night Kir of Moab is laid waste, and brought to silence;

Bible.Title: Isaiah 15:
Bible.Verse: 2 He is gone up to Bajith, and to Dibon, the high places, to weep: Moab shall howl over Nebo, and over Medeba: on all their heads shall be baldness, and every beard cut off.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 15:
Bible.Verse: 3 In their streets they shall gird themselves with sackcloth: on the tops of their houses, and in their streets, every one shall howl, weeping abundantly.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 15:
Bible.Verse: 4 And Heshbon shall cry, and Elealeh: their voice shall be heard even unto Jahaz: therefore the armed soldiers of Moab shall cry out; his life shall be grievous unto him.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 15:
Bible.Verse: 5 My heart shall cry out for Moab; his fugitives shall flee unto Zoar, an heifer of three years old: for by the mounting up of Luhith with weeping shall they go it up; for in the way of Horonaim they shall raise up a cry of destruction.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 15:
Bible.Verse: 6 For the waters of Nimrim shall be desolate: for the hay is withered away, the grass faileth, there is no green thing.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 15:
Bible.Verse: 7 Therefore the abundance they have gotten, and that which they have laid up, shall they carry away to the brook of the willows.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 15:
Bible.Verse: 8 For the cry is gone round about the borders of Moab; the howling thereof unto Eglaim, and the howling thereof unto Beerelim.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 15:
Bible.Verse: 9 For the waters of Dimon shall be full of blood: for I will bring more upon Dimon, lions upon him that escapeth of Moab, and upon the remnant of the land.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 16:
Bible.Verse: 1 Send ye the lamb to the ruler of the land from Sela to the wilderness, unto the mount of the daughter of Zion.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 16:
Bible.Verse: 2 For it shall be, that, as a wandering bird cast out of the nest, so the daughters of Moab shall be at the fords of Arnon.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 16:
Bible.Verse: 3 Take counsel, execute judgment; make thy shadow as the night in the midst of the noonday; hide the outcasts; bewray not him that wandereth.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 16:
Bible.Verse: 4 Let mine outcasts dwell with thee, Moab; be thou a covert to them from the face of the spoiler: for the extortioner is at an end, the spoiler ceaseth, the oppressors are consumed out of the land.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 16:
Bible.Verse: 5 And in mercy shall the throne be established: and he shall sit upon it in truth in the tabernacle of David, judging, and seeking judgment, and hasting righteousness.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 16:
Bible.Verse: 6 We have heard of the pride of Moab; he is very proud: even of his haughtiness, and his pride, and his wrath: but his lies shall not be so.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 16:
Bible.Verse: 7 Therefore shall Moab howl for Moab, every one shall howl: for the foundations of Kirhareseth shall ye mourn; surely they are stricken.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 16:
Bible.Verse: 8 For the fields of Heshbon languish, and the vine of Sibmah: the lords of the heathen have broken down the principal plants thereof, they are come even unto Jazer, they wandered through the wilderness: her branches are stretched out, they are gone over the sea.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 16:
Bible.Verse: 9 Therefore I will bewail with the weeping of Jazer the vine of Sibmah: I will water thee with my tears, O Heshbon, and Elealeh: for the shouting for thy summer fruits and for thy harvest is fallen.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 16:
