Bible.Verse: 10 And gladness is taken away, and joy out of the plentiful field; and in the vineyards there shall be no singing, neither shall there be shouting: the treaders shall tread out no wine in their presses; I have made their vintage shouting to cease.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 16:
Bible.Verse: 11 Wherefore my bowels shall sound like an harp for Moab, and mine inward parts for Kirharesh.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 16:
Bible.Verse: 12 And it shall come to pass, when it is seen that Moab is weary on the high place, that he shall come to his sanctuary to pray; but he shall not prevail.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 16:
Bible.Verse: 13 This is the word that the LORD hath spoken concerning Moab since that time.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 16:
Bible.Verse: 14 But now the LORD hath spoken, saying, Within three years, as the years of an hireling, and the glory of Moab shall be contemned, with all that great multitude; and the remnant shall be very small and feeble.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 17:
Bible.Verse: 1 The burden of Damascus. Behold, Damascus is taken away from being a city, and it shall be a ruinous heap.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 17:
Bible.Verse: 2 The cities of Aroer are forsaken: they shall be for flocks, which shall lie down, and none shall make them afraid.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 17:
Bible.Verse: 3 The fortress also shall cease from Ephraim, and the kingdom from Damascus, and the remnant of Syria: they shall be as the glory of the children of Israel, saith the LORD of hosts.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 17:
Bible.Verse: 4 And in that day it shall come to pass, that the glory of Jacob shall be made thin, and the fatness of his flesh shall wax lean.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 17:
Bible.Verse: 5 And it shall be as when the harvestman gathereth the corn, and reapeth the ears with his arm; and it shall be as he that gathereth ears in the valley of Rephaim.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 17:
Bible.Verse: 6 Yet gleaning grapes shall be left in it, as the shaking of an olive tree, two or three berries in the top of the uppermost bough, four or five in the outmost fruitful branches thereof, saith the LORD God of Israel.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 17:
Bible.Verse: 7 At that day shall a man look to his Maker, and his eyes shall have respect to the Holy One of Israel.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 17:
Bible.Verse: 8 And he shall not look to the altars, the work of his hands, neither shall respect that which his fingers have made, either the groves, or the images.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 17:
Bible.Verse: 9 In that day shall his strong cities be as a forsaken bough, and an uppermost branch, which they left because of the children of Israel: and there shall be desolation.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 17:
Bible.Verse: 10 Because thou hast forgotten the God of thy salvation, and hast not been mindful of the rock of thy strength, therefore shalt thou plant pleasant plants, and shalt set it with strange slips:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 17:
Bible.Verse: 11 In the day shalt thou make thy plant to grow, and in the morning shalt thou make thy seed to flourish: but the harvest shall be a heap in the day of grief and of desperate sorrow.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 17:
Bible.Verse: 12 Woe to the multitude of many people, which make a noise like the noise of the seas; and to the rushing of nations, that make a rushing like the rushing of mighty waters!

Bible.Title: Isaiah 17:
Bible.Verse: 13 The nations shall rush like the rushing of many waters: but God shall rebuke them, and they shall flee far off, and shall be chased as the chaff of the mountains before the wind, and like a rolling thing before the whirlwind.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 17:
Bible.Verse: 14 And behold at eveningtide trouble; and before the morning he is not. This is the portion of them that spoil us, and the lot of them that rob us.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 18:
Bible.Verse: 1 Woe to the land shadowing with wings, which is beyond the rivers of Ethiopia:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 18:
Bible.Verse: 2 That sendeth ambassadors by the sea, even in vessels of bulrushes upon the waters, saying, Go, ye swift messengers, to a nation scattered and peeled, to a people terrible from their beginning hitherto; a nation meted out and trodden down, whose land the rivers have spoiled!

Bible.Title: Isaiah 18:
Bible.Verse: 3 All ye inhabitants of the world, and dwellers on the earth, see ye, when he lifteth up an ensign on the mountains; and when he bloweth a trumpet, hear ye.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 18:
Bible.Verse: 4 For so the LORD said unto me, I will take my rest, and I will consider in my dwelling place like a clear heat upon herbs, and like a cloud of dew in the heat of harvest.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 18:
Bible.Verse: 5 For afore the harvest, when the bud is perfect, and the sour grape is ripening in the flower, he shall both cut off the sprigs with pruning hooks, and take away and cut down the branches.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 18:
Bible.Verse: 6 They shall be left together unto the fowls of the mountains, and to the beasts of the earth: and the fowls shall summer upon them, and all the beasts of the earth shall winter upon them.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 18:
Bible.Verse: 7 In that time shall the present be brought unto the LORD of hosts of a people scattered and peeled, and from a people terrible from their beginning hitherto; a nation meted out and trodden under foot, whose land the rivers have spoiled, to the place of the name of the LORD of hosts, the mount Zion.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 19:
Bible.Verse: 1 The burden of Egypt. Behold, the LORD rideth upon a swift cloud, and shall come into Egypt: and the idols of Egypt shall be moved at his presence, and the heart of Egypt shall melt in the midst of it.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 19:
Bible.Verse: 2 And I will set the Egyptians against the Egyptians: and they shall fight every one against his brother, and every one against his neighbour; city against city, and kingdom against kingdom.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 19:
Bible.Verse: 3 And the spirit of Egypt shall fail in the midst thereof; and I will destroy the counsel thereof: and they shall seek to the idols, and to the charmers, and to them that have familiar spirits, and to the wizards.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 19:
Bible.Verse: 4 And the Egyptians will I give over into the hand of a cruel lord; and a fierce king shall rule over them, saith the Lord, the LORD of hosts.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 19:
Bible.Verse: 5 And the waters shall fail from the sea, and the river shall be wasted and dried up.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 19:
Bible.Verse: 6 And they shall turn the rivers far away; and the brooks of defence shall be emptied and dried up: the reeds and flags shall wither.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 19:
Bible.Verse: 7 The paper reeds by the brooks, by the mouth of the brooks, and every thing sown by the brooks, shall wither, be driven away, and be no more.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 19:
Bible.Verse: 8 The fishers also shall mourn, and all they that cast angle into the brooks shall lament, and they that spread nets upon the waters shall languish.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 19:
Bible.Verse: 9 Moreover they that work in fine flax, and they that weave networks, shall be confounded.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 19:
Bible.Verse: 10 And they shall be broken in the purposes thereof, all that make sluices and ponds for fish.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 19:
Bible.Verse: 11 Surely the princes of Zoan are fools, the counsel of the wise counsellors of Pharaoh is become brutish: how say ye unto Pharaoh, I am the son of the wise, the son of ancient kings?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 19:
Bible.Verse: 12 Where are they? where are thy wise men? and let them tell thee now, and let them know what the LORD of hosts hath purposed upon Egypt.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 19:
Bible.Verse: 13 The princes of Zoan are become fools, the princes of Noph are deceived; they have also seduced Egypt, even they that are the stay of the tribes thereof.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 19:
Bible.Verse: 14 The LORD hath mingled a perverse spirit in the midst thereof: and they have caused Egypt to err in every work thereof, as a drunken man staggereth in his vomit.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 19:
Bible.Verse: 15 Neither shall there be any work for Egypt, which the head or tail, branch or rush, may do.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 19:
Bible.Verse: 16 In that day shall Egypt be like unto women: and it shall be afraid and fear because of the shaking of the hand of the LORD of hosts, which he shaketh over it.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 19:
Bible.Verse: 17 And the land of Judah shall be a terror unto Egypt, every one that maketh mention thereof shall be afraid in himself, because of the counsel of the LORD of hosts, which he hath determined against it.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 19:
Bible.Verse: 18 In that day shall five cities in the land of Egypt speak the language of Canaan, and swear to the LORD of hosts; one shall be called, The city of destruction.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 19:
Bible.Verse: 19 In that day shall there be an altar to the LORD in the midst of the land of Egypt, and a pillar at the border thereof to the LORD.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 19:
Bible.Verse: 20 And it shall be for a sign and for a witness unto the LORD of hosts in the land of Egypt: for they shall cry unto the LORD because of the oppressors, and he shall send them a saviour, and a great one, and he shall deliver them.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 19:
Bible.Verse: 21 And the LORD shall be known to Egypt, and the Egyptians shall know the LORD in that day, and shall do sacrifice and oblation; yea, they shall vow a vow unto the LORD, and perform it.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 19:
Bible.Verse: 22 And the LORD shall smite Egypt: he shall smite and heal it: and they shall return even to the LORD, and he shall be intreated of them, and shall heal them.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 19:
Bible.Verse: 23 In that day shall there be a highway out of Egypt to Assyria, and the Assyrian shall come into Egypt, and the Egyptian into Assyria, and the Egyptians shall serve with the Assyrians.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 19:
Bible.Verse: 24 In that day shall Israel be the third with Egypt and with Assyria, even a blessing in the midst of the land:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 19:
Bible.Verse: 25 Whom the LORD of hosts shall bless, saying, Blessed be Egypt my people, and Assyria the work of my hands, and Israel mine inheritance.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 20:
Bible.Verse: 1 In the year that Tartan came unto Ashdod, (when Sargon the king of Assyria sent him,) and fought against Ashdod, and took it;

Bible.Title: Isaiah 20:
Bible.Verse: 2 At the same time spake the LORD by Isaiah the son of Amoz, saying, Go and loose the sackcloth from off thy loins, and put off thy shoe from thy foot. And he did so, walking naked and barefoot.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 20:
Bible.Verse: 3 And the LORD said, Like as my servant Isaiah hath walked naked and barefoot three years for a sign and wonder upon Egypt and upon Ethiopia;

Bible.Title: Isaiah 20:
Bible.Verse: 4 So shall the king of Assyria lead away the Egyptians prisoners, and the Ethiopians captives, young and old, naked and barefoot, even with their buttocks uncovered, to the shame of Egypt.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 20:
Bible.Verse: 5 And they shall be afraid and ashamed of Ethiopia their expectation, and of Egypt their glory.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 20:
Bible.Verse: 6 And the inhabitant of this isle shall say in that day, Behold, such is our expectation, whither we flee for help to be delivered from the king of Assyria: and how shall we escape?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 21:
Bible.Verse: 1 The burden of the desert of the sea. As whirlwinds in the south pass through; so it cometh from the desert, from a terrible land.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 21:
Bible.Verse: 2 A grievous vision is declared unto me; the treacherous dealer dealeth treacherously, and the spoiler spoileth. Go up, O Elam: besiege, O Media; all the sighing thereof have I made to cease.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 21:
Bible.Verse: 3 Therefore are my loins filled with pain: pangs have taken hold upon me, as the pangs of a woman that travaileth: I was bowed down at the hearing of it; I was dismayed at the seeing of it.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 21:
Bible.Verse: 4 My heart panted, fearfulness affrighted me: the night of my pleasure hath he turned into fear unto me.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 21:
Bible.Verse: 5 Prepare the table, watch in the watchtower, eat, drink: arise, ye princes, and anoint the shield.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 21:
Bible.Verse: 6 For thus hath the LORD said unto me, Go, set a watchman, let him declare what he seeth.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 21:
Bible.Verse: 7 And he saw a chariot with a couple of horsemen, a chariot of asses, and a chariot of camels; and he hearkened diligently with much heed:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 21:
Bible.Verse: 8 And he cried, A lion: My lord, I stand continually upon the watchtower in the daytime, and I am set in my ward whole nights:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 21:
Bible.Verse: 9 And, behold, here cometh a chariot of men, with a couple of horsemen. And he answered and said, Babylon is fallen, is fallen; and all the graven images of her gods he hath broken unto the ground.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 21:
Bible.Verse: 10 O my threshing, and the corn of my floor: that which I have heard of the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, have I declared unto you.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 21:
Bible.Verse: 11 The burden of Dumah. He calleth to me out of Seir, Watchman, what of the night? Watchman, what of the night?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 21:
Bible.Verse: 12 The watchman said, The morning cometh, and also the night: if ye will enquire, enquire ye: return, come.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 21:
Bible.Verse: 13 The burden upon Arabia. In the forest in Arabia shall ye lodge, O ye travelling companies of Dedanim.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 21:
Bible.Verse: 14 The inhabitants of the land of Tema brought water to him that was thirsty, they prevented with their bread him that fled.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 21:
Bible.Verse: 15 For they fled from the swords, from the drawn sword, and from the bent bow, and from the grievousness of war.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 21:
Bible.Verse: 16 For thus hath the LORD said unto me, Within a year, according to the years of an hireling, and all the glory of Kedar shall fail:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 21:
Bible.Verse: 17 And the residue of the number of archers, the mighty men of the children of Kedar, shall be diminished: for the LORD God of Israel hath spoken it.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 22:
Bible.Verse: 1 The burden of the valley of vision. What aileth thee now, that thou art wholly gone up to the housetops?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 22:
Bible.Verse: 2 Thou that art full of stirs, a tumultuous city, a joyous city: thy slain men are not slain with the sword, nor dead in battle.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 22:
Bible.Verse: 3 All thy rulers are fled together, they are bound by the archers: all that are found in thee are bound together, which have fled from far.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 22:
Bible.Verse: 4 Therefore said I, Look away from me; I will weep bitterly, labour not to comfort me, because of the spoiling of the daughter of my people.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 22:
Bible.Verse: 5 For it is a day of trouble, and of treading down, and of perplexity by the Lord GOD of hosts in the valley of vision, breaking down the walls, and of crying to the mountains.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 22:
Bible.Verse: 6 And Elam bare the quiver with chariots of men and horsemen, and Kir uncovered the shield.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 22:
Bible.Verse: 7 And it shall come to pass, that thy choicest valleys shall be full of chariots, and the horsemen shall set themselves in array at the gate.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 22:
Bible.Verse: 8 And he discovered the covering of Judah, and thou didst look in that day to the armour of the house of the forest.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 22:
Bible.Verse: 9 Ye have seen also the breaches of the city of David, that they are many: and ye gathered together the waters of the lower pool.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 22:
Bible.Verse: 10 And ye have numbered the houses of Jerusalem, and the houses have ye broken down to fortify the wall.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 22:
Bible.Verse: 11 Ye made also a ditch between the two walls for the water of the old pool: but ye have not looked unto the maker thereof, neither had respect unto him that fashioned it long ago.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 22:
Bible.Verse: 12 And in that day did the Lord GOD of hosts call to weeping, and to mourning, and to baldness, and to girding with sackcloth:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 22:
Bible.Verse: 13 And behold joy and gladness, slaying oxen, and killing sheep, eating flesh, and drinking wine: let us eat and drink; for to morrow we shall die.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 22:
Bible.Verse: 14 And it was revealed in mine ears by the LORD of hosts, Surely this iniquity shall not be purged from you till ye die, saith the Lord GOD of hosts.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 22:
Bible.Verse: 15 Thus saith the Lord GOD of hosts, Go, get thee unto this treasurer, even unto Shebna, which is over the house, and say,

Bible.Title: Isaiah 22:
Bible.Verse: 16 What hast thou here? and whom hast thou here, that thou hast hewed thee out a sepulchre here, as he that heweth him out a sepulchre on high, and that graveth an habitation for himself in a rock?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 22:
Bible.Verse: 17 Behold, the LORD will carry thee away with a mighty captivity, and will surely cover thee.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 22:
Bible.Verse: 18 He will surely violently turn and toss thee like a ball into a large country: there shalt thou die, and there the chariots of thy glory shall be the shame of thy lord's house.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 22:
Bible.Verse: 19 And I will drive thee from thy station, and from thy state shall he pull thee down.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 22:
Bible.Verse: 20 And it shall come to pass in that day, that I will call my servant Eliakim the son of Hilkiah:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 22:
Bible.Verse: 21 And I will clothe him with thy robe, and strengthen him with thy girdle, and I will commit thy government into his hand: and he shall be a father to the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and to the house of Judah.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 22:
Bible.Verse: 22 And the key of the house of David will I lay upon his shoulder; so he shall open, and none shall shut; and he shall shut, and none shall open.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 22:
Bible.Verse: 23 And I will fasten him as a nail in a sure place; and he shall be for a glorious throne to his father's house.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 22:
Bible.Verse: 24 And they shall hang upon him all the glory of his father's house, the offspring and the issue, all vessels of small quantity, from the vessels of cups, even to all the vessels of flagons.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 22:
Bible.Verse: 25 In that day, saith the LORD of hosts, shall the nail that is fastened in the sure place be removed, and be cut down, and fall; and the burden that was upon it shall be cut off: for the LORD hath spoken it.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 23:
Bible.Verse: 1 The burden of Tyre. Howl, ye ships of Tarshish; for it is laid waste, so that there is no house, no entering in: from the land of Chittim it is revealed to them.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 23:
Bible.Verse: 2 Be still, ye inhabitants of the isle; thou whom the merchants of Zidon, that pass over the sea, have replenished.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 23:
Bible.Verse: 3 And by great waters the seed of Sihor, the harvest of the river, is her revenue; and she is a mart of nations.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 23:
Bible.Verse: 4 Be thou ashamed, O Zidon: for the sea hath spoken, even the strength of the sea, saying, I travail not, nor bring forth children, neither do I nourish up young men, nor bring up virgins.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 23:
Bible.Verse: 5 As at the report concerning Egypt, so shall they be sorely pained at the report of Tyre.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 23:
Bible.Verse: 6 Pass ye over to Tarshish; howl, ye inhabitants of the isle.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 23:
Bible.Verse: 7 Is this your joyous city, whose antiquity is of ancient days? her own feet shall carry her afar off to sojourn.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 23:
Bible.Verse: 8 Who hath taken this counsel against Tyre, the crowning city, whose merchants are princes, whose traffickers are the honourable of the earth?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 23:
Bible.Verse: 9 The LORD of hosts hath purposed it, to stain the pride of all glory, and to bring into contempt all the honourable of the earth.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 23:
Bible.Verse: 10 Pass through thy land as a river, O daughter of Tarshish: there is no more strength.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 23:
Bible.Verse: 11 He stretched out his hand over the sea, he shook the kingdoms: the LORD hath given a commandment against the merchant city, to destroy the strong holds thereof.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 23:
Bible.Verse: 12 And he said, Thou shalt no more rejoice, O thou oppressed virgin, daughter of Zidon: arise, pass over to Chittim; there also shalt thou have no rest.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 23:
Bible.Verse: 13 Behold the land of the Chaldeans; this people was not, till the Assyrian founded it for them that dwell in the wilderness: they set up the towers thereof, they raised up the palaces thereof; and he brought it to ruin.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 23:
Bible.Verse: 14 Howl, ye ships of Tarshish: for your strength is laid waste.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 23:
Bible.Verse: 15 And it shall come to pass in that day, that Tyre shall be forgotten seventy years, according to the days of one king: after the end of seventy years shall Tyre sing as an harlot.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 23:
Bible.Verse: 16 Take an harp, go about the city, thou harlot that hast been forgotten; make sweet melody, sing many songs, that thou mayest be remembered.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 23:
Bible.Verse: 17 And it shall come to pass after the end of seventy years, that the LORD will visit Tyre, and she shall turn to her hire, and shall commit fornication with all the kingdoms of the world upon the face of the earth.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 23:
Bible.Verse: 18 And her merchandise and her hire shall be holiness to the LORD: it shall not be treasured nor laid up; for her merchandise shall be for them that dwell before the LORD, to eat sufficiently, and for durable clothing.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 24:
Bible.Verse: 1 Behold, the LORD maketh the earth empty, and maketh it waste, and turneth it upside down, and scattereth abroad the inhabitants thereof.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 24:
Bible.Verse: 2 And it shall be, as with the people, so with the priest; as with the servant, so with his master; as with the maid, so with her mistress; as with the buyer, so with the seller; as with the lender, so with the borrower; as with the taker of usury, so with the giver of usury to him.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 24:
Bible.Verse: 3 The land shall be utterly emptied, and utterly spoiled: for the LORD hath spoken this word.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 24:
Bible.Verse: 4 The earth mourneth and fadeth away, the world languisheth and fadeth away, the haughty people of the earth do languish.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 24:
Bible.Verse: 5 The earth also is defiled under the inhabitants thereof; because they have transgressed the laws, changed the ordinance, broken the everlasting covenant.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 24:
Bible.Verse: 6 Therefore hath the curse devoured the earth, and they that dwell therein are desolate: therefore the inhabitants of the earth are burned, and few men left.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 24:
Bible.Verse: 7 The new wine mourneth, the vine languisheth, all the merryhearted do sigh.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 24:
Bible.Verse: 8 The mirth of tabrets ceaseth, the noise of them that rejoice endeth, the joy of the harp ceaseth.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 24:
Bible.Verse: 9 They shall not drink wine with a song; strong drink shall be bitter to them that drink it.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 24:
Bible.Verse: 10 The city of confusion is broken down: every house is shut up, that no man may come in.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 24:
Bible.Verse: 11 There is a crying for wine in the streets; all joy is darkened, the mirth of the land is gone.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 24:
Bible.Verse: 12 In the city is left desolation, and the gate is smitten with destruction.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 24:
Bible.Verse: 13 When thus it shall be in the midst of the land among the people, there shall be as the shaking of an olive tree, and as the gleaning grapes when the vintage is done.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 24:
Bible.Verse: 14 They shall lift up their voice, they shall sing for the majesty of the LORD, they shall cry aloud from the sea.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 24:
Bible.Verse: 15 Wherefore glorify ye the LORD in the fires, even the name of the LORD God of Israel in the isles of the sea.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 24:
Bible.Verse: 16 From the uttermost part of the earth have we heard songs, even glory to the righteous. But I said, My leanness, my leanness, woe unto me! the treacherous dealers have dealt treacherously; yea, the treacherous dealers have dealt very treacherously.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 24:
Bible.Verse: 17 Fear, and the pit, and the snare, are upon thee, O inhabitant of the earth.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 24:
Bible.Verse: 18 And it shall come to pass, that he who fleeth from the noise of the fear shall fall into the pit; and he that cometh up out of the midst of the pit shall be taken in the snare: for the windows from on high are open, and the foundations of the earth do shake.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 24:
Bible.Verse: 19 The earth is utterly broken down, the earth is clean dissolved, the earth is moved exceedingly.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 24:
Bible.Verse: 20 The earth shall reel to and fro like a drunkard, and shall be removed like a cottage; and the transgression thereof shall be heavy upon it; and it shall fall, and not rise again.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 24:
Bible.Verse: 21 And it shall come to pass in that day, that the LORD shall punish the host of the high ones that are on high, and the kings of the earth upon the earth.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 24:
Bible.Verse: 22 And they shall be gathered together, as prisoners are gathered in the pit, and shall be shut up in the prison, and after many days shall they be visited.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 24:
Bible.Verse: 23 Then the moon shall be confounded, and the sun ashamed, when the LORD of hosts shall reign in mount Zion, and in Jerusalem, and before his ancients gloriously.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 25:
Bible.Verse: 1 O Lord, thou art my God; I will exalt thee, I will praise thy name; for thou hast done wonderful things; thy counsels of old are faithfulness and truth.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 25:
Bible.Verse: 2 For thou hast made of a city an heap; of a defenced city a ruin: a palace of strangers to be no city; it shall never be built.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 25:
Bible.Verse: 3 Therefore shall the strong people glorify thee, the city of the terrible nations shall fear thee.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 25:
Bible.Verse: 4 For thou hast been a strength to the poor, a strength to the needy in his distress, a refuge from the storm, a shadow from the heat, when the blast of the terrible ones is as a storm against the wall.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 25:
Bible.Verse: 5 Thou shalt bring down the noise of strangers, as the heat in a dry place; even the heat with the shadow of a cloud: the branch of the terrible ones shall be brought low.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 25:
Bible.Verse: 6 And in this mountain shall the LORD of hosts make unto all people a feast of fat things, a feast of wines on the lees, of fat things full of marrow, of wines on the lees well refined.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 25:
Bible.Verse: 7 And he will destroy in this mountain the face of the covering cast over all people, and the vail that is spread over all nations.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 25:
Bible.Verse: 8 He will swallow up death in victory; and the Lord GOD will wipe away tears from off all faces; and the rebuke of his people shall he take away from off all the earth: for the LORD hath spoken it.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 25:
Bible.Verse: 9 And it shall be said in that day, Lo, this is our God; we have waited for him, and he will save us: this is the LORD; we have waited for him, we will be glad and rejoice in his salvation.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 25:
Bible.Verse: 10 For in this mountain shall the hand of the LORD rest, and Moab shall be trodden down under him, even as straw is trodden down for the dunghill.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 25:
Bible.Verse: 11 And he shall spread forth his hands in the midst of them, as he that swimmeth spreadeth forth his hands to swim: and he shall bring down their pride together with the spoils of their hands.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 25:
Bible.Verse: 12 And the fortress of the high fort of thy walls shall he bring down, lay low, and bring to the ground, even to the dust.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 26:
Bible.Verse: 1 In that day shall this song be sung in the land of Judah; We have a strong city; salvation will God appoint for walls and bulwarks.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 26:
Bible.Verse: 2 Open ye the gates, that the righteous nation which keepeth the truth may enter in.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 26:
Bible.Verse: 3 Thou wilt keep him in perfect peace, whose mind is stayed on thee: because he trusteth in thee.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 26:
Bible.Verse: 4 Trust ye in the LORD for ever: for in the LORD JEHOVAH is everlasting strength:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 26:
Bible.Verse: 5 For he bringeth down them that dwell on high; the lofty city, he layeth it low; he layeth it low, even to the ground; he bringeth it even to the dust.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 26:
Bible.Verse: 6 The foot shall tread it down, even the feet of the poor, and the steps of the needy.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 26:
Bible.Verse: 7 The way of the just is uprightness: thou, most upright, dost weigh the path of the just.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 26:
Bible.Verse: 8 Yea, in the way of thy judgments, O LORD, have we waited for thee; the desire of our soul is to thy name, and to the remembrance of thee.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 26:
Bible.Verse: 9 With my soul have I desired thee in the night; yea, with my spirit within me will I seek thee early: for when thy judgments are in the earth, the inhabitants of the world will learn righteousness.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 26:
Bible.Verse: 10 Let favour be shewed to the wicked, yet will he not learn righteousness: in the land of uprightness will he deal unjustly, and will not behold the majesty of the LORD.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 26:
Bible.Verse: 11 LORD, when thy hand is lifted up, they will not see: but they shall see, and be ashamed for their envy at the people; yea, the fire of thine enemies shall devour them.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 26:
Bible.Verse: 12 LORD, thou wilt ordain peace for us: for thou also hast wrought all our works in us.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 26:
Bible.Verse: 13 O LORD our God, other lords beside thee have had dominion over us: but by thee only will we make mention of thy name.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 26:
Bible.Verse: 14 They are dead, they shall not live; they are deceased, they shall not rise: therefore hast thou visited and destroyed them, and made all their memory to perish.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 26:
Bible.Verse: 15 Thou hast increased the nation, O LORD, thou hast increased the nation: thou art glorified: thou hadst removed it far unto all the ends of the earth.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 26:
Bible.Verse: 16 LORD, in trouble have they visited thee, they poured out a prayer when thy chastening was upon them.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 26:
Bible.Verse: 17 Like as a woman with child, that draweth near the time of her delivery, is in pain, and crieth out in her pangs; so have we been in thy sight, O LORD.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 26:
Bible.Verse: 18 We have been with child, we have been in pain, we have as it were brought forth wind; we have not wrought any deliverance in the earth; neither have the inhabitants of the world fallen.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 26:
Bible.Verse: 19 Thy dead men shall live, together with my dead body shall they arise. Awake and sing, ye that dwell in dust: for thy dew is as the dew of herbs, and the earth shall cast out the dead.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 26:
Bible.Verse: 20 Come, my people, enter thou into thy chambers, and shut thy doors about thee: hide thyself as it were for a little moment, until the indignation be overpast.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 26:
Bible.Verse: 21 For, behold, the LORD cometh out of his place to punish the inhabitants of the earth for their iniquity: the earth also shall disclose her blood, and shall no more cover her slain.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 27:
Bible.Verse: 1 In that day the LORD with his sore and great and strong sword shall punish leviathan the piercing serpent, even leviathan that crooked serpent; and he shall slay the dragon that is in the sea.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 27:
Bible.Verse: 2 In that day sing ye unto her, A vineyard of red wine.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 27:
Bible.Verse: 3 I the LORD do keep it; I will water it every moment: lest any hurt it, I will keep it night and day.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 27:
Bible.Verse: 4 Fury is not in me: who would set the briers and thorns against me in battle? I would go through them, I would burn them together.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 27:
Bible.Verse: 5 Or let him take hold of my strength, that he may make peace with me; and he shall make peace with me.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 27:
Bible.Verse: 6 He shall cause them that come of Jacob to take root: Israel shall blossom and bud, and fill the face of the world with fruit.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 27:
Bible.Verse: 7 Hath he smitten him, as he smote those that smote him? or is he slain according to the slaughter of them that are slain by him?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 27:
Bible.Verse: 8 In measure, when it shooteth forth, thou wilt debate with it: he stayeth his rough wind in the day of the east wind.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 27:
Bible.Verse: 9 By this therefore shall the iniquity of Jacob be purged; and this is all the fruit to take away his sin; when he maketh all the stones of the altar as chalkstones that are beaten in sunder, the groves and images shall not stand up.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 27:
Bible.Verse: 10 Yet the defenced city shall be desolate, and the habitation forsaken, and left like a wilderness: there shall the calf feed, and there shall he lie down, and consume the branches thereof.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 27:
Bible.Verse: 11 When the boughs thereof are withered, they shall be broken off: the women come, and set them on fire: for it is a people of no understanding: therefore he that made them will not have mercy on them, and he that formed them will shew them no favour.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 27:
Bible.Verse: 12 And it shall come to pass in that day, that the LORD shall beat off from the channel of the river unto the stream of Egypt, and ye shall be gathered one by one, O ye children of Israel.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 27:
Bible.Verse: 13 And it shall come to pass in that day, that the great trumpet shall be blown, and they shall come which were ready to perish in the land of Assyria, and the outcasts in the land of Egypt, and shall worship the LORD in the holy mount at Jerusalem.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 28:
Bible.Verse: 1 Woe to the crown of pride, to the drunkards of Ephraim, whose glorious beauty is a fading flower, which are on the head of the fat valleys of them that are overcome with wine!

Bible.Title: Isaiah 28:
Bible.Verse: 2 Behold, the Lord hath a mighty and strong one, which as a tempest of hail and a destroying storm, as a flood of mighty waters overflowing, shall cast down to the earth with the hand.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 28:
Bible.Verse: 3 The crown of pride, the drunkards of Ephraim, shall be trodden under feet:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 28:
Bible.Verse: 4 And the glorious beauty, which is on the head of the fat valley, shall be a fading flower, and as the hasty fruit before the summer; which when he that looketh upon it seeth, while it is yet in his hand he eateth it up.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 28:
Bible.Verse: 5 In that day shall the LORD of hosts be for a crown of glory, and for a diadem of beauty, unto the residue of his people,

Bible.Title: Isaiah 28:
Bible.Verse: 6 And for a spirit of judgment to him that sitteth in judgment, and for strength to them that turn the battle to the gate.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 28:
Bible.Verse: 7 But they also have erred through wine, and through strong drink are out of the way; the priest and the prophet have erred through strong drink, they are swallowed up of wine, they are out of the way through strong drink; they err in vision, they stumble in judgment.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 28:
Bible.Verse: 8 For all tables are full of vomit and filthiness, so that there is no place clean.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 28:
Bible.Verse: 9 Whom shall he teach knowledge? and whom shall he make to understand doctrine? them that are weaned from the milk, and drawn from the breasts.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 28:
Bible.Verse: 10 For precept must be upon precept, precept upon precept; line upon line, line upon line; here a little, and there a little:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 28:
Bible.Verse: 11 For with stammering lips and another tongue will he speak to this people.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 28:
Bible.Verse: 12 To whom he said, This is the rest wherewith ye may cause the weary to rest; and this is the refreshing: yet they would not hear.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 28:
Bible.Verse: 13 But the word of the LORD was unto them precept upon precept, precept upon precept; line upon line, line upon line; here a little, and there a little; that they might go, and fall backward, and be broken, and snared, and taken.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 28:
Bible.Verse: 14 Wherefore hear the word of the LORD, ye scornful men, that rule this people which is in Jerusalem.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 28:
Bible.Verse: 15 Because ye have said, We have made a covenant with death, and with hell are we at agreement; when the overflowing scourge shall pass through, it shall not come unto us: for we have made lies our refuge, and under falsehood have we hid ourselves:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 28:
Bible.Verse: 16 Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD, Behold, I lay in Zion for a foundation a stone, a tried stone, a precious corner stone, a sure foundation: he that believeth shall not make haste.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 28:
Bible.Verse: 17 Judgment also will I lay to the line, and righteousness to the plummet: and the hail shall sweep away the refuge of lies, and the waters shall overflow the hiding place.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 28:
Bible.Verse: 18 And your covenant with death shall be disannulled, and your agreement with hell shall not stand; when the overflowing scourge shall pass through, then ye shall be trodden down by it.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 28:
Bible.Verse: 19 From the time that it goeth forth it shall take you: for morning by morning shall it pass over, by day and by night: and it shall be a vexation only to understand the report.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 28:
Bible.Verse: 20 For the bed is shorter than that a man can stretch himself on it: and the covering narrower than that he can wrap himself in it.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 28:
Bible.Verse: 21 For the LORD shall rise up as in mount Perazim, he shall be wroth as in the valley of Gibeon, that he may do his work, his strange work; and bring to pass his act, his strange act.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 28:
Bible.Verse: 22 Now therefore be ye not mockers, lest your bands be made strong: for I have heard from the Lord GOD of hosts a consumption, even determined upon the whole earth.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 28:
Bible.Verse: 23 Give ye ear, and hear my voice; hearken, and hear my speech.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 28:
Bible.Verse: 24 Doth the plowman plow all day to sow? doth he open and break the clods of his ground?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 28:
Bible.Verse: 25 When he hath made plain the face thereof, doth he not cast abroad the fitches, and scatter the cummin, and cast in the principal wheat and the appointed barley and the rie in their place?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 28:
Bible.Verse: 26 For his God doth instruct him to discretion, and doth teach him.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 28:
Bible.Verse: 27 For the fitches are not threshed with a threshing instrument, neither is a cart wheel turned about upon the cummin; but the fitches are beaten out with a staff, and the cummin with a rod.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 28:
Bible.Verse: 28 Bread corn is bruised; because he will not ever be threshing it, nor break it with the wheel of his cart, nor bruise it with his horsemen.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 28:
Bible.Verse: 29 This also cometh forth from the LORD of hosts, which is wonderful in counsel, and excellent in working.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 29:
Bible.Verse: 1 Woe to Ariel, to Ariel, the city where David dwelt! add ye year to year; let them kill sacrifices.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 29:
Bible.Verse: 2 Yet I will distress Ariel, and there shall be heaviness and sorrow: and it shall be unto me as Ariel.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 29:
Bible.Verse: 3 And I will camp against thee round about, and will lay siege against thee with a mount, and I will raise forts against thee.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 29:
Bible.Verse: 4 And thou shalt be brought down, and shalt speak out of the ground, and thy speech shall be low out of the dust, and thy voice shall be, as of one that hath a familiar spirit, out of the ground, and thy speech shall whisper out of the dust.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 29:
Bible.Verse: 5 Moreover the multitude of thy strangers shall be like small dust, and the multitude of the terrible ones shall be as chaff that passeth away: yea, it shall be at an instant suddenly.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 29:
Bible.Verse: 6 Thou shalt be visited of the LORD of hosts with thunder, and with earthquake, and great noise, with storm and tempest, and the flame of devouring fire.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 29:
Bible.Verse: 7 And the multitude of all the nations that fight against Ariel, even all that fight against her and her munition, and that distress her, shall be as a dream of a night vision.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 29:
Bible.Verse: 8 It shall even be as when an hungry man dreameth, and, behold, he eateth; but he awaketh, and his soul is empty: or as when a thirsty man dreameth, and, behold, he drinketh; but he awaketh, and, behold, he is faint, and his soul hath appetite: so shall the multitude of all the nations be, that fight against mount Zion.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 29:
Bible.Verse: 9 Stay yourselves, and wonder; cry ye out, and cry: they are drunken, but not with wine; they stagger, but not with strong drink.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 29:
Bible.Verse: 10 For the LORD hath poured out upon you the spirit of deep sleep, and hath closed your eyes: the prophets and your rulers, the seers hath he covered.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 29:
Bible.Verse: 11 And the vision of all is become unto you as the words of a book that is sealed, which men deliver to one that is learned, saying, Read this, I pray thee: and he saith, I cannot; for it is sealed:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 29:
Bible.Verse: 12 And the book is delivered to him that is not learned, saying, Read this, I pray thee: and he saith, I am not learned.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 29:
Bible.Verse: 13 Wherefore the Lord said, Forasmuch as this people draw near me with their mouth, and with their lips do honour me, but have removed their heart far from me, and their fear toward me is taught by the precept of men:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 29:
Bible.Verse: 14 Therefore, behold, I will proceed to do a marvellous work among this people, even a marvellous work and a wonder: for the wisdom of their wise men shall perish, and the understanding of their prudent men shall be hid.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 29:
Bible.Verse: 15 Woe unto them that seek deep to hide their counsel from the LORD, and their works are in the dark, and they say, Who seeth us? and who knoweth us?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 29:
Bible.Verse: 16 Surely your turning of things upside down shall be esteemed as the potter's clay: for shall the work say of him that made it, He made me not? or shall the thing framed say of him that framed it, He had no understanding?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 29:
Bible.Verse: 17 Is it not yet a very little while, and Lebanon shall be turned into a fruitful field, and the fruitful field shall be esteemed as a forest?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 29:
Bible.Verse: 18 And in that day shall the deaf hear the words of the book, and the eyes of the blind shall see out of obscurity, and out of darkness.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 29:
Bible.Verse: 19 The meek also shall increase their joy in the LORD, and the poor among men shall rejoice in the Holy One of Israel.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 29:
Bible.Verse: 20 For the terrible one is brought to nought, and the scorner is consumed, and all that watch for iniquity are cut off:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 29:
Bible.Verse: 21 That make a man an offender for a word, and lay a snare for him that reproveth in the gate, and turn aside the just for a thing of nought.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 29:
Bible.Verse: 22 Therefore thus saith the LORD, who redeemed Abraham, concerning the house of Jacob, Jacob shall not now be ashamed, neither shall his face now wax pale.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 29:
Bible.Verse: 23 But when he seeth his children, the work of mine hands, in the midst of him, they shall sanctify my name, and sanctify the Holy One of Jacob, and shall fear the God of Israel.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 29:
Bible.Verse: 24 They also that erred in spirit shall come to understanding, and they that murmured shall learn doctrine.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 30:
Bible.Verse: 1 Woe to the rebellious children, saith the LORD, that take counsel, but not of me; and that cover with a covering, but not of my spirit, that they may add sin to sin:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 30:
Bible.Verse: 2 That walk to go down into Egypt, and have not asked at my mouth; to strengthen themselves in the strength of Pharaoh, and to trust in the shadow of Egypt!

Bible.Title: Isaiah 30:
Bible.Verse: 3 Therefore shall the strength of Pharaoh be your shame, and the trust in the shadow of Egypt your confusion.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 30:
Bible.Verse: 4 For his princes were at Zoan, and his ambassadors came to Hanes.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 30:
Bible.Verse: 5 They were all ashamed of a people that could not profit them, nor be an help nor profit, but a shame, and also a reproach.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 30:
Bible.Verse: 6 The burden of the beasts of the south: into the land of trouble and anguish, from whence come the young and old lion, the viper and fiery flying serpent, they will carry their riches upon the shoulders of young asses, and their treasures upon the bunches of camels, to a people that shall not profit them.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 30:
Bible.Verse: 7 For the Egyptians shall help in vain, and to no purpose: therefore have I cried concerning this, Their strength is to sit still.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 30:
Bible.Verse: 8 Now go, write it before them in a table, and note it in a book, that it may be for the time to come for ever and ever:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 30:
Bible.Verse: 9 That this is a rebellious people, lying children, children that will not hear the law of the LORD:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 30:
Bible.Verse: 10 Which say to the seers, See not; and to the prophets, Prophesy not unto us right things, speak unto us smooth things, prophesy deceits:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 30:
Bible.Verse: 11 Get you out of the way, turn aside out of the path, cause the Holy One of Israel to cease from before us.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 30:
Bible.Verse: 12 Wherefore thus saith the Holy One of Israel, Because ye despise this word, and trust in oppression and perverseness, and stay thereon:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 30:
Bible.Verse: 13 Therefore this iniquity shall be to you as a breach ready to fall, swelling out in a high wall, whose breaking cometh suddenly at an instant.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 30:
Bible.Verse: 14 And he shall break it as the breaking of the potters' vessel that is broken in pieces; he shall not spare: so that there shall not be found in the bursting of it a sherd to take fire from the hearth, or to take water withal out of the pit.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 30:
Bible.Verse: 15 For thus saith the Lord GOD, the Holy One of Israel; In returning and rest shall ye be saved; in quietness and in confidence shall be your strength: and ye would not.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 30:
Bible.Verse: 16 But ye said, No; for we will flee upon horses; therefore shall ye flee: and, We will ride upon the swift; therefore shall they that pursue you be swift.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 30:
Bible.Verse: 17 One thousand shall flee at the rebuke of one; at the rebuke of five shall ye flee: till ye be left as a beacon upon the top of a mountain, and as an ensign on an hill.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 30:
Bible.Verse: 18 And therefore will the LORD wait, that he may be gracious unto you, and therefore will he be exalted, that he may have mercy upon you: for the LORD is a God of judgment: blessed are all they that wait for him.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 30:
Bible.Verse: 19 For the people shall dwell in Zion at Jerusalem: thou shalt weep no more: he will be very gracious unto thee at the voice of thy cry; when he shall hear it, he will answer thee.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 30:
Bible.Verse: 20 And though the Lord give you the bread of adversity, and the water of affliction, yet shall not thy teachers be removed into a corner any more, but thine eyes shall see thy teachers:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 30:
Bible.Verse: 21 And thine ears shall hear a word behind thee, saying, This is the way, walk ye in it, when ye turn to the right hand, and when ye turn to the left.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 30:
Bible.Verse: 22 Ye shall defile also the covering of thy graven images of silver, and the ornament of thy molten images of gold: thou shalt cast them away as a menstruous cloth; thou shalt say unto it, Get thee hence.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 30:
Bible.Verse: 23 Then shall he give the rain of thy seed, that thou shalt sow the ground withal; and bread of the increase of the earth, and it shall be fat and plenteous: in that day shall thy cattle feed in large pastures.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 30:
Bible.Verse: 24 The oxen likewise and the young asses that ear the ground shall eat clean provender, which hath been winnowed with the shovel and with the fan.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 30:
Bible.Verse: 25 And there shall be upon every high mountain, and upon every high hill, rivers and streams of waters in the day of the great slaughter, when the towers fall.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 30:
Bible.Verse: 26 Moreover the light of the moon shall be as the light of the sun, and the light of the sun shall be sevenfold, as the light of seven days, in the day that the LORD bindeth up the breach of his people, and healeth the stroke of their wound.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 30:
Bible.Verse: 27 Behold, the name of the LORD cometh from far, burning with his anger, and the burden thereof is heavy: his lips are full of indignation, and his tongue as a devouring fire:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 30:
Bible.Verse: 28 And his breath, as an overflowing stream, shall reach to the midst of the neck, to sift the nations with the sieve of vanity: and there shall be a bridle in the jaws of the people, causing them to err.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 30:
Bible.Verse: 29 Ye shall have a song, as in the night when a holy solemnity is kept; and gladness of heart, as when one goeth with a pipe to come into the mountain of the LORD, to the mighty One of Israel.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 30:
Bible.Verse: 30 And the LORD shall cause his glorious voice to be heard, and shall shew the lighting down of his arm, with the indignation of his anger, and with the flame of a devouring fire, with scattering, and tempest, and hailstones.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 30:
Bible.Verse: 31 For through the voice of the LORD shall the Assyrian be beaten down, which smote with a rod.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 30:
Bible.Verse: 32 And in every place where the grounded staff shall pass, which the LORD shall lay upon him, it shall be with tabrets and harps: and in battles of shaking will he fight with it.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 30:
Bible.Verse: 33 For Tophet is ordained of old; yea, for the king it is prepared; he hath made it deep and large: the pile thereof is fire and much wood; the breath of the LORD, like a stream of brimstone, doth kindle it.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 31:
Bible.Verse: 1 Woe to them that go down to Egypt for help; and stay on horses, and trust in chariots, because they are many; and in horsemen, because they are very strong; but they look not unto the Holy One of Israel, neither seek the LORD!

Bible.Title: Isaiah 31:
Bible.Verse: 2 Yet he also is wise, and will bring evil, and will not call back his words: but will arise against the house of the evildoers, and against the help of them that work iniquity.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 31:
Bible.Verse: 3 Now the Egyptians are men, and not God; and their horses flesh, and not spirit. When the LORD shall stretch out his hand, both he that helpeth shall fall, and he that is holpen shall fall down, and they all shall fail together.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 31:
Bible.Verse: 4 For thus hath the LORD spoken unto me, Like as the lion and the young lion roaring on his prey, when a multitude of shepherds is called forth against him, he will not be afraid of their voice, nor abase himself for the noise of them: so shall the LORD of hosts come down to fight for mount Zion, and for the hill thereof.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 31:
Bible.Verse: 5 As birds flying, so will the LORD of hosts defend Jerusalem; defending also he will deliver it; and passing over he will preserve it.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 31:
Bible.Verse: 6 Turn ye unto him from whom the children of Israel have deeply revolted.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 31:
Bible.Verse: 7 For in that day every man shall cast away his idols of silver, and his idols of gold, which your own hands have made unto you for a sin.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 31:
Bible.Verse: 8 Then shall the Assyrian fall with the sword, not of a mighty man; and the sword, not of a mean man, shall devour him: but he shall flee from the sword, and his young men shall be discomfited.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 31:
Bible.Verse: 9 And he shall pass over to his strong hold for fear, and his princes shall be afraid of the ensign, saith the LORD, whose fire is in Zion, and his furnace in Jerusalem.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 32:
Bible.Verse: 1 Behold, a king shall reign in righteousness, and princes shall rule in judgment.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 32:
Bible.Verse: 2 And a man shall be as an hiding place from the wind, and a covert from the tempest; as rivers of water in a dry place, as the shadow of a great rock in a weary land.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 32:
Bible.Verse: 3 And the eyes of them that see shall not be dim, and the ears of them that hear shall hearken.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 32:
Bible.Verse: 4 The heart also of the rash shall understand knowledge, and the tongue of the stammerers shall be ready to speak plainly.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 32:
Bible.Verse: 5 The vile person shall be no more called liberal, nor the churl said to be bountiful.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 32:
Bible.Verse: 6 For the vile person will speak villany, and his heart will work iniquity, to practise hypocrisy, and to utter error against the LORD, to make empty the soul of the hungry, and he will cause the drink of the thirsty to fail.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 32:
Bible.Verse: 7 The instruments also of the churl are evil: he deviseth wicked devices to destroy the poor with lying words, even when the needy speaketh right.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 32:
Bible.Verse: 8 But the liberal deviseth liberal things; and by liberal things shall he stand.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 32:
Bible.Verse: 9 Rise up, ye women that are at ease; hear my voice, ye careless daughters; give ear unto my speech.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 32:
Bible.Verse: 10 Many days and years shall ye be troubled, ye careless women: for the vintage shall fail, the gathering shall not come.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 32:
Bible.Verse: 11 Tremble, ye women that are at ease; be troubled, ye careless ones: strip you, and make you bare, and gird sackcloth upon your loins.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 32:
Bible.Verse: 12 They shall lament for the teats, for the pleasant fields, for the fruitful vine.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 32:
Bible.Verse: 13 Upon the land of my people shall come up thorns and briers; yea, upon all the houses of joy in the joyous city:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 32:
Bible.Verse: 14 Because the palaces shall be forsaken; the multitude of the city shall be left; the forts and towers shall be for dens for ever, a joy of wild asses, a pasture of flocks;

Bible.Title: Isaiah 32:
Bible.Verse: 15 Until the spirit be poured upon us from on high, and the wilderness be a fruitful field, and the fruitful field be counted for a forest.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 32:
Bible.Verse: 16 Then judgment shall dwell in the wilderness, and righteousness remain in the fruitful field.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 32:
Bible.Verse: 17 And the work of righteousness shall be peace; and the effect of righteousness quietness and assurance for ever.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 32:
Bible.Verse: 18 And my people shall dwell in a peaceable habitation, and in sure dwellings, and in quiet resting places;

Bible.Title: Isaiah 32:
Bible.Verse: 19 When it shall hail, coming down on the forest; and the city shall be low in a low place.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 32:
Bible.Verse: 20 Blessed are ye that sow beside all waters, that send forth thither the feet of the ox and the ass.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 33:
Bible.Verse: 1 Woe to thee that spoilest, and thou wast not spoiled; and dealest treacherously, and they dealt not treacherously with thee! when thou shalt cease to spoil, thou shalt be spoiled; and when thou shalt make an end to deal treacherously, they shall deal treacherously with thee.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 33:
Bible.Verse: 2 O LORD, be gracious unto us; we have waited for thee: be thou their arm every morning, our salvation also in the time of trouble.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 33:
Bible.Verse: 3 At the noise of the tumult the people fled; at the lifting up of thyself the nations were scattered.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 33:
Bible.Verse: 4 And your spoil shall be gathered like the gathering of the caterpiller: as the running to and fro of locusts shall he run upon them.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 33:
Bible.Verse: 5 The LORD is exalted; for he dwelleth on high: he hath filled Zion with judgment and righteousness.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 33:
Bible.Verse: 6 And wisdom and knowledge shall be the stability of thy times, and strength of salvation: the fear of the LORD is his treasure.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 33:
Bible.Verse: 7 Behold, their valiant ones shall cry without: the ambassadors of peace shall weep bitterly.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 33:
Bible.Verse: 8 The highways lie waste, the wayfaring man ceaseth: he hath broken the covenant, he hath despised the cities, he regardeth no man.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 33:
Bible.Verse: 9 The earth mourneth and languisheth: Lebanon is ashamed and hewn down: Sharon is like a wilderness; and Bashan and Carmel shake off their fruits.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 33:
Bible.Verse: 10 Now will I rise, saith the LORD; now will I be exalted; now will I lift up myself.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 33:
Bible.Verse: 11 Ye shall conceive chaff, ye shall bring forth stubble: your breath, as fire, shall devour you.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 33:
Bible.Verse: 12 And the people shall be as the burnings of lime: as thorns cut up shall they be burned in the fire.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 33:
Bible.Verse: 13 Hear, ye that are far off, what I have done; and, ye that are near, acknowledge my might.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 33:
Bible.Verse: 14 The sinners in Zion are afraid; fearfulness hath surprised the hypocrites. Who among us shall dwell with the devouring fire? who among us shall dwell with everlasting burnings?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 33:
Bible.Verse: 15 He that walketh righteously, and speaketh uprightly; he that despiseth the gain of oppressions, that shaketh his hands from holding of bribes, that stoppeth his ears from hearing of blood, and shutteth his eyes from seeing evil;

Bible.Title: Isaiah 33:
Bible.Verse: 16 He shall dwell on high: his place of defence shall be the munitions of rocks: bread shall be given him; his waters shall be sure.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 33:
Bible.Verse: 17 Thine eyes shall see the king in his beauty: they shall behold the land that is very far off.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 33:
Bible.Verse: 18 Thine heart shall meditate terror. Where is the scribe? where is the receiver? where is he that counted the towers?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 33:
Bible.Verse: 19 Thou shalt not see a fierce people, a people of a deeper speech than thou canst perceive; of a stammering tongue, that thou canst not understand.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 33:
Bible.Verse: 20 Look upon Zion, the city of our solemnities: thine eyes shall see Jerusalem a quiet habitation, a tabernacle that shall not be taken down; not one of the stakes thereof shall ever be removed, neither shall any of the cords thereof be broken.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 33:
Bible.Verse: 21 But there the glorious LORD will be unto us a place of broad rivers and streams; wherein shall go no galley with oars, neither shall gallant ship pass thereby.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 33:
Bible.Verse: 22 For the LORD is our judge, the LORD is our lawgiver, the LORD is our king; he will save us.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 33:
Bible.Verse: 23 Thy tacklings are loosed; they could not well strengthen their mast, they could not spread the sail: then is the prey of a great spoil divided; the lame take the prey.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 33:
Bible.Verse: 24 And the inhabitant shall not say, I am sick: the people that dwell therein shall be forgiven their iniquity.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 34:
Bible.Verse: 1 Come near, ye nations, to hear; and hearken, ye people: let the earth hear, and all that is therein; the world, and all things that come forth of it.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 34:
Bible.Verse: 2 For the indignation of the LORD is upon all nations, and his fury upon all their armies: he hath utterly destroyed them, he hath delivered them to the slaughter.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 34:
Bible.Verse: 3 Their slain also shall be cast out, and their stink shall come up out of their carcases, and the mountains shall be melted with their blood.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 34:
Bible.Verse: 4 And all the host of heaven shall be dissolved, and the heavens shall be rolled together as a scroll: and all their host shall fall down, as the leaf falleth off from the vine, and as a falling fig from the fig tree.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 34:
Bible.Verse: 5 For my sword shall be bathed in heaven: behold, it shall come down upon Idumea, and upon the people of my curse, to judgment.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 34:
Bible.Verse: 6 The sword of the LORD is filled with blood, it is made fat with fatness, and with the blood of lambs and goats, with the fat of the kidneys of rams: for the LORD hath a sacrifice in Bozrah, and a great slaughter in the land of Idumea.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 34:
Bible.Verse: 7 And the unicorns shall come down with them, and the bullocks with the bulls; and their land shall be soaked with blood, and their dust made fat with fatness.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 34:
Bible.Verse: 8 For it is the day of the LORD's vengeance, and the year of recompences for the controversy of Zion.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 34:
Bible.Verse: 9 And the streams thereof shall be turned into pitch, and the dust thereof into brimstone, and the land thereof shall become burning pitch.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 34:
Bible.Verse: 10 It shall not be quenched night nor day; the smoke thereof shall go up for ever: from generation to generation it shall lie waste; none shall pass through it for ever and ever.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 34:
Bible.Verse: 11 But the cormorant and the bittern shall possess it; the owl also and the raven shall dwell in it: and he shall stretch out upon it the line of confusion, and the stones of emptiness.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 34:
Bible.Verse: 12 They shall call the nobles thereof to the kingdom, but none shall be there, and all her princes shall be nothing.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 34:
Bible.Verse: 13 And thorns shall come up in her palaces, nettles and brambles in the fortresses thereof: and it shall be an habitation of dragons, and a court for owls.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 34:
Bible.Verse: 14 The wild beasts of the desert shall also meet with the wild beasts of the island, and the satyr shall cry to his fellow; the screech owl also shall rest there, and find for herself a place of rest.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 34:
Bible.Verse: 15 There shall the great owl make her nest, and lay, and hatch, and gather under her shadow: there shall the vultures also be gathered, every one with her mate.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 34:
Bible.Verse: 16 Seek ye out of the book of the LORD, and read: no one of these shall fail, none shall want her mate: for my mouth it hath commanded, and his spirit it hath gathered them.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 34:
Bible.Verse: 17 And he hath cast the lot for them, and his hand hath divided it unto them by line: they shall possess it for ever, from generation to generation shall they dwell therein.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 35:
Bible.Verse: 1 The wilderness and the solitary place shall be glad for them; and the desert shall rejoice, and blossom as the rose.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 35:
Bible.Verse: 2 It shall blossom abundantly, and rejoice even with joy and singing: the glory of Lebanon shall be given unto it, the excellency of Carmel and Sharon, they shall see the glory of the LORD, and the excellency of our God.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 35:
Bible.Verse: 3 Strengthen ye the weak hands, and confirm the feeble knees.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 35:
Bible.Verse: 4 Say to them that are of a fearful heart, Be strong, fear not: behold, your God will come with vengeance, even God with a recompence; he will come and save you.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 35:
Bible.Verse: 5 Then the eyes of the blind shall be opened, and the ears of the deaf shall be unstopped.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 35:
Bible.Verse: 6 Then shall the lame man leap as an hart, and the tongue of the dumb sing: for in the wilderness shall waters break out, and streams in the desert.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 35:
Bible.Verse: 7 And the parched ground shall become a pool, and the thirsty land springs of water: in the habitation of dragons, where each lay, shall be grass with reeds and rushes.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 35:
Bible.Verse: 8 And an highway shall be there, and a way, and it shall be called The way of holiness; the unclean shall not pass over it; but it shall be for those: the wayfaring men, though fools, shall not err therein.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 35:
Bible.Verse: 9 No lion shall be there, nor any ravenous beast shall go up thereon, it shall not be found there; but the redeemed shall walk there:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 35:
Bible.Verse: 10 And the ransomed of the LORD shall return, and come to Zion with songs and everlasting joy upon their heads: they shall obtain joy and gladness, and sorrow and sighing shall flee away.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 36:
Bible.Verse: 1 Now it came to pass in the fourteenth year of king Hezekiah, that Sennacherib king of Assyria came up against all the defenced cities of Judah, and took them.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 36:
Bible.Verse: 2 And the king of Assyria sent Rabshakeh from Lachish to Jerusalem unto king Hezekiah with a great army. And he stood by the conduit of the upper pool in the highway of the fuller's field.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 36:
Bible.Verse: 3 Then came forth unto him Eliakim, Hilkiah's son, which was over the house, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah, Asaph's son, the recorder.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 36:
Bible.Verse: 4 And Rabshakeh said unto them, Say ye now to Hezekiah, Thus saith the great king, the king of Assyria, What confidence is this wherein thou trustest?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 36:
Bible.Verse: 5 I say, sayest thou, (but they are but vain words) I have counsel and strength for war: now on whom dost thou trust, that thou rebellest against me?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 36:
Bible.Verse: 6 Lo, thou trustest in the staff of this broken reed, on Egypt; whereon if a man lean, it will go into his hand, and pierce it: so is Pharaoh king of Egypt to all that trust in him.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 36:
Bible.Verse: 7 But if thou say to me, We trust in the LORD our God: is it not he, whose high places and whose altars Hezekiah hath taken away, and said to Judah and to Jerusalem, Ye shall worship before this altar?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 36:
Bible.Verse: 8 Now therefore give pledges, I pray thee, to my master the king of Assyria, and I will give thee two thousand horses, if thou be able on thy part to set riders upon them.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 36:
Bible.Verse: 9 How then wilt thou turn away the face of one captain of the least of my master's servants, and put thy trust on Egypt for chariots and for horsemen?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 36:
Bible.Verse: 10 And am I now come up without the LORD against this land to destroy it? the LORD said unto me, Go up against this land, and destroy it.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 36:
Bible.Verse: 11 Then said Eliakim and Shebna and Joah unto Rabshakeh, Speak, I pray thee, unto thy servants in the Syrian language; for we understand it: and speak not to us in the Jews' language, in the ears of the people that are on the wall.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 36:
Bible.Verse: 12 But Rabshakeh said, Hath my master sent me to thy master and to thee to speak these words? hath he not sent me to the men that sit upon the wall, that they may eat their own dung, and drink their own piss with you?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 36:
Bible.Verse: 13 Then Rabshakeh stood, and cried with a loud voice in the Jews' language, and said, Hear ye the words of the great king, the king of Assyria.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 36:
Bible.Verse: 14 Thus saith the king, Let not Hezekiah deceive you: for he shall not be able to deliver you.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 36:
Bible.Verse: 15 Neither let Hezekiah make you trust in the LORD, saying, The LORD will surely deliver us: this city shall not be delivered into the hand of the king of Assyria.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 36:
Bible.Verse: 16 Hearken not to Hezekiah: for thus saith the king of Assyria, Make an agreement with me by a present, and come out to me: and eat ye every one of his vine, and every one of his fig tree, and drink ye every one the waters of his own cistern;

Bible.Title: Isaiah 36:
Bible.Verse: 17 Until I come and take you away to a land like your own land, a land of corn and wine, a land of bread and vineyards.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 36:
Bible.Verse: 18 Beware lest Hezekiah persuade you, saying, The LORD will deliver us. Hath any of the gods of the nations delivered his land out of the hand of the king of Assyria?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 36:
Bible.Verse: 19 Where are the gods of Hamath and Arphad? where are the gods of Sepharvaim? and have they delivered Samaria out of my hand?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 36:
Bible.Verse: 20 Who are they among all the gods of these lands, that have delivered their land out of my hand, that the LORD should deliver Jerusalem out of my hand?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 36:
Bible.Verse: 21 But they held their peace, and answered him not a word: for the king's commandment was, saying, Answer him not.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 36:
Bible.Verse: 22 Then came Eliakim, the son of Hilkiah, that was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah, the son of Asaph, the recorder, to Hezekiah with their clothes rent, and told him the words of Rabshakeh.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 1 And it came to pass, when king Hezekiah heard it, that he rent his clothes, and covered himself with sackcloth, and went into the house of the LORD.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 2 And he sent Eliakim, who was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and the elders of the priests covered with sackcloth, unto Isaiah the prophet the son of Amoz.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 3 And they said unto him, Thus saith Hezekiah, This day is a day of trouble, and of rebuke, and of blasphemy: for the children are come to the birth, and there is not strength to bring forth.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 4 It may be the LORD thy God will hear the words of Rabshakeh, whom the king of Assyria his master hath sent to reproach the living God, and will reprove the words which the LORD thy God hath heard: wherefore lift up thy prayer for the remnant that is left.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 5 So the servants of king Hezekiah came to Isaiah.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 6 And Isaiah said unto them, Thus shall ye say unto your master, Thus saith the LORD, Be not afraid of the words that thou hast heard, wherewith the servants of the king of Assyria have blasphemed me.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 7 Behold, I will send a blast upon him, and he shall hear a rumour, and return to his own land; and I will cause him to fall by the sword in his own land.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 8 So Rabshakeh returned, and found the king of Assyria warring against Libnah: for he had heard that he was departed from Lachish.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 9 And he heard say concerning Tirhakah king of Ethiopia, He is come forth to make war with thee. And when he heard it, he sent messengers to Hezekiah, saying,

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 10 Thus shall ye speak to Hezekiah king of Judah, saying, Let not thy God, in whom thou trustest, deceive thee, saying, Jerusalem shall not be given into the hand of the king of Assyria.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 11 Behold, thou hast heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all lands by destroying them utterly; and shalt thou be delivered?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 12 Have the gods of the nations delivered them which my fathers have destroyed, as Gozan, and Haran, and Rezeph, and the children of Eden which were in Telassar?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 13 Where is the king of Hamath, and the king of Arphad, and the king of the city of Sepharvaim, Hena, and Ivah?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 14 And Hezekiah received the letter from the hand of the messengers, and read it: and Hezekiah went up unto the house of the LORD, and spread it before the LORD.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 15 And Hezekiah prayed unto the LORD, saying,

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 16 O LORD of hosts, God of Israel, that dwellest between the cherubims, thou art the God, even thou alone, of all the kingdoms of the earth: thou hast made heaven and earth.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 17 Incline thine ear, O LORD, and hear; open thine eyes, O LORD, and see: and hear all the words of Sennacherib, which hath sent to reproach the living God.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 18 Of a truth, LORD, the kings of Assyria have laid waste all the nations, and their countries,

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 19 And have cast their gods into the fire: for they were no gods, but the work of men's hands, wood and stone: therefore they have destroyed them.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 20 Now therefore, O LORD our God, save us from his hand, that all the kingdoms of the earth may know that thou art the LORD, even thou only.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 21 Then Isaiah the son of Amoz sent unto Hezekiah, saying, Thus saith the LORD God of Israel, Whereas thou hast prayed to me against Sennacherib king of Assyria:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 22 This is the word which the LORD hath spoken concerning him; The virgin, the daughter of Zion, hath despised thee, and laughed thee to scorn; the daughter of Jerusalem hath shaken her head at thee.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 23 Whom hast thou reproached and blasphemed? and against whom hast thou exalted thy voice, and lifted up thine eyes on high? even against the Holy One of Israel.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 24 By thy servants hast thou reproached the Lord, and hast said, By the multitude of my chariots am I come up to the height of the mountains, to the sides of Lebanon; and I will cut down the tall cedars thereof, and the choice fir trees thereof: and I will enter into the height of his border, and the forest of his Carmel.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 25 I have digged, and drunk water; and with the sole of my feet have I dried up all the rivers of the besieged places.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 26 Hast thou not heard long ago, how I have done it; and of ancient times, that I have formed it? now have I brought it to pass, that thou shouldest be to lay waste defenced cities into ruinous heaps.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 27 Therefore their inhabitants were of small power, they were dismayed and confounded: they were as the grass of the field, and as the green herb, as the grass on the housetops, and as corn blasted before it be grown up.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 28 But I know thy abode, and thy going out, and thy coming in, and thy rage against me.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 29 Because thy rage against me, and thy tumult, is come up into mine ears, therefore will I put my hook in thy nose, and my bridle in thy lips, and I will turn thee back by the way by which thou camest.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 30 And this shall be a sign unto thee, Ye shall eat this year such as groweth of itself; and the second year that which springeth of the same: and in the third year sow ye, and reap, and plant vineyards, and eat the fruit thereof.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 31 And the remnant that is escaped of the house of Judah shall again take root downward, and bear fruit upward:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 32 For out of Jerusalem shall go forth a remnant, and they that escape out of mount Zion: the zeal of the LORD of hosts shall do this.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 33 Therefore thus saith the LORD concerning the king of Assyria, He shall not come into this city, nor shoot an arrow there, nor come before it with shields, nor cast a bank against it.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 34 By the way that he came, by the same shall he return, and shall not come into this city, saith the LORD.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 35 For I will defend this city to save it for mine own sake, and for my servant David's sake.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 36 Then the angel of the LORD went forth, and smote in the camp of the Assyrians a hundred and fourscore and five thousand: and when they arose early in the morning, behold, they were all dead corpses.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 37 So Sennacherib king of Assyria departed, and went and returned, and dwelt at Nineveh.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 37:
Bible.Verse: 38 And it came to pass, as he was worshipping in the house of Nisroch his god, that Adrammelech and Sharezer his sons smote him with the sword; and they escaped into the land of Armenia: and Esarhaddon his son reigned in his stead.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 38:
Bible.Verse: 1 In those days was Hezekiah sick unto death. And Isaiah the prophet the son of Amoz came unto him, and said unto him, Thus saith the LORD, Set thine house in order: for thou shalt die, and not live.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 38:
Bible.Verse: 2 Then Hezekiah turned his face toward the wall, and prayed unto the LORD,

Bible.Title: Isaiah 38:
Bible.Verse: 3 And said, Remember now, O LORD, I beseech thee, how I have walked before thee in truth and with a perfect heart, and have done that which is good in thy sight. And Hezekiah wept sore.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 38:
Bible.Verse: 4 Then came the word of the LORD to Isaiah, saying,

Bible.Title: Isaiah 38:
Bible.Verse: 5 Go, and say to Hezekiah, Thus saith the LORD, the God of David thy father, I have heard thy prayer, I have seen thy tears: behold, I will add unto thy days fifteen years.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 38:
Bible.Verse: 6 And I will deliver thee and this city out of the hand of the king of Assyria: and I will defend this city.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 38:
Bible.Verse: 7 And this shall be a sign unto thee from the LORD, that the LORD will do this thing that he hath spoken;

Bible.Title: Isaiah 38:
Bible.Verse: 8 Behold, I will bring again the shadow of the degrees, which is gone down in the sun dial of Ahaz, ten degrees backward. So the sun returned ten degrees, by which degrees it was gone down.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 38:
