Bible.Verse: 11 We roar all like bears, and mourn sore like doves: we look for judgment, but there is none; for salvation, but it is far off from us.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 59:
Bible.Verse: 12 For our transgressions are multiplied before thee, and our sins testify against us: for our transgressions are with us; and as for our iniquities, we know them;

Bible.Title: Isaiah 59:
Bible.Verse: 13 In transgressing and lying against the LORD, and departing away from our God, speaking oppression and revolt, conceiving and uttering from the heart words of falsehood.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 59:
Bible.Verse: 14 And judgment is turned away backward, and justice standeth afar off: for truth is fallen in the street, and equity cannot enter.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 59:
Bible.Verse: 15 Yea, truth faileth; and he that departeth from evil maketh himself a prey: and the LORD saw it, and it displeased him that there was no judgment.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 59:
Bible.Verse: 16 And he saw that there was no man, and wondered that there was no intercessor: therefore his arm brought salvation unto him; and his righteousness, it sustained him.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 59:
Bible.Verse: 17 For he put on righteousness as a breastplate, and an helmet of salvation upon his head; and he put on the garments of vengeance for clothing, and was clad with zeal as a cloak.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 59:
Bible.Verse: 18 According to their deeds, accordingly he will repay, fury to his adversaries, recompence to his enemies; to the islands he will repay recompence.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 59:
Bible.Verse: 19 So shall they fear the name of the LORD from the west, and his glory from the rising of the sun. When the enemy shall come in like a flood, the Spirit of the LORD shall lift up a standard against him.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 59:
Bible.Verse: 20 And the Redeemer shall come to Zion, and unto them that turn from transgression in Jacob, saith the LORD.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 59:
Bible.Verse: 21 As for me, this is my covenant with them, saith the LORD; My spirit that is upon thee, and my words which I have put in thy mouth, shall not depart out of thy mouth, nor out of the mouth of thy seed, nor out of the mouth of thy seed's seed, saith the LORD, from henceforth and for ever.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 60:
Bible.Verse: 1 Arise, shine; for thy light is come, and the glory of the LORD is risen upon thee.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 60:
Bible.Verse: 2 For, behold, the darkness shall cover the earth, and gross darkness the people: but the LORD shall arise upon thee, and his glory shall be seen upon thee.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 60:
Bible.Verse: 3 And the Gentiles shall come to thy light, and kings to the brightness of thy rising.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 60:
Bible.Verse: 4 Lift up thine eyes round about, and see: all they gather themselves together, they come to thee: thy sons shall come from far, and thy daughters shall be nursed at thy side.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 60:
Bible.Verse: 5 Then thou shalt see, and flow together, and thine heart shall fear, and be enlarged; because the abundance of the sea shall be converted unto thee, the forces of the Gentiles shall come unto thee.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 60:
Bible.Verse: 6 The multitude of camels shall cover thee, the dromedaries of Midian and Ephah; all they from Sheba shall come: they shall bring gold and incense; and they shall shew forth the praises of the LORD.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 60:
Bible.Verse: 7 All the flocks of Kedar shall be gathered together unto thee, the rams of Nebaioth shall minister unto thee: they shall come up with acceptance on mine altar, and I will glorify the house of my glory.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 60:
Bible.Verse: 8 Who are these that fly as a cloud, and as the doves to their windows?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 60:
Bible.Verse: 9 Surely the isles shall wait for me, and the ships of Tarshish first, to bring thy sons from far, their silver and their gold with them, unto the name of the LORD thy God, and to the Holy One of Israel, because he hath glorified thee.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 60:
Bible.Verse: 10 And the sons of strangers shall build up thy walls, and their kings shall minister unto thee: for in my wrath I smote thee, but in my favour have I had mercy on thee.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 60:
Bible.Verse: 11 Therefore thy gates shall be open continually; they shall not be shut day nor night; that men may bring unto thee the forces of the Gentiles, and that their kings may be brought.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 60:
Bible.Verse: 12 For the nation and kingdom that will not serve thee shall perish; yea, those nations shall be utterly wasted.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 60:
Bible.Verse: 13 The glory of Lebanon shall come unto thee, the fir tree, the pine tree, and the box together, to beautify the place of my sanctuary; and I will make the place of my feet glorious.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 60:
Bible.Verse: 14 The sons also of them that afflicted thee shall come bending unto thee; and all they that despised thee shall bow themselves down at the soles of thy feet; and they shall call thee, The city of the LORD, The Zion of the Holy One of Israel.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 60:
Bible.Verse: 15 Whereas thou hast been forsaken and hated, so that no man went through thee, I will make thee an eternal excellency, a joy of many generations.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 60:
Bible.Verse: 16 Thou shalt also suck the milk of the Gentiles, and shalt suck the breast of kings: and thou shalt know that I the LORD am thy Saviour and thy Redeemer, the mighty One of Jacob.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 60:
Bible.Verse: 17 For brass I will bring gold, and for iron I will bring silver, and for wood brass, and for stones iron: I will also make thy officers peace, and thine exactors righteousness.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 60:
Bible.Verse: 18 Violence shall no more be heard in thy land, wasting nor destruction within thy borders; but thou shalt call thy walls Salvation, and thy gates Praise.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 60:
Bible.Verse: 19 The sun shall be no more thy light by day; neither for brightness shall the moon give light unto thee: but the LORD shall be unto thee an everlasting light, and thy God thy glory.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 60:
Bible.Verse: 20 Thy sun shall no more go down; neither shall thy moon withdraw itself: for the LORD shall be thine everlasting light, and the days of thy mourning shall be ended.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 60:
Bible.Verse: 21 Thy people also shall be all righteous: they shall inherit the land for ever, the branch of my planting, the work of my hands, that I may be glorified.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 60:
Bible.Verse: 22 A little one shall become a thousand, and a small one a strong nation: I the LORD will hasten it in his time.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 61:
Bible.Verse: 1 The Spirit of the Lord GOD is upon me; because the LORD hath anointed me to preach good tidings unto the meek; he hath sent me to bind up the brokenhearted, to proclaim liberty to the captives, and the opening of the prison to them that are bound;

Bible.Title: Isaiah 61:
Bible.Verse: 2 To proclaim the acceptable year of the LORD, and the day of vengeance of our God; to comfort all that mourn;

Bible.Title: Isaiah 61:
Bible.Verse: 3 To appoint unto them that mourn in Zion, to give unto them beauty for ashes, the oil of joy for mourning, the garment of praise for the spirit of heaviness; that they might be called trees of righteousness, the planting of the LORD, that he might be glorified.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 61:
Bible.Verse: 4 And they shall build the old wastes, they shall raise up the former desolations, and they shall repair the waste cities, the desolations of many generations.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 61:
Bible.Verse: 5 And strangers shall stand and feed your flocks, and the sons of the alien shall be your plowmen and your vinedressers.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 61:
Bible.Verse: 6 But ye shall be named the Priests of the LORD: men shall call you the Ministers of our God: ye shall eat the riches of the Gentiles, and in their glory shall ye boast yourselves.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 61:
Bible.Verse: 7 For your shame ye shall have double; and for confusion they shall rejoice in their portion: therefore in their land they shall possess the double: everlasting joy shall be unto them.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 61:
Bible.Verse: 8 For I the LORD love judgment, I hate robbery for burnt offering; and I will direct their work in truth, and I will make an everlasting covenant with them.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 61:
Bible.Verse: 9 And their seed shall be known among the Gentiles, and their offspring among the people: all that see them shall acknowledge them, that they are the seed which the LORD hath blessed.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 61:
Bible.Verse: 10 I will greatly rejoice in the LORD, my soul shall be joyful in my God; for he hath clothed me with the garments of salvation, he hath covered me with the robe of righteousness, as a bridegroom decketh himself with ornaments, and as a bride adorneth herself with her jewels.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 61:
Bible.Verse: 11 For as the earth bringeth forth her bud, and as the garden causeth the things that are sown in it to spring forth; so the Lord GOD will cause righteousness and praise to spring forth before all the nations.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 62:
Bible.Verse: 1 For Zion's sake will I not hold my peace, and for Jerusalem's sake I will not rest, until the righteousness thereof go forth as brightness, and the salvation thereof as a lamp that burneth.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 62:
Bible.Verse: 2 And the Gentiles shall see thy righteousness, and all kings thy glory: and thou shalt be called by a new name, which the mouth of the LORD shall name.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 62:
Bible.Verse: 3 Thou shalt also be a crown of glory in the hand of the LORD, and a royal diadem in the hand of thy God.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 62:
Bible.Verse: 4 Thou shalt no more be termed Forsaken; neither shall thy land any more be termed Desolate: but thou shalt be called Hephzibah, and thy land Beulah: for the LORD delighteth in thee, and thy land shall be married.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 62:
Bible.Verse: 5 For as a young man marrieth a virgin, so shall thy sons marry thee: and as the bridegroom rejoiceth over the bride, so shall thy God rejoice over thee.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 62:
Bible.Verse: 6 I have set watchmen upon thy walls, O Jerusalem, which shall never hold their peace day nor night: ye that make mention of the LORD, keep not silence,

Bible.Title: Isaiah 62:
Bible.Verse: 7 And give him no rest, till he establish, and till he make Jerusalem a praise in the earth.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 62:
Bible.Verse: 8 The LORD hath sworn by his right hand, and by the arm of his strength, Surely I will no more give thy corn to be meat for thine enemies; and the sons of the stranger shall not drink thy wine, for the which thou hast laboured:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 62:
Bible.Verse: 9 But they that have gathered it shall eat it, and praise the LORD; and they that have brought it together shall drink it in the courts of my holiness.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 62:
Bible.Verse: 10 Go through, go through the gates; prepare ye the way of the people; cast up, cast up the highway; gather out the stones; lift up a standard for the people.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 62:
Bible.Verse: 11 Behold, the LORD hath proclaimed unto the end of the world, Say ye to the daughter of Zion, Behold, thy salvation cometh; behold, his reward is with him, and his work before him.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 62:
Bible.Verse: 12 And they shall call them, The holy people, The redeemed of the LORD: and thou shalt be called, Sought out, A city not forsaken.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 63:
Bible.Verse: 1 Who is this that cometh from Edom, with dyed garments from Bozrah? this that is glorious in his apparel, travelling in the greatness of his strength? I that speak in righteousness, mighty to save.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 63:
Bible.Verse: 2 Wherefore art thou red in thine apparel, and thy garments like him that treadeth in the winefat?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 63:
Bible.Verse: 3 I have trodden the winepress alone; and of the people there was none with me: for I will tread them in mine anger, and trample them in my fury; and their blood shall be sprinkled upon my garments, and I will stain all my raiment.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 63:
Bible.Verse: 4 For the day of vengeance is in mine heart, and the year of my redeemed is come.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 63:
Bible.Verse: 5 And I looked, and there was none to help; and I wondered that there was none to uphold: therefore mine own arm brought salvation unto me; and my fury, it upheld me.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 63:
Bible.Verse: 6 And I will tread down the people in mine anger, and make them drunk in my fury, and I will bring down their strength to the earth.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 63:
Bible.Verse: 7 I will mention the lovingkindnesses of the LORD, and the praises of the LORD, according to all that the LORD hath bestowed on us, and the great goodness toward the house of Israel, which he hath bestowed on them according to his mercies, and according to the multitude of his lovingkindnesses.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 63:
Bible.Verse: 8 For he said, Surely they are my people, children that will not lie: so he was their Saviour.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 63:
Bible.Verse: 9 In all their affliction he was afflicted, and the angel of his presence saved them: in his love and in his pity he redeemed them; and he bare them, and carried them all the days of old.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 63:
Bible.Verse: 10 But they rebelled, and vexed his holy Spirit: therefore he was turned to be their enemy, and he fought against them.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 63:
Bible.Verse: 11 Then he remembered the days of old, Moses, and his people, saying, Where is he that brought them up out of the sea with the shepherd of his flock? where is he that put his holy Spirit within him?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 63:
Bible.Verse: 12 That led them by the right hand of Moses with his glorious arm, dividing the water before them, to make himself an everlasting name?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 63:
Bible.Verse: 13 That led them through the deep, as an horse in the wilderness, that they should not stumble?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 63:
Bible.Verse: 14 As a beast goeth down into the valley, the Spirit of the LORD caused him to rest: so didst thou lead thy people, to make thyself a glorious name.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 63:
Bible.Verse: 15 Look down from heaven, and behold from the habitation of thy holiness and of thy glory: where is thy zeal and thy strength, the sounding of thy bowels and of thy mercies toward me? are they restrained?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 63:
Bible.Verse: 16 Doubtless thou art our father, though Abraham be ignorant of us, and Israel acknowledge us not: thou, O LORD, art our father, our redeemer; thy name is from everlasting.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 63:
Bible.Verse: 17 O LORD, why hast thou made us to err from thy ways, and hardened our heart from thy fear? Return for thy servants' sake, the tribes of thine inheritance.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 63:
Bible.Verse: 18 The people of thy holiness have possessed it but a little while: our adversaries have trodden down thy sanctuary.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 63:
Bible.Verse: 19 We are thine: thou never barest rule over them; they were not called by thy name.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 64:
Bible.Verse: 1 Oh that thou wouldest rend the heavens, that thou wouldest come down, that the mountains might flow down at thy presence,

Bible.Title: Isaiah 64:
Bible.Verse: 2 As when the melting fire burneth, the fire causeth the waters to boil, to make thy name known to thine adversaries, that the nations may tremble at thy presence!

Bible.Title: Isaiah 64:
Bible.Verse: 3 When thou didst terrible things which we looked not for, thou camest down, the mountains flowed down at thy presence.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 64:
Bible.Verse: 4 For since the beginning of the world men have not heard, nor perceived by the ear, neither hath the eye seen, O God, beside thee, what he hath prepared for him that waiteth for him.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 64:
Bible.Verse: 5 Thou meetest him that rejoiceth and worketh righteousness, those that remember thee in thy ways: behold, thou art wroth; for we have sinned: in those is continuance, and we shall be saved.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 64:
Bible.Verse: 6 But we are all as an unclean thing, and all our righteousnesses are as filthy rags; and we all do fade as a leaf; and our iniquities, like the wind, have taken us away.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 64:
Bible.Verse: 7 And there is none that calleth upon thy name, that stirreth up himself to take hold of thee: for thou hast hid thy face from us, and hast consumed us, because of our iniquities.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 64:
Bible.Verse: 8 But now, O LORD, thou art our father; we are the clay, and thou our potter; and we all are the work of thy hand.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 64:
Bible.Verse: 9 Be not wroth very sore, O LORD, neither remember iniquity for ever: behold, see, we beseech thee, we are all thy people.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 64:
Bible.Verse: 10 Thy holy cities are a wilderness, Zion is a wilderness, Jerusalem a desolation.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 64:
Bible.Verse: 11 Our holy and our beautiful house, where our fathers praised thee, is burned up with fire: and all our pleasant things are laid waste.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 64:
Bible.Verse: 12 Wilt thou refrain thyself for these things, O LORD? wilt thou hold thy peace, and afflict us very sore?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 65:
Bible.Verse: 1 I am sought of them that asked not for me; I am found of them that sought me not: I said, Behold me, behold me, unto a nation that was not called by my name.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 65:
Bible.Verse: 2 I have spread out my hands all the day unto a rebellious people, which walketh in a way that was not good, after their own thoughts;

Bible.Title: Isaiah 65:
Bible.Verse: 3 A people that provoketh me to anger continually to my face; that sacrificeth in gardens, and burneth incense upon altars of brick;

Bible.Title: Isaiah 65:
Bible.Verse: 4 Which remain among the graves, and lodge in the monuments, which eat swine's flesh, and broth of abominable things is in their vessels;

Bible.Title: Isaiah 65:
Bible.Verse: 5 Which say, Stand by thyself, come not near to me; for I am holier than thou. These are a smoke in my nose, a fire that burneth all the day.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 65:
Bible.Verse: 6 Behold, it is written before me: I will not keep silence, but will recompense, even recompense into their bosom,

Bible.Title: Isaiah 65:
Bible.Verse: 7 Your iniquities, and the iniquities of your fathers together, saith the LORD, which have burned incense upon the mountains, and blasphemed me upon the hills: therefore will I measure their former work into their bosom.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 65:
Bible.Verse: 8 Thus saith the LORD, As the new wine is found in the cluster, and one saith, Destroy it not; for a blessing is in it: so will I do for my servants' sakes, that I may not destroy them all.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 65:
Bible.Verse: 9 And I will bring forth a seed out of Jacob, and out of Judah an inheritor of my mountains: and mine elect shall inherit it, and my servants shall dwell there.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 65:
Bible.Verse: 10 And Sharon shall be a fold of flocks, and the valley of Achor a place for the herds to lie down in, for my people that have sought me.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 65:
Bible.Verse: 11 But ye are they that forsake the LORD, that forget my holy mountain, that prepare a table for that troop, and that furnish the drink offering unto that number.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 65:
Bible.Verse: 12 Therefore will I number you to the sword, and ye shall all bow down to the slaughter: because when I called, ye did not answer; when I spake, ye did not hear; but did evil before mine eyes, and did choose that wherein I delighted not.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 65:
Bible.Verse: 13 Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD, Behold, my servants shall eat, but ye shall be hungry: behold, my servants shall drink, but ye shall be thirsty: behold, my servants shall rejoice, but ye shall be ashamed:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 65:
Bible.Verse: 14 Behold, my servants shall sing for joy of heart, but ye shall cry for sorrow of heart, and shall howl for vexation of spirit.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 65:
Bible.Verse: 15 And ye shall leave your name for a curse unto my chosen: for the Lord GOD shall slay thee, and call his servants by another name:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 65:
Bible.Verse: 16 That he who blesseth himself in the earth shall bless himself in the God of truth; and he that sweareth in the earth shall swear by the God of truth; because the former troubles are forgotten, and because they are hid from mine eyes.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 65:
Bible.Verse: 17 For, behold, I create new heavens and a new earth: and the former shall not be remembered, nor come into mind.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 65:
Bible.Verse: 18 But be ye glad and rejoice for ever in that which I create: for, behold, I create Jerusalem a rejoicing, and her people a joy.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 65:
Bible.Verse: 19 And I will rejoice in Jerusalem, and joy in my people: and the voice of weeping shall be no more heard in her, nor the voice of crying.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 65:
Bible.Verse: 20 There shall be no more thence an infant of days, nor an old man that hath not filled his days: for the child shall die an hundred years old; but the sinner being an hundred years old shall be accursed.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 65:
Bible.Verse: 21 And they shall build houses, and inhabit them; and they shall plant vineyards, and eat the fruit of them.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 65:
Bible.Verse: 22 They shall not build, and another inhabit; they shall not plant, and another eat: for as the days of a tree are the days of my people, and mine elect shall long enjoy the work of their hands.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 65:
Bible.Verse: 23 They shall not labour in vain, nor bring forth for trouble; for they are the seed of the blessed of the LORD, and their offspring with them.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 65:
Bible.Verse: 24 And it shall come to pass, that before they call, I will answer; and while they are yet speaking, I will hear.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 65:
Bible.Verse: 25 The wolf and the lamb shall feed together, and the lion shall eat straw like the bullock: and dust shall be the serpent's meat. They shall not hurt nor destroy in all my holy mountain, saith the LORD.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 66:
Bible.Verse: 1 Thus saith the LORD, The heaven is my throne, and the earth is my footstool: where is the house that ye build unto me? and where is the place of my rest?

Bible.Title: Isaiah 66:
Bible.Verse: 2 For all those things hath mine hand made, and all those things have been, saith the LORD: but to this man will I look, even to him that is poor and of a contrite spirit, and trembleth at my word.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 66:
Bible.Verse: 3 He that killeth an ox is as if he slew a man; he that sacrificeth a lamb, as if he cut off a dog's neck; he that offereth an oblation, as if he offered swine's blood; he that burneth incense, as if he blessed an idol. Yea, they have chosen their own ways, and their soul delighteth in their abominations.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 66:
Bible.Verse: 4 I also will choose their delusions, and will bring their fears upon them; because when I called, none did answer; when I spake, they did not hear: but they did evil before mine eyes, and chose that in which I delighted not.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 66:
Bible.Verse: 5 Hear the word of the LORD, ye that tremble at his word; Your brethren that hated you, that cast you out for my name's sake, said, Let the LORD be glorified: but he shall appear to your joy, and they shall be ashamed.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 66:
Bible.Verse: 6 A voice of noise from the city, a voice from the temple, a voice of the LORD that rendereth recompence to his enemies.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 66:
Bible.Verse: 7 Before she travailed, she brought forth; before her pain came, she was delivered of a man child.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 66:
Bible.Verse: 8 Who hath heard such a thing? who hath seen such things? Shall the earth be made to bring forth in one day? or shall a nation be born at once? for as soon as Zion travailed, she brought forth her children.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 66:
Bible.Verse: 9 Shall I bring to the birth, and not cause to bring forth? saith the LORD: shall I cause to bring forth, and shut the womb? saith thy God.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 66:
Bible.Verse: 10 Rejoice ye with Jerusalem, and be glad with her, all ye that love her: rejoice for joy with her, all ye that mourn for her:

Bible.Title: Isaiah 66:
Bible.Verse: 11 That ye may suck, and be satisfied with the breasts of her consolations; that ye may milk out, and be delighted with the abundance of her glory.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 66:
Bible.Verse: 12 For thus saith the LORD, Behold, I will extend peace to her like a river, and the glory of the Gentiles like a flowing stream: then shall ye suck, ye shall be borne upon her sides, and be dandled upon her knees.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 66:
Bible.Verse: 13 As one whom his mother comforteth, so will I comfort you; and ye shall be comforted in Jerusalem.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 66:
Bible.Verse: 14 And when ye see this, your heart shall rejoice, and your bones shall flourish like an herb: and the hand of the LORD shall be known toward his servants, and his indignation toward his enemies.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 66:
Bible.Verse: 15 For, behold, the LORD will come with fire, and with his chariots like a whirlwind, to render his anger with fury, and his rebuke with flames of fire.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 66:
Bible.Verse: 16 For by fire and by his sword will the LORD plead with all flesh: and the slain of the LORD shall be many.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 66:
Bible.Verse: 17 They that sanctify themselves, and purify themselves in the gardens behind one tree in the midst, eating swine's flesh, and the abomination, and the mouse, shall be consumed together, saith the LORD.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 66:
Bible.Verse: 18 For I know their works and their thoughts: it shall come, that I will gather all nations and tongues; and they shall come, and see my glory.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 66:
Bible.Verse: 19 And I will set a sign among them, and I will send those that escape of them unto the nations, to Tarshish, Pul, and Lud, that draw the bow, to Tubal, and Javan, to the isles afar off, that have not heard my fame, neither have seen my glory; and they shall declare my glory among the Gentiles.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 66:
Bible.Verse: 20 And they shall bring all your brethren for an offering unto the LORD out of all nations upon horses, and in chariots, and in litters, and upon mules, and upon swift beasts, to my holy mountain Jerusalem, saith the LORD, as the children of Israel bring an offering in a clean vessel into the house of the LORD.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 66:
Bible.Verse: 21 And I will also take of them for priests and for Levites, saith the LORD.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 66:
Bible.Verse: 22 For as the new heavens and the new earth, which I will make, shall remain before me, saith the LORD, so shall your seed and your name remain.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 66:
Bible.Verse: 23 And it shall come to pass, that from one new moon to another, and from one sabbath to another, shall all flesh come to worship before me, saith the LORD.

Bible.Title: Isaiah 66:
Bible.Verse: 24 And they shall go forth, and look upon the carcases of the men that have transgressed against me: for their worm shall not die, neither shall their fire be quenched; and they shall be an abhorring unto all flesh.
